asr: 我周公，作周礼。著六官，存治体。大小戴，注礼记。述圣言，礼乐备。曰国风，曰雅颂。号四诗，当讽咏。诗既亡，春秋作。寓褒贬，别善恶。三传者，有公羊。
s2tt:
Duke of Zhou, the Rites he made,
Six posts of state, in order laid.
Two Dais, the Book of Rites they note,
Sage words preserved, with music wrote.
The Airs, the Odes, the Hymns we sing,
Four classic songs, their praises ring.
When odes declined, Spring-Autumn rose,
Praise and blame in its lines it shows.
Three commentaries there appear,
Among them Gongyang stands clear.
s2tt_r:
原文：
我周公，作周礼，著六官，存治体。大小戴，注礼记，述圣言，礼乐备。曰国风，曰雅颂，好诗诗，当讽咏。诗既亡，春秋作，寓褒贬，别善恶。三传者，有公羊。

译文：
I, Duke of Zhou, created the Zhou Ritual, established six official positions, and preserved the system of governance.大小戴,注礼记,述圣言,礼乐备。曰国风，曰雅颂，好诗诗，当讽咏。诗既亡，春秋作，寓褒贬，别善恶。三传者，有公羊。
大小戴,注礼记,述圣言,礼乐备。曰国风，曰雅颂，好诗诗，当讽咏。诗既亡，春秋作，寓褒贬，别善恶。三传者，有公羊。

asr: 有左氏，有谷梁。经既明，方读子。撮其要，记其事。五子者，有荀扬。文中子，及老庄。经子通，读诸史。考世系，知终始。自羲农，至黄帝。号三皇，居上世。
s2tt: There are the Zuo Commentary and the Guliang Commentary. When the Classics are understood, then the writings of the various philosophers should be read. Pick out the important points in each, and take a note of all facts. The five chief philosophers are Xun, Yang, Wen Zhongzi, Laozi, and Zhuangzi. When the Classics and the Philosophers are mastered, the various histories should then be read, and the genealogical connections should be examined, so that the end of one dynasty and the beginning of the next may be known. From Fu Xi and Shen Nong on to the Yellow Emperor, these are called the Three Rulers, who lived in the early ages.
s2tt_r:
游佐事，有古梁。
荆棘名，方独子。
挫其药，济其事。
无子者，有寻阳。
文中子，及老庄。
经子通，读诸史。
考试器，知中史。
自羲农，至黄帝，号三皇，居上世。

译文：
Ancient affairs, in the old land,
Jing and Jie, the solitary sons.
Grind their herbs, to aid their cause,
Without offspring, they seek Xunyang.
Wen Zhongzi, and Laozi, Zhuangzi,
The classics are read, through history.
Examinations, to know the middle history.
From the time of the Yellow Emperor, known as the Three Emperors, they lived in the ancient world.

asr: 唐有虞，号二帝。相揖逊，称盛世。夏有禹，商有汤。周文武，称三王。夏传子，家天下。四百载，迁夏社。汤伐夏，国号商。六百载，至纣亡。周武王，始诛纣。
s2tt: In the Tang and Yu dynasties, there were two emperors. They abdicated the throne to each other, known as the Golden Age. In the Xia dynasty, there was Yu; in the Shang dynasty, there was Tang. King Wen and King Wu of the Zhou dynasty were known as the Three Sage Kings. The Xia dynasty passed the throne to sons, making the state a family possession. After four hundred years, the Xia dynasty fell. Tang overthrew the Xia dynasty and established the Shang dynasty. After six hundred years, it ended with the death of King Zhou. King Wu of Zhou finally executed King Zhou.
s2tt_r:
原文：
唐有虞，号二帝，相揖逊，称盛世。
夏有禹，商有汤，周文武，称三王。
夏传子，家天下，四百载，天下涉。
汤伐夏，国号商，六百载，至纣亡。
周武王，始诛纣。

译文：
In the Tang, there was Yu, known as the Second Emperor, who揖逊相让，称盛世。
In the Xia, there was Yu, and in the Shang, there was Tang, while Zhou's Wen and Wu were called the Three Kings.
The Xia passed the throne to their sons, making the family rule the world, for four hundred years, the world was in turmoil.
Tang overthrew the Xia, and the country was named Shang, lasting six hundred years until the fall of the Zhou.
Zhou's Wu began to punish the Zhou.

asr: 八百载，最长久。周辙东，王纲坠。逞干戈，尚游说。始春秋，终战国。五霸强，七雄出。嬴秦氏，始兼并。传二世，楚汉争。高祖兴，汉业建。至孝平，王莽篡。
s2tt:
Eight hundred years, the longest reign.
Eastward the Zhou court moved, its power waned.
War raged, while orators their arts maintained.
Spring and Autumn began, Warring States closed.
Five Hegemons rose, seven States opposed.
Then Qin, by Ying, all lands annexed.
Two reigns passed, Chu and Han clashed next.
Gaozu rose, the Han's rule set.
To Xiaoping's end, Wang Mang's coup met.
s2tt_r:
八百载最长久，周辙东，王纲坠。
惩干戈尚游说，始春秋，终战国。
五霸强，七雄出，嬴秦氏，始兼并。
传二世，楚汉争，高祖兴，汉业建。
至孝平，王莽篡。

译文：
Eight hundred years of the longest, Zhou's path to the east, the king's rule falls.
Punishing the sword and still persuading, begins the Spring and Autumn, ends the Warring States.
Five hegemonies strong, seven heroes emerge, the Qin family, begins the annexation.
Transmitted to the second generation, the Chu-Han struggle, Gaozu rises, the Han dynasty is established.
Until the reign of Emperor Ai, Wang Mang usurps.

asr: 光武兴，为东汉。四百年，终于献。魏蜀吴，争汉鼎。号三国，迄两晋。宋齐继，梁陈承。为南朝，都金陵。北元魏，分东西。宇文周，与高齐。迨至隋，一土宇。
s2tt: Guangwu arose, and founded the Eastern Han. Four hundred years, and ended with Xian. Wei, Shu, and Wu, fought for the Han throne. Called the Three Kingdoms, until the Two Jins. Song and Qi succeeded, Liang and Chen inherited. Known as the Southern Dynasties, capital at Jinling. In the north, Yuan Wei, split into Eastern and Western. Yuwen Zhou, and Gao Qi. Until the Sui, unified the land.
s2tt_r:
光武兴，为东汉，四百年，终于献。魏蜀吴，争汉鼎，号三国，迄两晋。宋齐继，梁陈承，为南朝，都金陵。北元魏，分东西，周宇文，与高齐，代至隋，一土宇。
译文：
Emperor Guangwu rises, founding the Eastern Han, lasting four hundred years until Emperor Xian. Wei, Shu, and Wu compete for the Han throne, known as the Three Kingdoms, ending with the Jin Dynasty. Song, Qi, Liang, and Chen succeed, forming the Southern Dynasties, with their capital in Jianling. Northern Wei divides into East and West, followed by Zhou, Yuwen, and Gao Qi, leading to the Sui Dynasty, unifying under one rule.

asr: 不再传，失统绪。唐高祖，起义师。除隋乱，创国基。二十传，三百载。梁灭之，国乃改。梁唐晋，及汉周。称五代，皆有由。炎宋兴，受周禅。十八传，南北混。
s2tt:
Succession no longer passed on, the continuity lost.
Tang Gaozu raised an insurgent army.
He ended the Sui chaos and laid the nation's foundation.
Twenty reigns, three hundred years.
Liang destroyed it, and the realm was changed.
Liang, Tang, Jin, Han, and Zhou —
Called the Five Dynasties, each with its cause.
The illustrious Song rose, receiving Zhou's abdication.
Eighteen reigns, north and south intertwined.
s2tt_r:
不在传诗统序，唐高祖起义师，除隋乱，创国基。二十传三百载，梁灭之，国乃改。梁、唐、晋、齐、汉、周，称五代，皆有由。炎、宋兴，受周禅，十八传，南北混。
译文：
Not in the transmission of poetic tradition, Emperor Gaozu of Tang led an uprising army, removing the chaos of the Sui dynasty and establishing the foundation of the country. Twenty dynasties lasted for three hundred years, until the fall of the Liang dynasty, the state changed. The Liang, Tang, Jin, Qi, Han, and Zhou dynasties, collectively known as the Five Dynasties, each had their origins. The Yan and Song dynasties rose, receiving the Zhou dynasty's legacy, and eighteen dynasties followed, leading to the mingling of the north and south.

asr: 辽与金，皆称帝。元灭金，绝宋世。舆图广，超前代。九十年，国祚废。太祖兴，国大明。号洪武，都金陵。迨成祖，迁燕京。十六世，至崇祯。权阉肆，寇如林。
s2tt:
Liao and Jin, both claimed the throne.
Yuan o'erthrew Jin, ended Song's reign.
Lands vast and wide, past ages outshone.
Ninety years passed, the rule did wane.
Taizu rose, Ming's glory shone.
Hongwu named, in Jinling's domain.
Chengzu came, to Yanjing he'd go.
Sixteen reigns, to Chongzhen's woe.
Eunuchs' power, like forests foes grow.
s2tt_r:
辽与金，皆称帝，元灭金，绝宋世。
余图广，超前代，九十年，祖祚废。
太祖兴，国大明，号洪武，都金陵。
代成祖，迁燕京，十六世，至崇祯。
权阉肆，寇如林。

asr: 李闯出，神器焚。清世祖，膺景命。靖四方，克大定。由康雍，历乾嘉。民安富，治绩夸。道咸间，变乱起。始英法，扰都鄙。同光后，宣统弱。传九帝，满清殁。
s2tt: Li Chuang emerged, the divine vessel burned. The Qing Shizu, bearing the mandate of heaven. Pacified the four directions, achieved great stability. From Kangxi to Yongzheng, through Qianlong to Jiaqing. The people were peaceful and prosperous, governance achievements praised. During the Daoguang and Xianfeng periods, turmoil arose. Beginning with Britain and France, disturbing the capital and countryside. After Tongzhi and Guangxu, Xuantong was weak. Nine emperors passed, the Qing Dynasty fell.
s2tt_r:
离闯出神器焚，清室祖。英景命，靖四方，克大定。由康雍，历乾嘉，民安富，志既夸。道咸间，变乱起，始英法，扰都鄙。同光后，宣统弱，传九帝，满清末。

译文：
Leaving the imperial city in flames,
The Qing dynasty's ancestors.
Under the rule of the British and the French,
The四方are pacified, and the great city is conquered.
From the Kangxi and Yongzheng eras,
To the Qianlong and Jiaqing eras,
The people are prosperous and the志are great.
During the Daoguang and Xianfeng eras,
Changes and chaos arise,
Beginning with the British and French,
Disturbing the capital and the border.
After the Tongzhi and Guangxu eras,
The Xuantong is weak,
Passing on nine emperors,
The end of the Qing dynasty.

asr: 革命兴，废帝制。立宪法，建民国。古今史，全在兹。载治乱，知兴衰。史虽繁，读有次。史记一，汉书二。后汉三，国志四。兼证经，参通鉴。读史者，考实录。
s2tt:
Revolution thrives, the empire dies;
The Constitution and Republic rise.
All history, past and present, lies
In records of order and decline.
Though histories vast, in order read:
First Records, then Han, then Later Han's deed,
Three Kingdoms next, with Classics' creed,
And Mirror's light, where truth we heed.
s2tt_r:
革命兴，废帝制，立宪法，建民国，古今史，权在兹。载治乱，知兴衰，史虽繁，独有次。史记一，汉书二，后汉三，国志四，兼正经，参通鉴，读史者，考史录。

译文：
Revolution rises, abolishing imperial rule, establishing a constitution, founding a republic, ancient and modern history, power lies herein. Records of governance and chaos, understanding rise and fall, though history is vast, it has its order. Records of the Grand Historian first, Book of Han second, Book of the Later Han third, Records of the Three Kingdoms fourth, combining classics, consulting the Comprehensive Mirror to Aid in Government, those who read history, examine historical records.

asr: 通古今，若亲目。口而诵，心而惟。朝于斯，夕于斯。昔仲尼，师项橐。古圣贤，尚勤学。赵中令，读鲁论。彼既仕，学且勤。披蒲编，削竹简。彼无书，且知勉。
s2tt:
Through times old and new, as if seen firsthand,
With mouth recite, with heart understand.
At dawn on this, at dusk on this, stay.
Confucius once learned from Xiang Tuo, they say.
Ancient sages still studied with zeal.
Zhao, the minister, read Lu's Analects real.
Though in office high, he studied with might.
On rushes he wrote, bamboo slips he'd write.
Without books at hand, he strove for the light.
s2tt_r:
通古今若亲目，口而诵，心而惟。
朝与夕，夕与朝，夕重拟，师相妥。
古圣贤，尚勤学，赵中令，读鲁论。
笔既释，学且勤，披蒲编，削竹简。
彼无书，且知勉。

译文：
Through ancient and modern times as if with eyes of flesh,
Mouths recite, hearts ponder.
Morning and evening, evening and morning,
Evening reiterates, teacher is at ease.
Ancient sages, cherish diligent study,
Zhao Zhongling, reads the Book of Rites.
Pen released, study is diligent,
Papyrus is cut, bamboo is削ed.
Without books, yet know to strive.

asr: 头悬梁，锥刺股。彼不教，自勤苦。如囊萤，如映雪。家虽贫，学不辍。如负薪，如挂角。身虽劳，犹苦卓。苏老泉，二十七。始发愤，读书籍。彼既老，犹悔迟。
s2tt:
Head hung from beam, awl pricks the thigh,
No teacher's word, self-drive runs high.
Like fireflies caught, like snow's pale light,
Though poor at home, they study night.
With firewood borne, on horns books rest,
Though toil is deep, they strive their best.
Su Lao-quan, at twenty-seven,
Began to read, with will as heaven.
Though old he grew, regret ran deep.
s2tt_r:
原文：
头悬梁，锥刺股，彼不教，自勤苦。
如囊萤，如映雪，家虽贫，学不辍。
如负薪，如挂角，身虽劳，犹苦卓。
苏老泉，二十七，始发愤，读书籍。
彼既老，犹悔迟。

译文：
Hanging hair from beam, pricking skin with awl,
Without teaching, they study hard on their own.
Like囊萤, like映雪, though poor, they never stop.
Like负薪, like挂角, though tired, they still strive.
Su Laoquan, at twenty-seven, begins to study with vigor.
Though old, they regret not starting earlier.

asr: 尔小生，宜早思。若梁灏，八十二。对大廷，魁多士。彼既成，众称异。尔小生，宜立志。莹八岁，能咏诗。泌七岁，能赋棋。彼颖悟，人称奇。尔幼学，当效之。
s2tt:
Young souls, think early, think aright.
Like Liang Hao, at eighty-two,
He faced the court, the laurels knew.
His triumph won, all praised the sight.
Young souls, set goals with all your might.

At eight, Ying could recite with grace;
At seven, Mi chess rhymes could trace.
Their brilliance earned the world's surprise.
Young learners, follow their wise ways.
s2tt_r:
原文：
而小生乙藻思，若梁灏，二十八对大廷魁多士，彼既成众称异。而小生乙立志，赢八岁能咏诗，觅七岁能赋棋，彼咏物人称其，而幼学当效之。

译文：
And the young scholar, like Liang Hao, excelled at the age of twenty-eight, winning the favor of many scholars in the court. His achievements were remarkable, and he was widely praised. The young scholar, however, was determined, excelling in poetry at the age of eight and in chess composition at seven. His poetry was admired, and young learners should emulate him.

asr: 蔡文姬，能辨琴。谢道韫，能咏吟。彼女子，且聪敏。尔男子，当自警。唐刘晏，方七岁。举神童，作正字。晏虽幼，身已仕。有为者，亦若是。犬守夜，鸡司晨。
s2tt:
Cai Wenji, knew the lyre's tone;  
Xie Daoyun, could chant alone.  
These maidens, wise and bright,  
Should make men heed their light.  
Liu Yan of Tang, at seven years,  
A child prodigy appears.  
Appointed to the royal post,  
Though young, he served with utmost boast.  
Who strives with heart and soul,  
May reach a similar goal.  
The dog guards night with keenest sight;  
The cock heralds dawn's early light.
s2tt_r:
原文：
蔡文姬能辨琴，谢道韫能咏吟，彼女子且聪明，而男子当自警。唐刘晏方七岁，举神童，作正字。晏虽幼，身已试，有为者亦若是。权守业，积私臣。

译文：
Cai Wenji can distinguish the zither, Xie Daoyun can recite, those women are already wise, and men should be cautious. Tang Liu Yan was only seven years old, was named a child prodigy, and wrote a correct character. Although Yan was young, he had already tried, and those who achieve success are also like this. Power inherits the business, accumulating private ministers.

asr: 苟不学，曷为人。蚕吐丝，蜂酿蜜。人不学，不如物。幼而学，壮而行。上致君，下泽民。扬名声，显父母。光于前，裕于后。人遗子，金满赢。我教子，唯一经。
s2tt:
If one learns not, how can one be?
Silkworms spin silk, bees make honey sweet.
Without learning, man is less than these.
Learn when young, practice when complete.
Serve the sovereign, benefit the folk.
Make parents proud, let ancestors shine.
Prosper descendants, future invoke.
Some leave their sons gold hoards in line.
I teach my sons this classic lore,
And nothing more.
s2tt_r:
原文：
苟不学，何为人？
蚕吐丝，蜂酿蜜。
人不学，不如物。
幼而学，壮而行。
上致君，下泽民。
扬名声，显父母。
光于前，裕于后。
人以子，金满盈。
我教子，唯一经。

译文：
If one does not learn, what is a person?
A silkworm spins silk, a bee makes honey.
Without learning, one is not as good as an animal.
Learn when young, act when strong.
Serve the ruler above, benefit the people below.
Fame spreads, parents are honored.
Shine before, illuminate after.
With a child, wealth overflows like gold.
I teach my child, only the classics.

asr: 海上生明月，天涯共此时。情人怨遥夜，竟夕起相思。灭烛怜光满，披衣觉露滋。不堪盈手赠，还寝梦佳期。
s2tt_r:
原文：
海上生明月，
天涯共此时。
情人怨遥夜，
竟夕起相思。
灭烛怜光满，
披衣觉露滋。
不堪盈手赠，
还寝梦佳期。

译文：
On the sea, the bright moon rises,
Across the horizon, we share this moment.
Lovers lament the distant night,
All night, their thoughts rise in longing.
Extinguish the candle, cherish the full light,
In the morning, feel the dew's touch.
Unable to offer it all, they return to sleep,
Dreaming of a better time.

asr: 暮云收尽溢清寒，银汉无声转玉盘。此生此夜不长好，明月明年何处看。
s2tt:
Evening clouds withdrawn, pure cold air floods the sky;
The River of Stars mute, a jade plate turns on high.
How oft can we enjoy a fine mid-autumn night?
Where shall we view next year a silver moon so bright?
s2tt_r:
原文：
暮云收尽溢清寒，
银汉无声转玉盘。
此生此夜不长好，
明月明年何处看。

译文：
Evening clouds retreat, pouring clear chill,
Silent Milky Way, a jade plate it fills.
This life, this night, so short and fair,
Where will the moon be seen next year?

asr: 中和癸卯春三月，洛阳城外花如雪。东西南北路人绝，绿杨悄悄香尘灭。路旁忽见如花人，独向绿杨阴下歇。凤侧鸾欹鬓脚斜，红攒黛敛眉心折。借问女郎何处来，含颦欲语声先咽。
s2tt:
In the third moon of the year Guimao,  
Outside Luoyang, flowers fall like snow.  
No travelers are seen east, west, south, or north,  
Green willows silent, fragrant dust laid low.  

By the roadside, a maiden fair appears,  
Resting alone beneath the willow's shade.  
Her hair disheveled, tilted like a phoenix's plume,  
Her brows knit tight, her rosy cheeks dismayed.  

I ask the maiden, "From where do you come?"  
She tries to speak, but tears her voice betray.
s2tt_r:
中和癸卯春三月，洛阳城外花如雪。
东西南北路人绝，绿杨悄悄香尘灭。
路旁忽见如花人，独向绿杨阴下歇。
风侧鸾栖鬓角斜，红攒黛敛眉心折。
借问女郎何处来，含颦欲语声先咽。

译文：
In the third month of the year癸卯， the flowers in Luoyang City are like snow.
People are absent from all directions, and the green willows are quiet, the fragrance fades.
Suddenly, a beautiful person is seen by the roadside, resting under the green willow shade.
The wind blows, and the bird perches on the side, its feathers slightly askew.
Red and black gather, the brow is bent.
Asking where the girl comes from, she wants to speak but her voice is already choked.

asr: 火迸金星上九天，十二官街烟烘烔。日轮西下寒光白，上帝无言空脉脉。阴云晕气若重围，宦者流星如血色。紫气潜随帝座移，妖光暗射台星拆。家家流血如泉沸，处处冤声声动地。
s2tt_r:
原文：
火迸金星上九天，
十二关阶烟汞铜。
日轮西下寒光白，
上帝无言空漠漠。
阴云运气若重围，
幻者流星如血色。
紫气潜随地作仪，
腰光暗射苔心拆。
家家流血如泉沸，
处处原声生动地。

译文：
Fire bursts, golden stars ascend high,
Twelve steps of smoke and mercury shine.
The sun sets, cold light spreads wide,
Heaven speaks not, vast silence reigns.
Dark clouds move like a heavy siege,
Illusionists' meteors glow with blood.
Purple aura follows, earth's display,
Belt's light secretly splits moss.
Households bleed like springs boil,
Everywhere, sounds stir the ground.

asr: 舞伎歌姬尽暗捐，婴儿稚女皆生弃。东邻有女眉新画，倾国倾城不知价。长戈拥得上戎车，回首香闺泪盈把。旋抽金线学缝旗，才上雕鞍教走马。有时马上见良人，不敢回眸空泪下。
s2tt:
Singers and dancers all cast aside,
Babies and children left to die.
The neighbor's daughter, with painted brow,
Of peerless beauty, none knows how.
Forced onto chariots, spears around,
She looks back, tears her silk gown drown.
She learns to stitch banners with golden thread,
To ride carved saddles, by soldiers led.
At times she sees her love on the way,
But dares not gaze, tears fall in dismay.
s2tt_r:
原文：
舞妓歌姬近案捐，莺儿掷女皆生气。
东邻有女眉心画，倾国倾城不知价。
长歌拥得上戎车，回首乡归泪盈把。
悬抽金线学缝旗，裁上雕鞍骄走马。
有时马上见良人，不敢回眸空泪下。

译文：
Dancers and singers near the table,
Larks and girls all full of spirit.
A girl from the east with painted eyebrows,
A beauty so great, her worth is hard to estimate.
Singing long, she boards the chariot,
Looking back, tears fill her hands.
Hanging golden thread to learn to sew flags,
Cutting fabric for a proud horse's saddle.
Sometimes seeing her beloved on horseback,
She dares not look back, tears fall in vain.

asr: 西邻有女真仙子，一寸横波剪秋水。妆成只对镜中春，年幼不知门外事。一夫跳跃上金阶，斜袒半肩欲相耻。牵衣不肯出朱门，红粉香脂刀下死。南邻有女不记姓，昨日良媒新纳聘。
s2tt:
West neighbor's daughter, a fairy true,
An inch of rippling eyes, autumn waters she drew.
Adorned, she faces spring in the mirror's gleam,
Young, unaware of the world beyond her dream.
A man leaps onto the golden stair,
Baring half a shoulder, intent to ensnare.
She clings to her robe, won't leave the crimson door,
In red powder and scent, 'neath the blade she's no more.
South neighbor's daughter, her name unknown,
Yesterday, a matchmaker's pledge was newly shown.
s2tt_r:
西邻有女真仙子，一寸横波剪秋水。妆成只对镜中春，年幼不知门外事。一夫跳跃上金阶，斜袒半肩欲相持。牵衣不肯出朱门，红粉香脂刀下死。南邻有女不记姓，昨日良媒新纳聘。
译文：
A maiden from the west, a celestial grace,
Her eyes like autumn's gentlest gaze.
Adorned, she faces her own reflection,
Unaware of the world beyond the gate.
A man leaps up the golden steps,
Half-dressed, he seeks her embrace.
He pulls her back, she won't leave the gate,
Her beauty, her life, in a bloody fate.
A maiden from the south, her name unknown,
Received by a matchmaker, newly wed.

asr: 琉璃阶上不闻行，翡翠帘间空见影。忽看庭际刀刃鸣，身首支离在俄顷。仰天掩面哭一声，女弟女兄同入井。北邻少妇行相促，旋拆云鬟拭眉绿。已闻击托坏高门，不觉攀缘上重屋。
s2tt_r:
琉璃街上不闻行，翡翠帘间空见影。
呼看庭际刀刃明，伸手持犁在俄顷。
仰天掩面哭一声，女弟女兄同入井。
北邻少妇行相促，悬钗云环饰眉绿。
以文寄托坏高门，不觉攀缘上重屋。

译文：
On the glassy street, no footsteps heard,
In the emerald curtains, shadows are stirred.
A cry for help, the blade's gleam in sight,
A hand grasps the plow, a moment's flight.
Lifting eyes, a cry ascends to the sky,
Daughters and sisters, into the well they fly.
A neighbor's wife, in haste, she's led,
Pearls and rings, adorning her head.
With words, she seeks to bring down the high,
Unaware, she climbs the towering sky.

asr: 须臾四面火光来，欲下回梯梯又摧。烟中大叫犹求救，梁上悬尸已作灰。妾身幸得全刀锯，不敢踟蹰久回顾。旋梳蝉鬓逐军行，强展蛾眉出门去。旧里从兹不得归，六亲自此无寻处。
s2tt:
In a flash, flames from all sides rise high,
To flee, the stairs crumble, no way to fly.
Through smoke, desperate cries for aid resound,
On beams, charred corpses hang, to ash are bound.
By luck, I escape the blade's cruel might,
Not daring to linger, nor turn in fright.
I comb my hair, follow the army's flow,
Force a faint smile, and out the door I go.
My homeland lost, no return to be found,
Kin and friends vanish, without a trace or sound.
s2tt_r:
须臾四面火光来，欲下楼梯梯又摧。
阴中大叫犹求救，梁上悬尸已作灰。
妾身幸得全刀锯，不敢迟出久回顾。
悬舒缠鬓逐君行，强战峨眉出门去。
旧里从兹不得归，六亲自此无寻处。

译文：
In an instant, flames engulfed from all sides,
As I tried to descend the stairs, they crumbled.
In the shadows, cries for help still rang,
While the body hung, a charred frame.
I was fortunate to escape the blade,
Daring not linger, my gaze never to return.
My hair, bound in a loose braid,
Follows you, brave warrior, as I fight.
With strength, I battle the峨眉,
And venture out, my heart in turmoil.
From now on, I cannot return to my old home,
My family, forever lost to my sight.

asr: 柏台多半是狐精，兰省诸郎皆鼠魅。还将短发戴华簪，不脱朝衣缠绣被。翻持象笏作三公，倒佩金鱼为两史。朝闻奏对入朝堂，暮见喧呼来酒市。一朝五鼓人惊起，叫啸喧呼如窃语。
s2tt:
In cypress courts the fox-spirits hold sway;
In orchid halls the rat-demons display.
With sparse hair crowned by jeweled pins they're seen,
In court robes wrapped, on broidered quilts they lean.
They wield ivory tablets as lords high,
And wear gold fish reversed as chiefs awry.
At dawn they bow in court with grave report,
At dusk they shout in wineshops, drunk and sport.
When fifth watch drums startle them from their dream,
They scream and yell as in a secret scheme.
s2tt_r:
原文：
百台多伴侍胡惊，懒省诸郎皆鼠魅。
还将短发戴华簪，不脱朝衣缠绣被。
翻持象笏作三公，倒佩金鱼为梁史。
朝闻奏对入朝堂，暮见悬呼来酒市。
一朝无故人惊起，叫嚣喧呼入如窃语。

译文：
A hundred platforms伴侍胡惊，懒省诸郎皆鼠魅。
还将短发戴华簪，不脱朝衣缠绣被。
翻持象笏作三公，倒佩金鱼为梁史。
朝闻奏对入朝堂，暮见悬呼来酒市。
一朝无故人惊起，叫嚣喧呼入如窃语。

asr: 大彭小彭相顾忧，二郎四郎抱鞍泣。沉沉数日无消息，必谓军前已衔璧。簸旗掉剑却来归，又道官军悉败绩。四面从兹多厄束，一斗黄金一斗粟。尚让厨中食木皮，黄巢机上刲人肉。
s2tt:
The Pengs, old and young, in fear gaze at each other;
The second and fourth sons weep, their saddles in clutch.
For days no news comes, a silence hard to breach,
They fear the army's defeat, a bitter speech.
Yet back they come, with banners torn and swords sheathed,
Only to tell of the government's forces bequeathed.
From all sides now, troubles and constraints arise,
A peck of gold for a peck of grain, the price.
In Shang Rang's kitchen, tree bark is the meal,
On Huang Chao's table, human flesh they peel.
s2tt_r:
原文：
大鹏小鹏相顾忧，二郎四郎报安气。沉沉数日无消息，必谓君前已贤毕。跛骑调剑却来归，又道官军披败绩。四面从兹多恶树，一斗黄金一斗粟。上让厨中食木皮，黄巢机上窥人肉。

译文：
Great鹏 and small鹏 look at each other with worry,
Two郎 and four郎 report peace.
For days there's no news, I must think you've finished your mission.
The lame horse returns with a sword, saying the army has been defeated.
From now on, there are many bad trees around,
One dou of gold and one dou of grain.
The kitchen is left with only bark to eat,
The yellow nest spies on human flesh.

asr: 含元殿上狐兔行，花萼楼前荆棘满。昔时繁盛皆埋没，举目凄凉无故物。内库烧为锦绣灰，天街踏尽公卿骨！来时晓出城东陌，城外风烟如塞色。路旁时见游奕军，坡下寂无迎送客。
s2tt_r:
原文：
坛院殿上狐兔行，花萼楼前荆棘满。
昔时繁盛皆埋没，举目凄凉无故物。
内库稍为锦绣辉，天阶踏尽公卿骨。
来时小出城东陌，城外风烟如塞色。
路旁时见游奕军，坡下既无迎送客。

译文：
Foxes and rabbits roam the temple courtyard,
Jungles of thorns fill the flower-blossom hall.
Once-glorious times are now buried,
All that remains is desolation and decay.
The inner treasury glows with silk and brocade,
The steps of heaven tread upon the bones of nobles.
When I came, I walked the eastern path,
Outside the city, the wind and smoke resemble a frontier.
Along the roadside, I see soldiers at ease,
On the slope, no one greets or sees me off.

asr: 霸陵东望人烟绝，树锁骊山金翠灭。大道俱成棘子林，行人夜宿墙匡月。明朝晓至三峰路，百万人家无一户。破落田园但有蒿，摧残竹树皆无主。路旁试问金天神，金天无语愁于人。
s2tt:
From Baling eastward no sign of smoke remains;
Trees clasp Mount Li, its gilded green extinguished.
The great road has all become a briarwood,
Travelers sleep at night beside the wall beneath the moon.
At dawn they reach the road to the Three Peaks,
A hundred thousand households—there is not a single home.
Ruined fields and gardens yield only mugwort,
Bruised bamboo and trees stand all without an owner.
I asked the roadside god of Golden Heaven,
He made no answer, sorrowing for humankind.
s2tt_r:
原文：
霸陵东望人烟绝，
数锁骊山金翠灭。
大道俱成棘子树，
行人夜宿墙匡月。
明朝晓至三峰路，
百万人家无一户。
破落田园但有蒿，
摧残竹树皆无主。
路旁试问今天神，
今天无雨愁雨人。

译文：
Looking east to the霸陵 no trace of life,
The golden and green of the骊山 are now gone.
The great roads are overgrown with thorny trees,
Travelers rest at night under the wall moon.
Tomorrow morning on the path to the three peaks,
Not a single house among a million.
The ruined fields are only overgrown with weeds,
The broken bamboos and trees are all abandoned.
By the roadside I ask the god of the day,
Why is there no rain to trouble the people today?

asr: 庙前古柏有残枿，殿上金炉生暗尘。一从狂寇陷中国，天地晦冥风雨黑。案前神水咒不成，壁上阴兵驱不得。闲日徒歆奠飨恩，危时不助神通力。我今愧恧拙为神，且向山中深避匿。
s2tt_r:
庙前古柏有残孽，殿上金炉生暗尘。
译文：Ancient cypresses in front of the temple bear the remnants of past calamities, while the golden incense burner in the hall is covered with dust.

asr: 寰中箫管不曾闻，筵上牺牲无处觅。旋教魇鬼傍乡村，诛剥生灵过朝夕。妾闻此语愁更愁，天遣时灾非自由。神在山中犹避难，何须责望东诸侯！前年又出杨震关，举头云际见荆山。
s2tt:
Throughout the realm the flutes and pipes are never heard;
at the banquet no sacrificial beasts are to be found.
Soon nightmare-demons hover round the villages,
slaughtering and plundering the living from dawn to dusk.
I hear these words and my sorrow deepens;
calamities sent by Heaven are not of our choosing.
Even the gods in the mountains flee hardship—why blame and hope for the eastern lords!
The year before last I again passed through Yangzhen Pass; I lifted my head and, at the cloud-line, saw Mount Jing.
s2tt_r:
原文：
环中箫管不曾闻，
檐上溪声无处觅。
炫娇妍诡傍乡村，
诸般生灵过朝夕。
窃闻词语愁更愁，
天谴实灾非自由。
神在山中犹避难，
何须责望东诸侯。
前年又出阳正关，
举头云际见金山。

译文：
In the ring, the flute's melody is unheard,
On the eaves, the stream's sound nowhere to be found.
Beside the village, dazzling and strange,
All kinds of creatures pass through day and night.
Hearing words, sorrow deepens sorrow,
Heaven's punishment is real, not free.
Gods in the mountains still seek refuge,
Why blame the eastern lords?
Last year, I passed through Yangzheng Pass,
Looking up, I saw the golden mountain in the clouds.

asr: 如从地府到人间，顿觉时清天地闲。陕州主帅忠且贞，不动干戈唯守城。蒲津主帅能戢兵，千里晏然无犬声。朝携宝货无人问，暮插金钗唯独行。明朝又过新安东，路上乞浆逢一翁。
s2tt:
From nether world to mortal sphere,
I feel the world serene and clear.
The Shaanzhou chief, both true and brave,
Keeps peace and guards what he should save.
The Pujin leader, arms laid down,
Secures a thousand miles of town.
At dawn with gems none cares to stay;
At dusk alone with gold I stray.
Tomorrow I'll leave the town behind,
And beg an old man for drink to find.
s2tt_r:
原文：
如从地府到人间，
顿觉时清天地闲。
陕州主帅终且争，
不动干戈为守城。
胡金主帅能疾兵，
千里晏然无犬声。
招携宝货无人问，
木叉金钗惟独行。
明朝又过新安东，
路上岂将逢野翁。

译文：
From hell to earth, a journey so vast,
A world of peace, a time so vast.
The commander of Shaanxi, in strife,
No war, but to defend the city's life.
The commander of Hujin, swift and bold,
A thousand miles, no barking dog, no cold.
No one to ask for treasures rare,
Only wooden and golden, a solitary pair.
Tomorrow, past New An East,
On the road, will I meet a wild old man?

asr: 苍苍面带苔藓色，隐隐身藏蓬荻中。问翁本是何乡曲，底事寒天霜露宿？老翁暂起欲陈辞，却坐支颐仰天哭。乡园本贯东畿县，岁岁耕桑临近甸。岁种良田二百廛，年输户税三千万。
s2tt:
A face moss-green with age and care,
In reeds and rushes hidden there.
"Pray, whence are you, old man, and why
In cold and dew uncovered lie?"
He tries to rise and words to say,
Then sits and weeps with hands on grey.
"My native place is east of the town,
Where I've tilled and mulched up and down.
Two hundred acres I had in field;
Three million taxes I had to yield."
s2tt_r:
原文：
苍苍面带苔藓色，隐隐深藏蓬荜中。
翁翁本是荷香区，底事寒天霜露宿。
老翁暂举玉尘子，却作枝丫仰听谷。
香园本贯东极县，岁岁供商林尽典。
岁种良田二百禅，年输户税三千万。

译文：
With mossy face and hidden in the thatch,
The old man rests in the cold frost.
He lifts the jade dust, yet listens to the valley,
In the garden of incense, where the year's tax is paid.

asr: 小姑惯织褐絁袍，中妇能炊红黍饭。千间仓兮万丝箱，黄巢过后犹残半。自从洛下屯师旅，日夜巡兵入村坞。匣中秋水拔青蛇，旗上高风吹白虎。入门下马若旋风，罄室倾囊如卷土。
s2tt:
The younger girl weaves coarse robes with skill,
The elder cooks red millet at will.
A thousand barns and chests of silk,
Half remain after Huang Chao's ilk.
Since troops in Luoyang made their stay,
Patrols sweep villages night and day.
Swords flash like autumn streams so cold,
Tiger flags in high winds unfold.
They storm in like a whirlwind's blast,
Looting all treasures to the last.
s2tt_r:
小姑冠之褐狮袍，中腹能吹红薯饭，千间苍溪万丝香，黄巢过后犹残伴，自从落下屯师旅，日夜巡兵入村坞，峡中秋水拔青蛇，骑上高峰吹白虎，入门下马若旋风，庆事轻囊如卷土。

译文：
A young sister-in-law wears a brown lion robe,
Her belly can blow sweet potato rice.
A thousand streams and ten thousand threads of fragrance,
After Huang Chao, still companions remain.
Since the troops have settled,
Day and night patrols enter the village.
In autumn, the river拔s a green snake,
Riding high, blowing a white tiger.
Entering the door, dismounting like a whirlwind,
Celebrations like a light bag, like a rolling wave.

asr: 家财既尽骨肉离，今日垂年一身苦。一身苦兮何足嗟，山中更有千万家。朝饥山上寻蓬子，夜宿霜中卧荻花！妾闻此老伤心语，竟日阑干泪如雨。出门惟见乱枭鸣，更欲东奔何处所？
s2tt_r:
原文：
家财既尽骨肉离，今日垂年一身苦。
一身苦兮何足嗟，山中更有千万家。
朝饥山上寻蓬子，夜宿霜中卧荻花。
窃闻此老伤心语，近日栏杆一泪如雨。
出门唯见乱萧鸣，更欲东奔何处所。

译文：
All wealth gone, kin now far,
In old age, alone I suffer.
Suffering alone, what to say,
In mountains, myriad homes lie.
In the morning, hunger pangs,
I seek wild chives on the hill.
At night, in frost, I lie,
On reed flowers, cold and still.
I hear this old man's sorrow,
His tears like rain, a sight to know.
Outside, only chaos I see,
Where shall I flee, where shall I be?

asr: 仍闻汴路舟车绝，又道彭门自相杀。野色徒销战士魂，河津半是冤人血。适闻有客金陵至，见说江南风景异。自从大寇犯中原，戎马不曾生四鄙。诛锄窃盗若神功，惠爱生灵如赤子。
s2tt:
Still hear no boat or cart on Bianzhou way,
And learn that Pengmen men themselves do slay.
The wilds but waste the warriors' souls away;
The riverside is stained with blood half red.
Just now a guest from Jinling came and said
The Southern scene has changed its face.
Since rebels came to Central Plain,
The borderland sees steeds in vain.
The thieves are killed as if by gods' decree;
The people loved as their own children be.
s2tt_r:
原文：
人文便路舟车绝，右道蓬门自相杀。
野色徒销战士魂，合金半是冤人血。
世闻有客金陵至，渐说江南风景异。
自从大寇犯中原，戎马不曾生四鄙。
诛锄窃盗若神功，惠爱生灵如赤子。

译文：
Humanity's path is blocked, boats and carriages cease,
Righteousness's door, a battle of the heart.
Wildness consumes the warrior's soul, half alloyed with the blood of the wronged.
The world hears of a guest from Jinling, gradually speaking of the strange scenery of the south.
Since the great invaders have invaded the central plains, war horses have never been born in the four borders.
Eliminating thieves and bandits is like a divine feat, loving life as if they were one's own children.

asr: 城壕固护教金汤，赋税如云送军垒。奈何四海尽滔滔，湛然一境平如砥。避难徒为阙下人，怀安却羡江南鬼。愿君举棹东复东，咏此长歌献相公。
s2tt:
The moat stands firm as walls of brass and gold,
While taxes like thick clouds to camps are rolled.
Yet floods o'erflow the land far and wide,
While here the realm's like whetstone, smooth and dried.
To flee from war makes me a stranger here,
In peace I envy southern ghosts' good cheer.
Row eastward on and on, I pray,
And sing this long song to the lord this day.
s2tt_r:
原文：
乘豪顾户浇金汤，赋税如云送军垒。
奈何四海尽滔滔，湛然一镜平如砥。
避难徒为鹊下人，怀安却陷江南鬼。
愿君举棹东复东，永此长歌献相公。

译文：
Ride the waves and look around, pour gold into the soup, taxes like clouds sent to the military camp.
How can the four seas be filled with waves, a mirror as clear as a stone.
To escape the disaster, one becomes a person under the magpie, to be safe, one falls into the ghost of the south of the Yangtze River.
May you row eastward again, forever sing this song to the prime minister.

asr: 日出东南隅，照我秦氏楼。秦氏有好女，自名为罗敷。罗敷喜蚕桑，采桑城南隅。青丝为笼系，桂枝为笼钩。头上倭堕髻，耳中明月珠。缃绮为下裙，紫绮为上襦。
s2tt:
The sun rises in southeast sky,  
Shining on the house of Qin nearby.  
In the house there lives a fair maid,  
Whose name is Luo Fu, it is said.  
She loves to raise silkworms with care,  
And gather mulberry leaves there.  
With blue silk threads her basket's tied,  
A cassia branch hangs by its side.  
Her hair coils like clouds, dark and low,  
Earrings like moons in ears glow.  
A skirt of yellow silk she wears,  
And a purple jacket she bears.
s2tt_r:
原文：
日出东南隅，照我秦氏楼。
秦氏有好女，自名为罗敷。
罗敷喜蚕桑，采桑城南隅。
青丝为笼系，桂枝为笼钩。
头上倭堕髻，耳中明月珠。
缃绮为下裙，紫绮为上襦。

译文：
Sunrise in the southeast corner,
Illuminating my Qin氏 tower.
K Qin氏 has a beautiful daughter,
She calls herself Luo Fu.
Luo Fu loves silk and mulberry,
Picking mulberry in the southern corner.
Green silk for the basket's tie,
Cinnamon branch for the basket's hook.
On her head, a倭堕 hair bun,
In her ears, bright moon pearls.
Bamboo silk for the lower skirt,
Purple silk for the upper robe.

asr: 行者见罗敷，下担捋髭须。少年见罗敷，脱帽著帩头。耕者忘其犁，锄者忘其锄。来归相怨怒，但坐观罗敷。使君从南来，五马立踟蹰。使君遣吏往，问是谁家姝？
s2tt_r:
原文：
行者见罗敷，下担捋髭须。
少年见罗敷，脱帽著帩头。
耕者忘其犁，锄者忘其锄。
来归相怨怒，但坐观罗敷。

使君从南来，五马立踟蹰。
使君遣吏往，问是谁家姝。
但见泪痕湿，不知泪所出。
东家有贤女，自名秦罗敷。
罗敷喜蚕桑，采桑城南隅。
青丝为笼系，桂枝为笼钩。
头上倭堕髻，耳中明月珠。
缃绮为下裙，紫绮为上襦。
行者见罗敷，下担捋髭须。
少年见罗敷，脱帽著帩头。
耕者忘其犁，锄者忘其锄。
来归相怨怒，但坐观罗敷。

使君从南来，五马立踟蹰。
使君遣吏往，问是谁家姝。
但见泪痕湿，不知泪所出。
东家有贤女，自名秦罗敷。
罗敷喜蚕桑，采桑城南隅。
青丝为笼系，桂枝为笼钩。
头上倭堕髻，耳中明月珠。
缃绮为下裙，紫绮为上襦。
行者见罗敷，下担捋髭须。
少年见罗敷，脱帽著帩头。
耕者忘其犁，锄者忘其锄。
来归相怨怒，但坐观罗敷。

译文：
Passersby see Loofu, lay down their burdens, stroke their beards.
Young men see Loofu, take off their hats, wear their caps askew.
Farmers forget their plows, gardeners forget their hoes.
When they return, they complain to each other, only because they watched Loofu.

The governor comes from the south, five horses stand and hesitate.
The governor sends an official, ask who is this beautiful girl.
Only see tears wet, do not know where the tears come from.
In the east there is a virtuous girl, named Qin Loofu.
Loofu loves silk and mulberry, picking mulberry in the south of the city.
Green silk for the basket, osmanthus branch for the basket hook.
On her head a topknot, in her ears a pearl.
Bamboo skirt for the lower part, purple silk for the upper part.
Passersby see Loofu, lay down their burdens, stroke their beards.
Young men see Loofu, take off their hats, wear their caps askew.
Farmers forget their plows, gardeners forget their hoes.
When they return, they complain to each other, only because they watched Loofu.

The governor comes from the south, five horses stand and hesitate.
The governor sends an official, ask who is this beautiful girl.
Only see tears wet, do not know where the tears come from.
In the east there is a virtuous girl, named Qin Loofu.
Loofu loves silk and mulberry, picking mulberry in the south of the city.
Green silk for the basket, osmanthus branch for the basket hook.
On her head a topknot, in her ears a pearl.
Bamboo skirt for the lower part, purple silk for the upper part.
Passersby see Loofu, lay down their burdens, stroke their beards.
Young men see Loofu, take off their hats, wear their caps askew.
Farmers forget their plows, gardeners forget their hoes.
When they return, they complain to each other, only because they watched Loofu.

asr: “秦氏有好女，自名为罗敷。”“罗敷年几何？”“二十尚不足，十五颇有余”。使君谢罗敷：“宁可共载不？”罗敷前致辞：“使君一何愚！使君自有妇，罗敷自有夫！
s2tt:
The Qin's have a daughter fair,
Whose name is Luo Fu, I declare.
"How old is she, pray?"
"Not twenty, I'd say,
A little past fifteen, I dare."

The lord sent word to the maid,
"Would you share my carriage, unafraid?"
Luo Fu stepped forth to reply,
"How foolish, my lord, to ask why!
You have a wife of your own,
And I have a husband, well-known!"
s2tt_r:
原文：
秦氏有好女，字名为罗敷。
罗敷年几何？二十尚不足，
十五颇右余。使君谢罗敷，
宁可共载否？罗敷前致辞，
使君一何愚！使君自有妇，
罗敷自有夫。

译文：
There once was a fair maiden named Luo Fu,
In her prime, yet not quite twenty, quite fifteen she was.
A nobleman courted Luo Fu, asking if he might share her carriage.
Luo Fu replied, "How foolish you are! You have a wife, I have a husband."

asr: ”“东方千余骑，夫婿居上头。何用识夫婿？白马从骊驹，青丝系马尾，黄金络马头腰中鹿卢剑，可值千万余。十五府小吏，二十朝大夫，三十侍中郎，四十专城居。
s2tt_r:
原文：
东方千余骑，夫婿居上头。
何用识夫婿？白马从骊驹。
青丝系马尾，黄金络马头。
腰中鹿卢剑，可值千万余。
十五府小吏，二十朝大夫。
三十侍中郎，四十专城居。

译文：
More than a thousand riders in the east,
My husband stands at the top.
How do you recognize my husband?
He rides a white horse following a black one.
A blue ribbon ties the horse's tail,
Gold adorns the horse's head.
A sword in his waist, worth a thousand.
At fifteen, he was a minor official,
At twenty, a court official.
At thirty, a court eunuch,
At forty, he governed a city.

asr: 为人洁白晰，鬑鬑颇有须。盈盈公府步，冉冉府中趋。坐中数千人，皆言夫婿殊。”
s2tt:
Fair, fair, he stands in sight,
With beard so black and bright.
At court he goes his pace;
In court he shows his grace.
Thousands of men in hall
Say none's like him at all.
s2tt_r:
原文：
惟人杰白皙，廉廉颇有须。
盈盈宫府部，冉冉府中趋。
座中数千人，皆言夫婿殊。

译文：
Only the nobleman is fair-skinned,
With a neat beard, quite distinct.
He walks through the palace's halls,
And moves through the court with grace.
In the hall, thousands gather,
All speak of his unique charm.

asr: 相鼠有皮，人而无仪！人而无仪，不死何为？相鼠有齿，人而无止！人而无止，不死何俟？相鼠有体，人而无礼！人而无礼，胡不遄死？
s2tt:
Look at the rat, it has its skin;
A man without his grace within!
If a man has no grace,
What should he do but death embrace?

Look at the rat, it has its teeth;
A man without his shame beneath!
If a man has no shame,
What should he do but wait for blame?

Look at the rat, it has its limbs;
A man without his courtesy hymns!
If a man has no courtesy,
Why not die immediately?
s2tt_r:
原文：
象数有皮，人而无衣。
人而无衣，不死何为？
象数有齿，人而无齿。
人而无齿，不死何似？
象数有体，人而无礼。
人而无礼，胡不传死？

译文：
The elephant has skin, man lacks cloth.
Without cloth, why not die?
The elephant has teeth, man lacks teeth.
Without teeth, how can one live?
The elephant has form, man lacks propriety.
Without propriety, why not pass on death?

asr: 长忆观潮，满郭人争江上望。来疑沧海尽成空，万面鼓声中。弄潮儿向涛头立，手把红旗旗不湿。别来几向梦中看，梦觉尚心寒。
s2tt:
I oft recall the tidal bore,
When crowds vied for a view on the shore.
It seemed the sea had emptied its core,
With thundering drums' roar.
The swimmers stood atop the tide,
Red flags in hand, not wet beside.
Since then, in dreams I've seen the sight,
Awake, my heart still chilled with fright.
s2tt_r:
常忆观潮，满郭人争江上望。
来疑沧海尽成空，万面鼓声中。
弄潮儿向潮头立，手把红旗旗不湿。
别来几向梦中看，梦觉尚心寒。

译文：
I often recall watching the tide,
Where the whole city gathers to gaze.
It seems the sea has all been drained,
In the midst of a thousand drumbeats.
The tide runners stand on the crest,
Holding red flags that never wet.
How many times have I seen it in dreams,
And still, when I wake, my heart feels cold.

asr: 飞光飞光，劝尔一杯酒。吾不识青天高，黄地厚。唯见月寒日暖，来煎人寿。食熊则肥，食蛙则瘦。神君何在？太一安有？天东有若木，下置衔烛龙。吾将斩龙足，嚼龙肉，使之朝不得回，夜不得伏。
s2tt:
Flying Light, Flying Light, I urge you a cup of wine.
I know not how high the azure sky,
Nor how deep the yellow earth's design.
I only see the moon cold, the sun warm,
Consuming human life in time.
Feast on bear, one grows stout;
Feast on frog, one grows lean.
Where is the Divine Lord?
Does the Great One truly reign supreme?
In the east of heaven grows the Ruomu tree,
Beneath it lies the dragon holding a candle in its teeth.
I shall sever the dragon's feet,
And chew its flesh with might,
So that morning cannot return,
And night cannot take flight.
s2tt_r:
原文：
飞光飞光，劝尔一杯酒。
吾不识青天高，黄地厚。
唯见月寒日暖，来煎人寿。
食熊则肥，食蛙则瘦。
神君何在？太一安有？
天东有若木，下至衔烛龙。
吾将斩龙足，嚼龙肉，
使此龙不得朝，不得夕。
译文：
Fly, fly, I urge you to drink a cup of wine.
I know not the height of the blue sky,
Nor the depth of the yellow earth.
I only see the cold moon and the warm sun,
That consume the life of man.
Eating bear makes one fat,
Eating frogs makes one thin.
Where is the divine king?
Where is the god of heaven?
In the east of the sky there is a tree,
And below it, a dragon holding a candle.
I will cut off the dragon's foot,
And chew its flesh,
So that this dragon may not come at dawn,
Nor at dusk.

asr: 自然老者不死，少者不哭。何为服黄金、吞白玉？谁似任公子，云中骑碧驴？刘彻茂陵多滞骨，嬴政梓棺费鲍鱼。
s2tt:
Nature's old never die, the young never cry.
Why take gold and jade to live by?
Who like the Prince Ren, on a blue donkey in cloud?
Liu Che's tomb holds but bones proud,
Qin Shihuang's coffin but fish foul.
s2tt_r:
自然老者不死，少者不哭，何为服黄金，吞白玉？谁似任公子，云中骑碧驴？刘彻茂陵多滞骨，嬴政梓棺费鲍鱼。

译文：
Nature's old do not die, young do not weep,
Why swallow gold, eat white jade? Who is like Ren Gongzi, riding a green donkey in the clouds? Liu Che's Maoling has many bones, Ying Zheng's casket costs much onh.

asr: 汝得残餐究奚补？伥鬼羞颜亦更主旧山同伴倘相逢，笑尔行藏不如鼠。
s2tt:
What gain from scraps of food you steal?  
Shamed ghosts would blush to change their zeal.  
Should old friends meet on mountains high,  
They'd mock your ways beneath the sky.
s2tt_r:
原文：
主德惭惭纠西补，
昌鬼休言一更主。
旧山同伴倘相逢，
笑尔行藏不如鼠。

译文：
The Lord's virtue grows dim and修补，
The ghost of prosperity rests in silence.
If old companions meet again in the mountains,
They'll laugh at your actions, no better than a mouse.

asr: 西楼别后，风高露冷，无奈月分明。飞鸿影里，捣衣砧外，总是玉关情。王孙此际，山重水远，何处赋西征。金闺魂梦枉丁宁。寻尽短长亭。
s2tt:
After West Tower's farewell, wind high, dew cold,
In vain the moon is bright.
In wild geese' shadows, by the washing stone,
The frontier's kept in sight.
Where can the roamer write a westward song
With hills and streams in view?
In vain his wife's soul dreams of him so long,
From short pavilion to long.
s2tt_r:
原文：
西楼别后风高路冷，无奈月分明。飞鸿影里，捣衣砧外，总是玉关情。王孙此际山重水远，何处复西征？金闺魂梦往，叮咛寻尽短长亭。

译文：
After parting on the west tower, the wind is high and the road is cold, but the moon is clear. In the shadow of the flying geese, outside the stone board for pounding clothes, there is always the longing for the frontier. At this moment, the mountains are heavy and the waters are far, where can the westward journey be resumed? The soul of the golden chamber dreams of you, urging to find the short and long pavilions.

asr: 我玩的是梁园月，饮的是东京酒，赏的是洛阳花，攀的是章台柳。我也会围棋、会蹴踘、会打围、会插科、会歌舞、会吹弹、会咽作、会吟诗、会双陆。你便是落了我牙、歪了我嘴、瘸了我腿、折了我手，天赐与我这几般儿歹症候，尚兀自不肯休！
s2tt:
I play with moonlight in Liang Garden's bowers,
I drink the wine of Eastern Capital's flowers,
I view the peonies in Luoyang's bowers,
I climb the willows in the dancing towers.
I play chess, kick the ball, hunt and jest,
I sing and dance, blow and beat with zest,
I write verse and play games with the best.
Even if you break my teeth, make my mouth awry,
Lame my legs and my hands untie,
Heaven has given me these incurable ills,
Yet I'll do what I will with a will.
s2tt_r:
原文：
我玩的是梁园月，饮的是东京酒，赏的是洛阳花，攀的是章台柳。我也会围棋，会蹴鞠，会打围，会插科，会歌舞，会吹弹，会咽作，会吟诗，会双陆。你便是落了我的牙，歪了我的嘴，瘸了我的腿，折了我的手，天赐与我这几般儿歹症候，尚兀自不肯休。
译文：
I play the moon of Liang Garden, drink the wine of Tokyo, admire the flowers of Luoyang, climb the willows of Zhang Tai. I also know chess, football, hunting, comedy, singing, playing, singing, poetry, and double chess. You have knocked out my teeth, twisted my mouth, crippled my leg, broken my hand, and given me these bad symptoms, yet still refuse to stop.

asr: 则除是阎王亲自唤，神鬼自来勾。三魂归地府，七魄丧冥幽。天哪！那其间才不向烟花路儿上走！
s2tt:
Unless the King of Hell in person call,
Or ghosts and spirits come to drag away
My soul down to the nether world, where all
Three spirits and seven souls are made to stay,
Heaven! Then only I'll no longer stray
Along the lane of singsong flowers gay.
s2tt_r:
择处是阎王亲自唤，
神鬼自来勾。
三魂归地府，
七魄丧冥幽。
天哪，
那其间才不像烟花路儿上走。

译文：
Where the King of Hell himself calls,
Ghosts and gods come to lead.
Three souls return to the underworld,
Seven spirits perish in the abyss.
Oh, heavens,
That period is not like the fireworks on the road.

asr: 广开兮天门，纷吾乘兮玄云。令飘风兮先驱，使涷雨兮洒尘。君回翔兮以下，逾空桑兮从女。纷总总兮九州，何寿夭兮在予。高飞兮安翔，乘清气兮御阴阳。吾与君兮齐速，导帝之兮九坑。
s2tt:
Wide open the Celestial Gate,
On dark clouds I ride in state.
Let whirlwinds run before my car,
And heavy rain wash dust afar.
You hover o'er the world below,
O'er the Empty Mulberry I go.
O'er the nine lands I fly up and down;
Who lives long and who dies? I frown.
I fly at ease on high,
On pure air ride the sun and moon in the sky.
I keep pace with you, oh, my lord,
To guide God to the mountains adored.
s2tt_r:
广开兮天门，纷吾乘兮玄云。
令飘风兮先驱，使雨露兮洒尘。
君回翔兮以下，余空桑兮从予。
纷总总兮九州，合授尧兮在余。
高飞兮安翔，乘清气兮御阴阳。
吾与君兮齐速，导帝之兮九刚。

译文：
Widening the sky's gate, I ride on dark clouds.
Let the gusts of wind lead the way, and let rain and dew cleanse the dust.
You circle down, I follow in the empty mulberry trees.
The nine regions are bustling, and I am granted the role of Yao.
Soar high and rest in peace, riding the clear air and controlling the yin and yang.
I and you move together, guiding the emperor to the nine heavens.

asr: 灵衣兮被被，玉佩兮陆离。壹阴兮壹阳，众莫知兮余所为。折疏麻兮瑶华，将以遗兮离居。老冉冉兮既极，不寖近兮愈疏。乘龙兮辚辚，高驼兮冲天。结桂枝兮延伫，羌愈思兮愁人。
s2tt:
In spirit's robe, so long, so wide,
With girdle gems of rainbow hue.
Now dark, now bright, I change my side;
None knows what I'm about to do.

I pluck the mystic flower fair
To send to one who's far away.
Old age is coming unaware;
If not approached, it will not stay.

I mount the dragon chariot proud,
And fly up to the heaven high.
I wait with cassia in hand, loud
My longing wafts into the sky.
s2tt_r:
原文：
林欀兮披披，玉佩兮陆离。
衣英兮翼翼，众莫知兮与所为。
折舒麻兮瑶华，将以遗兮离居。
老冉冉兮既极，不进进兮愈疏。
乘龙兮辚辚，高驰兮冲天。
结桂枝兮延伫，羌欲思兮愁人。

译文：
In the forest, branches spread wide,
Jade ornaments shimmer in the light.
Clothes flutter like wings, so fine,
No one knows what they are designed for.
Bending the soft hemp, a jade flower,
To send to the distant, a gift of love.
As time passes, life grows old,
Not advancing, growing more remote.
Riding a dragon, moving slowly,
Soaring high, piercing the sky.
Tying the laurel branch, waiting,
I long to think of you, my dear.

asr: 愁人兮奈何，愿若今兮无亏。固人命兮有当，孰离合兮可为？
s2tt:
Why so sad, O my heart?
Keep whole as thou art.
Man's life has its due date;
Who can part or unite?
s2tt_r:
原文：
愁人惜奈何，愿若今夕无亏。
故人命兮有当，孰离合兮可为。

译文：
A sorrowful heart laments, wishing for tonight's完好无缺。
A friend's fate is predestined, who can decide the parting or reunion?

asr: 秋兰兮麋芜，罗生兮堂下。绿叶兮素华，芳菲菲兮袭予。夫人自有兮美子，荪何以兮愁苦？秋兰兮青青，绿叶兮紫茎。满堂兮美人，忽独与余兮目成。入不言兮出不辞，乘回风兮载云旗。
s2tt:
Autumn orchids and sweet herbs grow,
Beneath the hall in row on row.
Green leaves and blossoms white,
Their fragrance fills the air.
Each has her own fair child so bright,
Why should you, Goddess, grieve in despair?
Green grow the autumn orchids fine,
With purple stalks and leaves divine.
The hall is filled with beauties fair,
But on me you have fixed your stare.
You come without a word, go without goodbye,
Riding the whirlwind with cloud-flag flying high.
s2tt_r:
秋兰兮靡芜，罗生兮堂下。绿叶兮素华，芳菲菲兮袭予。美人兮自美，何以兮愁苦？秋兰兮青青，绿叶兮紫茎。满堂兮美人，忽独与余兮目成。入不言兮出不辞，乘回风兮载云旗。
译文：
Beneath the hall, the orchid and the myrtle grow,
Their green leaves and pure blossoms, a fragrant show.
The beauty herself is fair, why then her sorrow?
The orchid stands so green, its purple stem so fine.
In the hall, the beauties gather, eyes meet mine.
No words are spoken, no farewells are made,
On the returning wind, the clouds and banners ride.

asr: 悲莫悲兮生别离，乐莫乐兮新相知。荷衣兮蕙带，儵而来兮忽而逝。夕宿兮帝郊，君谁须兮云之际？与女游兮九河，冲风至兮水扬波。与女沐兮咸池，晞女发兮阳之阿。
s2tt:
No grief so great as parting while alive;
No joy so great as making friends anew.
In lotus coat with angelica girded,
You come and go like a flash of light.
At dusk you lodge in outskirts of the sky.
For whom do you wait on cloud so high?
I'd sail with you on rivers nine,
Though waves may rise when blows the wind.
I'd bathe with you in sunlit pool,
And dry your hair on sunny hill.
s2tt_r:
原文：
悲莫悲兮生别离，
乐莫乐兮新相知。
何以兮会带，
孰而来兮忽而逝。
夕宿兮帝郊，
君谁须兮云之际。
与女游兮九河，
冲风至兮水扬波。
与女沐兮咸池，
与女发兮阳之阿。

译文：
The saddest thing is to part,
The happiest is to meet anew.
How can we meet with a belt?
Who comes and then departs anew?
At dusk, we rest at the emperor's land,
Who needs you at the clouds' edge?
We roam the nine rivers,
As the wind blows, the water waves.
We bathe in the salty pool,
We let our hair dry by the sun's edge.

asr: 望美人兮未来，临风怳兮浩歌。孔盖兮翠旍，登九天兮抚彗星。竦长剑兮拥幼艾，荪独宜兮为民正。
s2tt_r:
原文：
望美人兮未来，临风恍兮浩歌。
孔盖兮翠旂，登九天兮抚彗星。
耸长剑兮拥幼艾，荪独宜兮为民众。

译文：
I long for the beauty that is not yet here,
In the wind, I sing with a vast and boundless heart.
The canopy and the green flag rise,
Ascending to the heavens, touching the comet's star.
With a towering sword and embracing the young,
Selin is alone, suitable for the people's welfare.

asr: 泛览周王传，流观山海图。俯仰终宇宙，不乐复何如？
s2tt:
Through King Zhou's tales I roam,
O'er Classic Hills and Seas I gaze.
Thus in a trice I span the globe's vast dome,
What greater joy could e'er my spirit raise?
s2tt_r:
泛览周王传，流观山海图。俯仰终宇宙，不乐复何如。
译文：
A glance through the annals of Zhou,
A fleeting look at the mountains and seas.
In a moment, the universe is seen,
What joy can surpass this scene?

asr: 精卫衔微木，将以填沧海。刑天舞干戚，猛志固常在。同物既无虑，化去不复悔。徒设在昔心，良辰讵可待。
s2tt:
The Bird Jingwei with a twig in beak,
To fill the sea would try.
The Giant Xing Tian, spear and shield in hand,
Would fight against the sky.
They feared not death, nor would they e'er regret,
Though turned to dust and clay.
Their will was strong, but could they e'er forget
The good old bygone day?
s2tt_r:
原文：
精卫衔微木，将以填沧海。
刑天舞干戚，猛志固常在。
同物既无虑，化去不复悔。
徒设在昔心，良辰讵可待。

译文：
A tiny wood in beak, a sea to fill,
A warrior's spirit, unyielding still.
With no fear of change, no regret to feel,
A heart of old, a future to fulfill.

asr: 厚地高天，侧身颇觉平生左。小斋如舸，自许回旋可。聊复浮生，得此须臾我。乾坤大，霜林独坐，红叶纷纷堕。
s2tt:
Vast earth and sky, I feel my life awry.
My study like a boat, where I can float.
In this fleeting life, I seize this moment's strife.
The world so wide, in frosty woods I bide,
As red leaves fall, embracing all.
s2tt_r:
原文：
厚地高天，侧身颇觉平生左。
小斋如阁，自诩回旋可。
聊复残生，得此须臾我。
乾坤大，霜林独坐，红叶纷纷堕。

译文：
Thick earth and high sky, a side glance feels life askew.
A small study like a pavilion, I boast I can turn around.
A fleeting life, this moment is all I have.
In the vast universe, sitting alone in frosty woods, red leaves fall in abundance.

asr: 林花谢了春红，太匆匆。无奈朝来寒雨晚来风。胭脂泪，留人醉，几时重。自是人生长恨水长东。
s2tt:
Forest flowers fade in spring's red hue,
Too swift, too fleet.
Morn's chill rain and eve's wind in view,
How can they meet?
Rouge tears in streams,
Intoxicate with dreams.
When will they reappear?
Life's long regret, like water eastward bound,
Forever flows without a sound.
s2tt_r:
原文：
菱花谢了春红，太匆匆。
无奈朝来寒雨晚来风。
胭脂泪，留人醉，几时重。
自是人生长恨水长东。

译文：
Lotus flowers fade, spring's redness too fleeting.
Unwillingly, morning rain and evening wind come.
Cinnabar tears, leaving people drunk, when will they return?
Life's long hatred flows like water eastward.

asr: 气劘屈贾垒，目短曹刘墙。忤下考功第，独辞京尹堂。放荡齐赵间，裘马颇清狂。春歌丛台上，冬猎青丘旁。呼鹰皂枥林，逐兽云雪冈。射飞曾纵鞚，引臂落鹙鶬。
s2tt_r:
原文：
气摩屈贾垒，目短曹刘墙。
舞下考功第，独辞金印堂。
放荡骑照间，裘马颇轻狂。
春歌丛台上，冬猎青丘旁。
呼鹰诏栗林，逐兽云雪冈。
射飞沉重控，饮碧落秋苍。

译文：
The spirit soars to match屈贾的壁垒，目光短浅曹刘的城墙。
舞动在考功的殿堂，独自辞去金印的官场。
放荡在日光的照耀间，裘马轻狂。
春歌在丛台上，冬猎在青丘旁。
呼鹰在栗林诏令，逐兽在云雪冈。
射飞沉稳控制，饮碧落秋苍。

asr: 四方之歌，异音而同乐。岁正月，余来建平，里中儿联歌《竹枝》，吹短笛，击鼓以赴节。歌者扬袂睢舞，以曲多为贤。聆其音，中黄钟之羽，其卒章激讦如吴声，虽伧儜不可分，而含思宛转，有《淇奥》之艳。
s2tt:
Songs from all lands, in varied tunes, delight the ear.
In the first moon I came to Jianping, where I hear
Children sing songs of Bamboo Branch with fife and drum
Beating time. With sleeves raised, they dance with grace.
The more songs they sing, the more they win the race.
Their songs are plaintive, appealing to the heart,
And in the end impassioned, southern-like, in part.
Though rustic, they are pleasing to the ear,
As the song of Riverside so dear.
s2tt_r:
原文：
四方之歌，一音而同乐，遂争乐于来建平。里中而连歌逐之，吹短笛，击鼓以复节。歌者扬袂挥舞，以曲多为贤。林其音，众黄钟之羽，其足张，击节如无声，虽苍宁不可分，而含思婉转，有奇遇之宴。

译文：
Four directions of song, one sound and same joy, thus competing in pleasure at the coming of peace. In the village, they sing in unison, blowing short flutes, striking drums to renew the rhythm. Singers wave their sleeves, taking pride in the abundance of their tunes. The sound fills the forest, a chorus of yellow bells, their feet moving, tapping the beat like silent harmony. Though the melody is complex, it flows gracefully, evoking a feast of unexpected delights.

asr: 昔屈原居沅湘间，其民迎神，词多鄙陋，乃为作《九歌》，到于今荆楚鼓舞之。故余亦作《竹枝词》九篇，俾善歌者飏之，附于末，后之聆巴歈，知变风之自焉。
s2tt:
In days of old, Qu Yuan by riverside,
Where rustic hymns to gods were sung with pride,
Composed the "Nine Songs" to refine the tone,
Now danced in Chu with rhythms deeply known.
Thus I, inspired, nine "Bamboo Branch" songs frame,
For skilled musicians to exalt their fame,
Appended here as echoes of the breeze,
That future ears may trace the changing melodies.
s2tt_r:
原文：
昔屈原居沅湘间，其民吟神词多鄙陋，乃谓作九歌，道于今，荆楚鼓舞之，故于意作竹枝词九篇，比善歌者扬之，复于末，后之邻巴渝之变风之自焉。

译文：
In the past, Qu Yuan lived in the area of the Yuan and Xiang rivers. The people there often sang divine songs, which were often crude. So he created the Nine Songs, which are still sung today. The people of Jingchu dance to these songs, so he wrote nine Bamboo Branch Songs to convey his intentions. These songs were sung by skilled singers and were later influenced by the folk songs of neighboring regions, particularly those of Ba and Yu.

asr: 白帝城头春草生，白盐山下蜀江清。南人上来歌一曲，北人莫上动乡情。山桃红花满上头，蜀江春水拍山流。花红易衰似郎意，水流无限似侬愁。江上朱楼新雨晴，瀼西春水縠文生。
s2tt_r:
白帝城头春草生，白盐山下蜀江清。
南人上来歌一曲，北人莫上动乡情。
山桃红花满上头，蜀江春水拍山流。
花红易衰似郎意，水流无限似侬愁。
江上朱楼新雨晴，瀼西春水縠纹生。
译文：
Spring grass grows on the White Emperor's tower,
The Sichuan River flows clear by the White Salt Mountain.
Southerners sing a song as they climb,
Northerners, do not ascend, for it stirs homesickness.
Red flowers bloom on the mountain tops,
The Sichuan River's spring waters beat against the mountains.
Red flowers fade easily, like a lover's heart,
The flowing water is boundless, like my sorrow.
Newly-rained朱楼 on the river,
Riverside spring waters ripple like a veil.

asr: 个里愁人肠自断，由来不是此声悲。山上层层桃李花，云间烟火是人家。银钏金钗来负水，长刀短笠去烧畲。
s2tt:
Here sorrows rend the heart in twain,
Yet not for this the notes complain.
On hillside bloom peach trees and plums;
In clouds smoke rises from homes.
With silver bracelets and gold hairpin,
They carry water from the fountain.
With long swords and short hats they go
To burn the weeds and make fields grow.
s2tt_r:
原文：
个里愁人肠自断，由来不是此生悲。
山上层层桃李花，云间烟火是人家。
银钏金钗来覆水，长刀短笠去烧畲。

译文：
In this place, sorrow cuts one's heart,
It's not this life's sorrow that's ever been.
Layer upon layer of peach and plum blossoms,
In the clouds, the smoke of homes.
Silver bracelets and golden hairpins fall like water,
Long knives and short hats go to burn the fields.

asr: 悲哉，秋之为气也！萧瑟兮草木摇落而变衰。憭栗兮若在远行，登山临水兮送将归。泬漻兮天高而气清，寂漻兮收潦而水清。憯悽增欷兮，薄寒之中人。怆怳懭悢兮，去故而就新。
s2tt:
Sad, oh! the autumn air's so drear!
Sough, sough! the plants and trees turn sear.
Lonely, oh! I'm on journey long;
Mounting the hill, I see friends home along.
Vast, oh! the sky is high and air clear;
Silent, oh! the water's lucid here.
Grieved, oh! I heave sigh on sigh,
Chilled, oh! by thin cold from on high.
Sad, oh! I leave the old for the new,
Melancholy, oh! my heart's rent in two.
s2tt_r:
原文：
悲哉秋之为气也，萧瑟兮草木摇落而变衰。憭栗兮若在远行，登山临水兮送将归。泬寥兮天高而气清，寂寥兮收潦而水清。惨凄增兮薄寒之中人，怆恍恍量兮去故而就新。

译文：
Alas, autumn's the season of sorrow,
Leaves fall, grasses wither, nature's in woe.
A旅者 feels the chill, far from home,
Mountains and waters, a farewell to roam.
The sky is vast, air clear and bright,
The waters calm, the earth's embrace, a sight.
The cold grows sharper, piercing the heart,
A sense of loss, yet hope for a new start.

asr: 坎廪兮贫士失职而志不平。廓落兮羁旅而无友生。惆怅兮而私自怜！燕翩翩其辞归兮，蝉寂漠而无声。雁廱廱而南游兮，鹍鸡啁哳而悲鸣。独申旦而不寐兮，哀蟋蟀之宵征。
s2tt_r:
原文：
坎廪兮平是施，直而致不平。
廓落兮羁旅而无有声。
惆怅兮而思自怜。
燕翩翩兮辞归兮。
蝉寂寞而无声。
燕雍雍而难游兮。
鲲击朝朝而悲鸣。
独身旦而不寐兮。
哀蟋蟀之宵征。

译文：
Level and straight is the path,
But it leads to unevenness.
Lonely and silent is the journey,
No sound to be heard.
Sighing and thinking of self-pity,
The swallows fly away, leaving.
The cicadas are silent, lost in solitude.
The swallows are hard to find, far away.
The great fish cries in the morning, mourning.
Alone, I cannot sleep at dawn.
I mourn the cricket's night journey.

asr: 原一见兮道余意，君之心兮与余异。车既驾兮朅而归，不得见兮心伤悲。倚结軨兮长太息，涕潺湲兮下霑轼。忼慨绝兮不得，中瞀乱兮迷惑。私自怜兮何极，心怦怦兮谅直。
s2tt_r:
原文：
愿一见兮道余意
君之心兮与余异
车既驾兮妾而归
不得见兮心伤悲
意结凌兮成太息
涕潺湲兮下沾轼
慷慨绝兮不得
终冒乱兮迷惑
私自怜兮何极
心怦怦兮谅直

译文：
Wish to see you, to convey my thoughts,
Your heart differs from mine, it seems.
The carriage is ready, I return home,
Not to see you, my heart is filled with sorrow.
My thoughts are entangled, I sigh deeply,
Tears flow down, wetting the carriage.
I am filled with emotion, unable to express,
In the end, I am confused and lost.
I pity myself, how can I endure this?
My heart beats rapidly, I am sincere.

asr: 皇天平分四时兮，窃独悲此凛秋。白露既下百草兮，奄离披此梧楸。去白日之昭昭兮，袭长夜之悠悠。离芳蔼之方壮兮，余萎约而悲愁。秋既先戒以白露兮，冬又申之以严霜。
s2tt_r:
黄天平分四时兮，
窃独悲此凛秋。
白露既下百草兮，
掩离披此芜丘。
去白日之昭昭兮，
袭长夜之悠悠。
离芳霭之方壮兮，
余委约而悲愁。
秋既先戒以白露兮，
冬又申之以严霜。

译文：
The yellow sky divides the four seasons,
I secretly grieve for this cold autumn.
White dew has fallen on a hundred grasses,
Covering the withered hills.
The bright sun has departed,
And long nights have come.
The fragrant mist is fading,
And I am left to sorrow.
Autumn has warned with white dew,
And winter will follow with frost.

asr: 收恢台之孟夏兮，然欿傺而沉藏。叶菸邑而无色兮，枝烦挐而交横。颜淫溢而将罢兮，柯仿佛而萎黄。萷櫹椮之可哀兮，形销铄而瘀伤。惟其纷糅而将落兮，恨其失时而无当。
s2tt:
The summer's splendor fades away,
And sinks in gloom and deep dismay.
The leaves, once green, now pale and sere,
The branches cross in tangled fear.
The hues, once bright, now dim and old,
The boughs, once strong, now weak and cold.
The trees stand bare, a mournful sight,
Their forms decayed, bereft of light.
All mingled, soon to fall and die,
Regret their time has passed them by.
s2tt_r:
原文：
收灰台之孟夏兮，冉冉炽而成藏。
叶蔫翳而无色兮，枝繁缛而交横。
颜淫溢而将罢兮，柯仿佛而萎黄。
稍萧森之可哀兮，形消烁而淤伤。
唯其纷柔而将落兮，恨其失时而无当。

译文：
In the midsummer of the ash-gray season,
The heat rises slowly, enveloping the scene.
Leaves wilt and fade, colorless and lifeless,
Branches intertwine, lush and dense.
Faces overflow with vitality, about to fade,
Branches seem to wither, turning yellow.
A little more, and the scene is sorrowful,
Shapes disappear, leaving only decay.
Only the softness and fragility will fall,
Regretting the missed opportunity, it is inappropriate.

asr: 凫雁皆唼夫梁藻兮，凤愈飘翔而高举。圜凿而方枘兮，吾固知其鉏铻而难入。众鸟皆有所登棲兮，凤独遑遑而无所集。原衔枚而无言兮，尝被君之渥洽。太公九十乃显荣兮，诚未遇其匹合。
s2tt:
Wild ducks peck weeds on the pool and stream;
The phoenix soars up on high.
A square tenon for a round mortise,
I know they can't fit, however they try.
All birds have their perches where they may rest;
The phoenix alone can find no place for her nest.
I'd rather keep silent with a gag in the mouth,
But I can't forget your past favor, forsooth.
At ninety the Lord of Lu won fame and renown.
Where can I find a prince to help me win the crown?
s2tt_r:
原文：
浮雁接铩羽良藻兮，凤欲飘翔而高举。
圆凿而方枘兮，吾固知其除吾而难入。
众鸟皆有所登栖兮，凤独遑遑而无所集。
圆弦美而无延兮，常备君之我弃。
太公九十仍显荣兮，诚未遇其匹合。

译文：
Floating geese connect with broken feathers and fine feathers,
The phoenix wants to soar and fly high.
Round holes and square pegs,
I firmly know it will be difficult for me to fit in.
All birds have places to perch,
But the phoenix is in a hurry and has nowhere to settle.
Round strings are beautiful but cannot be extended,
Often prepared for you, I am abandoned.
Taigong is still glorious at ninety,
He has never met his equal.

asr: 谓骐骥兮安归，谓凤皇兮安棲？变古易俗兮世衰，今之相者兮举肥。骐骥伏匿而不见兮，凤皇高飞而不下。鸟兽犹知怀德兮，何云贤士之不处？骥不骤进而求服兮，凤亦不贪餧而妄食。
s2tt:
Where shall the noble steed find rest?
Where shall the phoenix build its nest?
When ancient ways are cast aside,
The world decays and men deride.
The steed in hiding lies unseen;
The phoenix soars o'er clouds serene.
Even beasts know where virtue lies,
Why should the worthy be despised?
The steed won't rush to serve in haste;
The phoenix scorns the vulgar taste.
s2tt_r:
原文：
未闻孔雀兮安归？未见凤凰兮安栖？变古易俗兮世衰，今之相者兮举非。孔雀服匿兮不见兮，凤凰高飞兮不下。鸟兽犹如怀德兮，何云贤士之不处？既不骤进而求福兮，凤亦不贪位而忘时。

译文：
Where is the peacock's home?
Where does the phoenix rest?
As times change, customs shift, and the world decays,
The wise are often misunderstood.

The peacock hides, unseen,
The phoenix soars high, never descending.
Birds and beasts cherish virtue,
Why should the wise not find their place?

Seeking fortune without haste,
The phoenix does not seek power, forgetting time.

asr: 君弃远而不察兮，虽原忠其焉得？欲寂漠而绝端兮，窃不敢忘初之厚德。独悲愁其伤人兮，冯郁郁其何极？霜露惨悽而交下兮，心尚幸其弗济。霰雪雰糅其增加兮，乃知遭命之将至。
s2tt:
You cast me off, unheeding, far away;
How can I prove my loyalty, I pray?
I wish to cut off all ties, silent, alone,
Yet dare not forget your first kindness shown.
My sorrow wounds me, deep and profound;
How can I bear this grief without bound?
Frost and dew fall, mingled, chill and drear,
Yet I still hope they may not settle here.
When sleet and snow increase and blend as one,
I know my ill fate has begun.
s2tt_r:
原文：
君器远而不察兮，虽远终其焉得。
欲寂寞而绝端兮，切不敢忘出之后得。
独悲愁其伤人兮，凭郁郁其何及。
霜露惨凄而交下兮，心尚幸其弗及。
霰雪纷糅其增加兮，乃知遭命之将至。

译文：
Your power is far and unseen,
Though distant, how can you attain?
Desiring solitude and isolation,
I dare not forget the path ahead.
Alone, sorrow and grief consume,
How can I bear this heavy load?
Frost and dew fall together,
My heart still hopes it will not reach.
Snowflakes and ice crystals increase,
I now know my fate is near.

asr: 窃美申包胥之气盛兮，恐时世之不固。何时俗之工巧兮，灭规矩而改凿！独耿介而不随兮，原慕先圣之遗教。处浊世而显荣兮，非余心之所乐。与其无义而有名兮，宁穷处而守高。
s2tt:
I admire Shen Pao-hsu's spirit so bright,
Yet fear the world's change, unstable and slight.
How cunning the custom, how crafty the art!
To change square and compass, they break them apart.
Alone I stand upright, not following the tide,
Adoring the teachings of sages who died.
In a muddy world to be honored and proud
Is not what I want to be sung aloud.
Better to be poor and keep my soul high
Than to win a name by what's wrong, not right.
s2tt_r:
原文：
千美身苞须知气盛兮，
恐时世之不顾，
何时俗之工巧兮，
灭规矩而改造，
独耿介而不随兮，
愿慕先圣之一教。
处浊世而显荣兮，
非余心之所乐，
与其无义而有名兮，
宁穷处而守高。

译文：
A thousand beauties must be known to be strong,
Lest the times ignore them.
Why do the common people be so skillful,
Destroying rules and transforming?
Alone, steadfast and unyielding,
I wish to follow the teachings of the sages.
In a浊world, to be honored,
Is not what I desire.
Rather than be nameless and without righteousness,
I would rather be poor and maintain my integrity.

asr: 春秋逴逴而日高兮，然惆怅而自悲。四时递来而卒岁兮，阴阳不可与俪偕。白日晼晚其将入兮，明月销铄而减毁。岁忽忽而遒尽兮，老冉冉而愈弛。心摇悦而日幸兮，然怊怅而无冀。
s2tt:
Spring and autumn swiftly rise and fall,
Yet sorrow's shadow on my heart does call.
The seasons pass, the year draws to its end,
Where light and dark can never blend.
The sun declines in evening's tender glow,
The waning moon begins its wane to show.
Swift years press on, their course is nearly run,
And age advances, weakening begun.
My heart now trembles with a fleeting cheer,
Yet finds no hope to banish doubt and fear.
s2tt_r:
原文：
春秋绰绰而日高兮，
欣然惆怅而自悲。
四时递来而足岁兮，
阴阳不可与力兮。
白日晚晚其将入兮，
明月萧疏而减晦。
岁忽忽而求尽兮，
老冉冉而愈迟。
心摇悦而日幸兮，
然超畅而无际。

译文：
Spring and autumn stretch out as the sun rises high,
Joyful yet sorrowful, I feel my own sorrow.
The four seasons come and go, completing a year,
Nature's forces cannot be resisted.
The white day slowly sets,
The bright moon fades and grows dim.
Time rushes to its end,
Old age slowly but surely advances.
My heart is filled with joy and hope,
But it remains boundless and boundless.

asr: 卒壅蔽此浮云兮，下暗漠而无光。尧舜皆有所举任兮，故高枕而自适。谅无怨于天下兮，心焉取此怵惕？乘骐骥之浏浏兮，驭安用夫强策？谅城郭之不足恃兮，虽重介之何益？
s2tt_r:
原文：
足壅蔽此浮云兮，下暗漠而无光。
尧舜皆有所举任兮，顾高枕而自适。
谅吾愿于天下兮，心焉取此怵惕。
乘骐骥之留留兮，驭安用夫强策？
谅成郭之不足恃兮，虽众介之何益？

译文：
Clouds obscure this view, blocking the sun,
Darkness fills the land, no light to run.
Yao and Shun have their successors,
I rest high, content with my lot.
I wish to serve the world, my heart's desire,
Why should I be troubled by this fear?
Riding a swift steed, I journey on,
Why need a whip to guide the way?
I know a city's strength is not enough,
Even with many soldiers, what use?

asr: 原赐不肖之躯而别离兮，放游志乎云中。乘精气之抟抟兮，骛诸神之湛湛。骖白霓之習習兮，历群灵之丰丰。左硃雀之茇茇兮，右苍龙之躣躣。属雷师之阗阗兮，通飞廉之衙衙。
s2tt:
My humble self, I bid the world farewell,
To roam the clouds, where lofty spirits dwell.
On whirling ether's breath I mount the sky,
Where gods in solemn majesty pass by.
White rainbow as my team, through air I flee,
And visit all the powers that be.
On left, the Scarlet Bird with wings outspread;
On right, the Azure Dragon, serpentine led.
The Thunder God behind his chariot keeps;
The Wind God clears the way as forward sweeps.
s2tt_r:
原文：
润辞不效之趋而别离兮，放尤之乎云中。澄精气之团团兮，悟诸神之融融。惨白霓之习习兮，立群鳞之豅豅。左朱雀之拔拔兮，右苍龙之渠渠。左雷师之阗阗兮，通飞廉之呀呀。

译文：
Rhythm does not work, I depart with a different tone,
I cast my reproach into the clouds. 
The essence of the spirit gathers in a circle,
I understand the harmony of the gods. 
The white clouds flow gently,
Standing among the scales of the dragon. 
The red bird flies high,
The blue dragon moves gracefully. 
The thunder roars loudly,
The flying horses neigh.

asr: 前轻辌之锵锵兮，后辎乘之从从。载云旗之委蛇兮，扈屯骑之容容。计专专之不可化兮，原遂推而为臧。赖皇天之厚德兮，还及君之无恙！
s2tt:
Before, light carriages clang and ring;
Behind, the heavy wagons follow in train.
Cloud banners flutter, serpentine they swing;
Guarding riders surge like a rolling main.
My steadfast heart no change can ever mar,
I wish to serve and shield you from afar.
Heaven's grace profound, a blessing from above,
Returns to guard the sovereign whom I love.
s2tt_r:
前清梁之锵锵兮，后资成之丛丛。
载云旗之威仪兮，扈屯旗之融融。
既专专之不可化兮，愿岁推而为章。
赖皇天之厚德兮，还集君之无恙。

译文：
Before the clear beams resound,
Behind the assembly throng.
With flags of clouds in majesty,
Surrounded by flags in harmony.
Though steadfast and unyielding,
May the years bring peace.
Thanks to the kindness of the heavens,
May you return safe and sound.

asr: 朕幼清以廉洁兮，身服义而未沬。主此盛德兮，牵于俗而芜秽。上无所考此盛德兮，长离殃而愁苦。帝告巫阳曰：有人在下，我欲辅之。魂魄离散，汝筮予之。
s2tt:
In youth, I was pure and clean,
Devoted to justice, my soul serene.
But this noble virtue, alas, was led astray,
By worldly customs that led it to decay.
No one above could see this virtue bright,
So I suffered long, in sorrow and plight.
The Emperor told Wu Yang, with a decree:
"A man below, I wish to set free.
His soul is scattered, his spirit torn,
By divination, let it be reborn."
s2tt_r:
原文：
朕幼清以廉洁兮，
身服义而未亏。
独此圣德兮，
千余俗而无讳。
上无所考，
此圣德兮。
常离殃而愁苦。
帝告巫阳曰：
“有人在下，
我欲辅之。
魂魄离散，
汝试与之。”

译文：
I was young and clear with integrity,
My body was filled with righteousness and never lost its value.
Only this holy virtue,
Has endured for over a thousand years without any taboo.
There is no examination,
This holy virtue.
It often suffers from misfortune and sorrow.
The emperor told the witch Yang,
"Someone is below,
I want to assist them.
Their soul and spirit are scattered,
You try to help them."

asr: 巫阳对曰：掌梦，上帝其难从。若必筮予之，恐后之谢，不能复用。巫阳焉乃下招曰。魂兮归来，去君之恒干？何为四方些，舍君之乐处。而离彼不祥些！魂兮归来！
s2tt:
The Witch replied: "I'm in charge of dreams,  
The Lord's command is hard, it seems.  
If you must divine to call it back,  
I fear delay, when life you lack,  
And magic fails its former tracks."  
So down she went, the soul to summon:  
"O soul, come back! Why leave your body's haven?  
Why wander to the world's four ends,  
Forsake your joys, and meet dark trends?  
O soul, come back! Flee evil ways!"
s2tt_r:
原文：
巫阳对曰：掌梦上帝其难从。若必是与之，恐后之谢，不能复用。巫阳焉乃下招曰：魂兮归来，去君之横干，何谓四方朔？舍君之乐处而离彼不详兮，魂兮归来。

译文：
Wu Yang replied: "The Lord of Dreams is difficult to please. If we must comply with him, we fear that in the future, he will refuse and we will not be able to use him again." Wu Yang then issued a call: "Soul, return! Leave the high mountains and rivers, what is四方朔? Abandon your joyful place and depart from the ominous. Soul, return!"

asr: 蝮蛇蓁蓁，封狐千里些。雄虺九首，往来倏忽，吞人以益其心些。归来兮！不可以久淫些。魂兮归来！西方之害，流沙千里些。旋入雷渊，爢散而不可止些。幸而得脱，其外旷宇些。
s2tt:
Vipers are rampant there;
Foxes a thousand miles long roam.
Nine-headed serpents swiftly come and go,
And swallow men to feed their greedy maw.
Come back, O soul, for you cannot stay there long!
O soul, come back! In the west there is more woe
With moving sands that for a thousand miles extend!
If you were swept into the thunder’s deep,
You’d be torn into pieces without help.
Even if you should escape from such a fate,
Outside there is a barren desert plain.
s2tt_r:
原文：
蝮蛇真真，封狐千里。
雄虺九首，往来倏忽。
吞人以异其心，所归来兮，不可以久吟。
魂兮归来，西方之海，流沙千里。
悬入雷渊，弥散而不可止。
幸而得脱，其外况与。

译文：
Viper truly, fox千里封。
Nine-headed snake, swift and swift.
Devouring men to change its heart, it returns, cannot long chant.
Soul return, western sea, sands千里流。
Hanging into the abyss, spreading and unstoppable.
Lucky to escape, its outside how.

asr: 赤蚁若象，玄蜂若壶些。五谷不生，丛菅是食些。其土烂人，求水无所得些。彷徉无所倚，广大无所极些。归来兮，恐自遗贼些。魂兮归来！北方不可以止些。
s2tt_r:
原文：
赤蚁若象，玄蜂若虎。
五谷不生，丛菅是实。
其土烂人，求水无所。
蓬羊无所，广大无所。
归来兮，恐自未遂。
魂兮归来，北方不可以止。

译文：
Red ants like elephants, black bees like tigers.
No grain grows, only reed stalks fill the fields.
The soil is so rotten it eats people alive, seeking water in vain.
No shelter, no vastness, no limit.
Return, for fear you may not succeed.
Return, for the north cannot be stayed.

asr: 增冰峨峨，飞雪千里些。归来兮，不可以久些。魂兮归来，君无上天些。虎豹九关，啄害下人些。一夫九首，拔木九千些。豺狼从目，往来侁侁些。悬人以嬉，投之深渊些。
s2tt:
Ice piled high, a thousand miles of snowflakes fly.  
Return, O soul, for here you cannot stay.  
Return, O soul, do not go up to the sky.  
Nine gates are guarded by tigers and leopards sly,  
Who peck at mortal men and make them die.  
A giant with nine heads, nine thousand trees uproots;  
Wolves glare and prowl in throngs, hunting for human brutes.  
They hang men up for sport, then cast them in the deep.
s2tt_r:
