asr: 致命于帝，然后得瞑些。归来！往恐危身些。魂兮归来！君无下此幽都些。土伯九约，其角觺觺些。敦脄血拇，逐人駓駓些。参目虎首，其身若牛些。此皆甘人，归来，恐自遗灾些。
s2tt:
To God above I pray, then rest you may.
Return! Lest you should go astray.
O soul, come back from where you stray!
Go not to the Land of the Dead!
The Lord of Earth with horns on head,
And shoulders huge and sharp, you'll dread;
With bloody thumbs, to run so fast
That he will catch and hold you fast.
With tigers' heads and three eyes red,
And bodies like the bull's, 'tis said,
They feed on man. O soul, come back!
Lest you should go on wrongward track!
s2tt_r:
原文：
知命于地，然后得名所归。来往王孔，微生所。魂兮归来，君无天下，此忧都所。吐蕃九约，七角一一所。蹲眉眩目，逐人披披所。参目虎首，其身若牛所。此皆干人，归来恐自未哉所。

译文：
Know the land of destiny, then find your name's place.
Traveling between kings and sages, in the realm of the humble.
Soul, return, for you have no kingdom, this worry is your place.
Tibet's nine agreements, one with seven horns.
Squinting eyes, chasing people,披披所.
Tiger heads, eyes like参, bodies like oxen.
These are all dry people, returning, fearing self-destruction.

asr: 魂兮归来，入修门些。工祝招君，背行先些。秦篝齐缕，郑绵络些。招具该备，永啸呼些。魂兮归来，反故居些。天地四方，多贼奸些。像设君室，静闲安些。
s2tt:
O soul, come back! Enter the Southern Gate!  
The wizard calls you, walking backward in state.  
With cords of Qi and Qin basket high,  
And silken Zheng net, he calls you from the sky.  
All ready are the instruments to call  
Your soul back to your hall.  
O soul, come back! Go to your old retreat!  
In heaven and on earth and west and east,  
There're thieves and robbers, man and beast.  
Your image in your chamber's set  
In quietude and ease without regret.
s2tt_r:
魂兮归来入休门所，宫筑昭君背行先所，琴钩绮缕正绵络所，昭句该背永啸胡所，魂兮归来返故居所，天地四方多贼奸所，象设军事竞闲安所。

译文：
Soul, return to rest, enter the gate of rest,
The palace of Zhaojun, you walk behind first.
The strings of the lute, fine and soft, are entwined,
Zhao's words, profound and deep, echo in the desert.
Soul, return to your old home,
In this world, many are the thieves and traitors.
The military setup, like an elephant, is at ease.

asr: 高堂邃宇，槛层轩些。层台累榭，临高山些。网户朱缀，刻方连些。冬有穾厦，夏室寒些。川谷径复，流潺湲些。光风转蕙，氾崇兰些。经堂入奥，朱尘筵些。
s2tt:
Lofty halls and chambers deep,
With balconies tier on tier.
Tense towers and terraces steep
Stand o'er mountains high and sheer.
Vermeil doors with network bright,
Square engraved patterns in sight.
Warm abode in winter cold,
Cool retreat when summer's hot.
Winding streams through valleys hold
Murmuring water, cool or not.
Sunny breeze turns sweet grass green,
And orchids o'erflow the scene.
Through the hall to rooms you go,
Where red dust-proof mats spread.
s2tt_r:
原文：
高堂邃宇，建层轩索。层台累榭，临高山左。网户珠缀，客房连索。冬有曜厦，夏饰寒索。穿古径复，留禅园索。光风转晦，泛重澜索。经堂入奥，诸尘掩索。

译文：
High halls and deep chambers, with towering windows and balconies.
Layered terraces and pavilions, overlooking the mountains to the left.
Netted doors adorned with pearls, guest rooms connected in a line.
Winter has its bright halls, summer its cool drapes.
Ancient paths are traversed again, leaving the garden's tranquility.
Light turns to darkness, waves ripple in the vast expanse.
Through the hall, into the depths, dust and noise are concealed.

asr: 九侯淑女，多迅众些。盛鬋不同制，实满宫些。容态好比，顺弥代些。弱颜固植，謇其有意些。姱容修态，絚洞房些。蛾眉曼睩，目腾光些。靡颜腻理，遗视矊些。
s2tt:
Fair ladies nine,  
In swift array they shine.  
With varied coiffure, rich and rare,  
The palace teems, a garden fair.  
Their beauty vies,  
Unmatched 'neath skies.  
With tender face and will sincere,  
Their hearts are true and clear.  
With grace refined,  
Through inner rooms they wind.  
Their eyebrows fine, their glances bright,  
Like morning beams of light.  
Their skin so sleek, their gaze so deep,  
In silent charm they keep.
s2tt_r:
酒后淑女多训众所，盛简不同致时满宫所，容态好比舜迷带所，若言故执简其有意所，夸容修态更动房所，峨眉曼绿木藤光所，迷眼逆旅疑是免所。

译文：
After drinking, the gentlewoman often teaches the crowd,  
The elegance is different, leading to the full palace.  
Her appearance is like舜's lost belt,  
If she speaks, she holds the book tightly,  
She praises her graceful appearance, moving the room.  
Her eyebrows are green, like the light of wood and vines,  
Her eyes are blurred, as if they are free from the world.

asr: 离榭修幕，侍君之闲些。翡帷翠帐，饰高堂些。红壁沙版，玄玉梁些。仰观刻桷，画龙蛇些。坐堂伏槛，临曲池些。芙蓉始发，杂芰荷些。紫茎屏风，文缘波些。
s2tt:
The lodge and tent, with curtains fine,
Await your leisure, lord divine.
With kingfisher and emerald screen,
The lofty hall is decked serene.
The walls are red, the floor of sand,
The beams of jade black as ink stand.
Look up and see the rafters bright
With dragons and with snakes bedight.
Sit in the hall or lean on rails,
You'll see the winding pool that trails.
When lotus blooms begin to blow,
Among the leaves duckweeds still grow.
With purple stems and ripples green,
The screen-like leaves can still be seen.
s2tt_r:
离榭修木，侍君之闲所。
匪惟翠障，是高堂所。
红壁纱板，悬玉梁所。
仰观客爵，画龙蛇所。
座堂拂剑，凌曲池所。
芙蓉始发，杂既荷所。
紫金屏风，文园波所。

译文：
On the terrace, tall trees stand,
A place of leisure for the king.
Not just a green barrier,
But a high hall.
Red walls and gauze panels,
Hanging from the jade beams.
Looking up at the guests' cups,
Painted dragons and serpents.
In the hall, the sword is brushed,
Over the curved pool.
Fragrant lotus flowers begin to bloom,
Mixed with lotus leaves.
Purple and gold screens,
In the garden's waves.

asr: 肥牛之腱，臑若芳些。和酸若苦，陈吴羹些。胹鳖炮羔，有柘浆些。鹄酸臇凫，煎鸿鸧些。露鸡臛蠵，厉而不爽些。粔籹蜜饵，有餦餭些。瑶浆蜜勺，实羽觞些。
s2tt:
Fat oxen's sinews, tender and sweet,
With sour and bitter flavors meet.
Wu's broth is served, a savory treat.
Stewed turtle, roasted lamb so neat,
With cane juice, a delightful feat.
Goose cooked in sour sauce, duck in heat,
Fried swan and crane, a royal treat.
Braised chicken, turtle, flavors fleet,
Strong yet not cloying, a balance neat.
Honey cakes and sweetmeats, oh so sweet,
With sugar twists, a sugary treat.
Jade-like wine, honeyed and complete,
Fills feathered cups, a toast to greet.
s2tt_r:
原文：
肥牛之腱，尔弱方缩。
何酸若苦，陈吴耕缩。
尔鳖袍膏，有浙江缩。
胡酸减伏，兼洪昌缩。
路饥或息，力而不爽。
巨女密耳，有张黄缩。
遥江觅勺，时与商缩。

译文：
The tendons of a fat cow, so weak they shrink.
How sour and bitter, like old Wu's dried fish.
Your turtle's roe and grease, from Zhejiang's sea.
Hubei's sourness eases, with Hongchang's dried fish.
When hungry on the road, your strength remains.
A giant woman with a secret ear, has Zhang's yellow fish.
In the distant river, find a spoon, to trade with merchants.

asr: 吴歈蔡讴，奏大吕些。士女杂坐，乱而不分些。放敶组缨，班其相纷些。郑卫妖玩，来杂陈些。《激楚》之结，独秀先些。菎蔽象棋，有六簙些。分曹并进，遒相迫些。
s2tt:
Wu songs and Cai tunes, in solemn key,
Men and women mingled, wild and free.
Unloosed their sashes, caps askew,
In motley hues the revel grew.
From Zheng and Wei, with wanton art,
They brought rare charms to play their part.
The "Jichu" dance, with grace untold,
Outshone the rest, both bright and bold.
With ivory chess and bamboo dice,
Six games they played, each roll precise.
In rival groups they pressed ahead,
With eager haste the board they spread.
s2tt_r:
原文：
吾与蔡邕奏大吕朔，侍女杂坐乱而不分所。方陈祖英班棋相分所，正谓邀丸来杂陈所，机处之捷独秀先所。坤必象棋有六博所，分曹并进求相破所。

译文：
I and Cai Yong played the great tune of the month of winter, with maids sitting in disorder without distinguishing their places. Just as the ancestral image of Zhen Yu arranged chess pieces to distinguish their places, it was precisely inviting marbles to come and mix with the arrangement of places, where the swift and skillful moves stood out first. The坤必象棋 had six博places, divided into groups advancing together to seek places to break each other.

asr: 酎饮尽欢，乐先故些。魂兮归来，反故居些。乱曰。献岁发春兮，汩吾南征。菉蘋齐叶兮，白芷生。路贯庐江兮，左长薄。倚沼畦瀛兮，遥望博。青骊结驷兮，齐千乘。
s2tt:
Drink deep, let joy be full and free,
For spirits of the dead, in glee.
O soul, come back to your old nest,
And here forever take your rest.

Epilogue:
When spring begins the opening year,
I speed my way to southward drear.
Where duckweed green spreads leaf by leaf,
And angelicas grow in sheaf.
Through Luchiang my way I wend,
On left the long marsh without end.
I stand by pool and swamp and lake,
And gaze afar for old times' sake.
Four black steeds draw the cab ahead;
A thousand chariots follow tread.
s2tt_r:
原文：
昼饮径欢乐弦固索
昏夕归来反故居所
乱曰
显岁发春兮
郁吾南征
路平其夜兮
白芷生
路观庐江兮
佐长薄
以藻其盈兮
遥望薄
清丽其四兮
其甘兽

译文：
Daytime drinking brings joy,
Strings firmly strung, music flows.
Evening returns to old abode,
Restored to its former place.

Chant:
The year's beginning brings spring,
I am ready for the southern journey.
The road is clear at night,
White芷 grows.
I observe the Lüjiang,
Accompanying the long grass.
To adorn its abundance,
I gaze afar,
The clear and beautiful surroundings,
Its sweetness attracts beasts.

asr: 悬火延起兮，玄颜烝。步及骤处兮，诱骋先。抑骛若通兮，引车右还。与王趋梦兮，课后先。君王亲发兮，惮青兕。朱明承夜兮，时不可以淹。皋兰被径兮，斯路渐。
s2tt:
Torches flare and spread their light,
The sky is dyed with fiery hue.
We pace or race to keep in sight
The vanguard swift in view.
We check or urge the steeds at will,
Then turn the chariots to the right.
We follow the king o'er hill and rill,
Striving to take the lead in flight.
The king himself shoots arrow after arrow,
Frightening the rhinoceros with might.
The bright sun follows the night's shadow,
For time and tide wait for no wight.
The riverside path o'ergrown with orchid sweet
Is flooded by the water bright.
s2tt_r:
原文：
悬火炎起兮，悬炎蒸雾兮。
奏楚兮，又逞仙。
异物若通兮，引车右还。
与王屈梦兮，客后先。
君王亲发兮，但轻驷。
朱明乘夜兮，时不可与焉。
高兰被径兮，思路见。

译文：
Fire flames rise high,
Steam clouds swirl, heat thick.
In楚奏响，
仙乐飘扬。
奇异之物若通，
车右缓缓还。
与王屈梦，
客后先。
君王亲发，
但轻驷。
朱明乘夜，
时不可与焉。
高兰铺径，
思路见。

asr: 湛湛江水兮，上有枫。目极千里兮，伤春心。魂兮归来，哀江南！
s2tt:
Clear, clear the river flows,
Above it maples grow.
My eyes survey a thousand miles,
With spring my heart aches all the while.
O soul, come back to the southern shore,
Where you'll grieve no more!
s2tt_r:
原文：
阵阵江水兮上有风，
目极千里兮伤春心，
魂兮归来哀江南。

译文：
Waves of the river, with the wind above,
As far as the eye can see, my heart is filled with sorrow,
Return, my spirit, and mourn for the south of the Yangtze.

asr: 青春受谢，白日昭只。春气奋发，万物遽只。冥凌浃行，魂无逃只。魂魄归来，无远遥只。魂乎归来！无东无西，无南无北只。东有大海，溺水浟浟只。螭龙并流，上下悠悠只。
s2tt:
Youth takes its leave, the sun shines bright;
Spring stirs with vigor, all things sprout in light.
Through shades and chills the spirits roam,
No soul can flee, no spirit find a home.
O soul, return! Not far, not wide,
No east, no west, no south, no north to bide.
In eastern seas where drowning waters flow,
Dragons and serpents glide, now high, now low.
s2tt_r:
原文：
青春受谢白日昭只，
春气奋发万物俱只，
冥灵嘉行魂无逃只，
魂魄归来无远遥只，
魂乎归来无东无西，
无南无北只，
东有大海，溺水尤有只，
螭龙并流，上下悠悠只。

译文：
Spring fades, the sun shines bright,
Spring's vigor spreads, all things take flight,
The spirit of the deep travels, soul escapes not,
The spirit returns, no distance vast,
The spirit returns, no east, no west,
No south, no north, it rests,
To the east, the sea, drowning waters vast,
Cherub dragons flow, up and down, they pass.

asr: 雾雨淫淫，白皓胶只。魂乎无东，汤谷寂寥只。魂乎无南！南有炎火千里，蝮蛇蜒只。山林险隘，虎豹蜿只。鰅鳙短狐，王虺骞只。魂乎无南，蜮伤躬只。魂乎无西！
s2tt:
The misty rain is drear and dense,
The white expanse is frozen hence.
O soul, go not to eastern shore,
Where sun's hot vale is lone and poor.
O soul, go not to southern land,
Where thousand miles of fire expand,
And coiling serpents crawl on sand.
The mountain forests, steep and deep,
With tigers and leopards creep.
The fox-like fish and venomous dart,
And giant snakes that coil and start.
O soul, go not to southern plain,
Lest hidden harms thy flesh should stain.
O soul, go not to western way,
s2tt_r:
原文：
雾雨盈盈白昊交止
魂乎无东
阳谷既辽止
魂乎无南
南有炎火千里
复蛇蜒止
山林险隘
虎豹弯止
鱼泳短湖
罔毁千止
魂乎无南
欲伤弓止
魂乎无西

译文：
Mist and rain fill the vast white sky,
Soul, do not turn east.
The sun's valley is far away,
Soul, do not turn south.
Southward, a thousand miles of blazing fire,
And snakes winding their way.
The mountains and forests are perilous,
Tigers and leopards bend their claws.
Fish swim in short lakes,
Without destruction, a thousand times.
Soul, do not turn south,
Desiring to hurt the bow.
Soul, do not turn west.

asr: 西方流沙，漭洋洋只。豕首纵目，被发鬤只。长爪踞牙，诶笑狂只。魂乎无西，多害伤只。魂乎无北！北有寒山，趠龙赩只。代水不可涉，深不可测只。天白颢颢，寒凝凝只。
s2tt:
Westward the desert, vast and wide;
With boar-head fiends, fierce-eyed, hair flowing wild.
Long-clawed, sharp-toothed, they grin and laugh in glee.
O soul, go not to the west, where perils be!
O soul, go not to the north, where mountains freeze,
And crimson dragons dart through icy seas.
The River Dai none can wade, so deep and cold;
The sky is pale, the frost congealed and old.
s2tt_r:
原文：
西方流沙莽洋洋止，
石首作木披发攘指，
长爪巨牙嘻笑狂止，
浑乎无西多害伤止，
浑乎无北，北有寒山，
戳龙戏止，带水不可涉，
深不可测止，
天白浩浩，寒凝凝止。

译文：
Western sands vast and boundless,
Stone heads like wood, hair and fingers spread,
Long claws, huge teeth, laughter and rage,
Wholly without west, full of harm and danger,
Wholly without north, north has cold mountains,
Dragon play, water cannot be crossed,
Deep cannot be measured,
Heavenly white, boundless, cold and still.

asr: 魂乎无往，盈北极只。魂魄归来，闲以静只。自恣荆楚，安以定只。逞志究欲，心意安只。穷身永乐，年寿延只。魂乎归来，乐不可言只。五谷六仞，设菰梁只。
s2tt:
Soul, wander not, to the North Pole go;
Soul, come back, in quiet and calm you may grow.
In the land of Chu you may do what you will,
And be safe and secure, free from ill.
You may do what you like and enjoy your fill,
And be happy and gay, free from care and chill.
You may live long and happy, free from sorrow;
Soul, come back! You'll be happy tomorrow.
Five kinds of grain piled up six feet high,
With lotus seeds cooked in millet pie.
s2tt_r:
魂乎无妄，饮北吉止。
魂魄归来，显已静止。
字字金楚，安以定制。
惩治究狱，心意安止。
穷生永乐，年寿延止。
魂乎归来，乐不可言止。
五谷六任，社孤良止。

译文：
Soul, do not wander, drink at the North Pole and rest.
Soul and spirit return, clearly at peace and still.
Every word is precious and clear, how can it be regulated?
Punishment and investigation conclude, the heart finds peace.
Endless life brings eternal joy, longevity extends.
Soul, return, joy beyond words.
Five grains and six responsibilities, the community thrives.

asr: 鼎臑盈望，和致芳只。内鸧鸽鹄，味豺羹只。魂乎归来，恣所尝只。鲜蠵甘鸡，和楚酪只。醢豚苦狗，脍苴蒪只。吴酸蒿蒌，不沾薄只。魂兮归来，恣所择只。
s2tt: The cauldrons are filled with meat, and the aroma is fragrant. Inside are cranes, pigeons, and swans, and the flavor is like that of jackal soup. O soul, come back! Indulge in the taste you desire. Fresh turtle and sweet chicken, blended with the cheese of Chu. Pickled pork, bitter dog meat, and slices of mustard plant. Wu's sour soup of artemisia and polygonum, not too thick or thin. O soul, come back! Choose whatever you please.
s2tt_r:
原文：
鼎臑盈望，何啻方趾；
内藏歌壶，未豺狼止。
魂乎归来，自所长止。
鲜飱甘鸡，何楚酪止；
海豚苦狗，脍居炮止。
无酸蒿蒌，不沾薄止。
魂兮归来，自所托止。

译文：
A feast of roasted meat,
How vast it seems, like a square foot.
Inside, a song in a pot,
Not yet stopped by wolves.
Soul, return to your place,
Where you belong.
Fresh food, sweet chicken,
How delicious and rich.
Sea turtles, dogs, cooked and fried,
Without any sourness or bitterness.
Soul, return to your place,
Where you are at ease.

asr: 代秦郑卫，鸣竽张只。伏戏《驾辩》，楚《劳商》只。讴和《扬阿》，赵萧倡只。魂乎归来，定空桑只。二八接舞，投诗赋只。叩钟调磬，娱人乱只。四上竞气，极声变只。
s2tt:
From Qin and Zheng, from Wei and Dai,
The reed-organs blow in array.
The ancient song of Fu Xi's day,
The Chu tune of "The Laborer's Lay",
The "Sunny Bank" in chorus sung,
The Zhao flutes played by singers young.
O soul, come back to mulberry's shade!
Two rows of dancers, maid and maid,
To the songs they sing keep time.
The bells and chimes are played in rhyme,
The singers' voices interlace.
The music rises to its height,
Then sinks and fades away from sight.
s2tt_r:
原文：
代琴正位，鸣于张指。
拂系稼变，楚劳商止。
讴鹤阳阿，赵萧唱止。
魂乎归来，定空桑止。
二八接舞，投诗赋止。
叩钟调气，娱人乱止。
四上进气，即生变止。

译文：
The instrument is properly positioned,
Its sound resonates through the extended fingers.
The strings are plucked and tuned,
The melody shifts, the laborious work comes to an end.
The song of the crane in the Yang阿,
The O萧 song stops.
The soul returns, the empty sāng stops.
Two and eight dance together,
The poem is cast.
The bell is struck, the air is adjusted,
Entertaining the people, the chaos stops.
Four upward breaths, the change begins.

asr: 魂乎归来，听歌譔只。朱唇皓齿，嫭以姱只。比德好闲，习以都只。丰肉微骨，调以娱只。魂乎归来，安以舒只。嫮目宜笑，娥眉曼只。容则秀雅，稚朱颜只。
s2tt: O soul, come back! Listen to the song and verse! With vermeil lips and shining teeth, the lovely maid is fair. With virtue and good sense, she's trained in mien and air. With flesh so soft and bones so fine, she's pleasing to the sight. O soul, come back! You'll feel at ease and quiet. With beaming eyes and smiling face, her eyebrows arch like bow. Her features are refined and fair, her face like flower's blow.
s2tt_r:
魂乎归来听歌啭之
朱唇皓齿互以夸之
彼得好贤习以都之
丰肉微骨调以愉之
魂乎归来安以舒之
顾目一笑蛾眉曼之
容则秀雅致朱颜之

asr: 魂乎归来，静以安只。姱修滂浩，丽以佳只。曾颊倚耳，曲眉规只。滂心绰态，姣丽施只。小腰秀颈，若鲜卑只。魂乎归来，思怨移只。易中利心，以动作只。
s2tt: O soul, come back to quiet and peace! Fair, virtuous, honest, good and wise, with rounded cheek and ear well set, curved brow as if by compass drawn, with heart sincere and graceful mien, O soul, come back to beauty's land! With slender waist and swan-like neck, like the fair maiden of the north, O soul, come back and banish woe! With winning ways and artless heart, O soul, come back and go no more!
s2tt_r:
魂乎归来，敬弭安止。
夸修潘好，丽以嘉止。
层颊颐耳，趋眉归止。
怦心绰态，娇丽失止。
小腰秀髻，若仙卑止。
魂乎归来，思怨以止。
意中立心，以动作止。

译文：
Return, spirit, and rest in peace,
With beauty and grace, you are free.
With cheeks and ears, you move with ease,
Your heart and form, a gentle breeze.
With slender waist and hair so neat,
Like a fairy, you are complete.
Return, spirit, and let your thoughts cease,
In your heart, let your actions be complete.

asr: 夏屋广大，沙堂秀只。南房小坛，观绝霤只。曲屋步壛，宜扰畜只。腾驾步游，猎春囿只。琼轂错衡，英华假只。茝兰桂树，郁弥路只。魂乎归来，恣志虑只。
s2tt:
The house in summer is wide and great,  
With sandalwood hall beautiful and high.  
In southern rooms there’re altars small,  
And eaves are out of sight.  
The winding rooms and corridors  
Are fit to raise beasts tame.  
Driving or walking, you may go  
Hunting in spring garden.  
With jeweled wheels and inlaid yoke,  
The carriage looks like a flower.  
The orchid sweet and fragrant trees  
Grow thick along the way.  
O soul, come back to enjoy your will  
And do what you think fit!
s2tt_r:
原文：
下屋广大，纱堂绣纸，南房小榻，官爵六指，屈屋不言，疑扰絮纸，藤架布游，列春柚纸，穷谷错横，英华古纸，采兰桂树，玉弥露纸，浑呼归来，自治律纸。

译文：
Large under the house, gauze hall embroidered paper, small bed in the southern room, official six fingers, curved house silent, doubtful disturbing paper, vine架子布游, spring pear paper, deep valley staggered, ancient paper, picking orchid tree, jade covered dew paper, all call return, self-made law paper.

asr: 孔雀盈园，畜鸾皇只！鵾鸿群晨，杂鶖鸧只。鸿鹄代游，曼骕驦只。魂乎归来，凤凰翔只。曼泽怡面，血气盛只。永宜厥身，保寿命只。室家盈廷，爵禄盛只。
s2tt:
Peacocks fill the garden, phoenixes are kept in sight;
At dawn cranes cry in flocks, with mallards black and white.
Swans swim in throngs, and steeds run with delight.
O soul, come back! The phoenix is in flight.
Your face is full of grace, your blood is full of might.
You should keep fit and live long, enjoying your life bright.
Your house is full of kin, your rank and pay are high.
Your soul should come back home and stay!
s2tt_r:
孔雀营园蓄鸾凰，
鲲鸿群臣杂秋苍。
鸿鹄带游漫宿霜，
鸿鹄归来凤凰翔。
漫泽一面血气盛，
永贻绝身保寿命。
世家营庭爵禄盛，
永贻绝身保寿命。

asr: 魂乎归来，居室定只。接径千里，出若云只。三圭重侯，听类神只。察笃夭隐，孤寡存只。魂兮归来，正始昆只。田邑千畛，人阜昌只。美冒众流，德泽章只。
s2tt:
O soul, come back! Your home is here.
A thousand miles of paths appear,
Where clouds of men come and go.
Three nobles, lords of high degree,
Attend like spirits, wise and free.
They care for orphans, widows, old,
And all the poor and weak uphold.
O soul, come back! Begin anew!
A thousand fields stretch in your view,
Where people thrive in peace and cheer.
Your virtue spreads far and near,
Enlightening all, both far and near.
s2tt_r:
魂乎归来，居世定止。
接近千里，出若云止。
三归重侯，听类神止。
茶赌邀饮，孤寡存止。
魂兮归来，正使昆止。
田役千整，人复昌止。
美貌众留，德泽张止。

译文：
Soul, return, and rest in peace,
In this world, your journey cease.
A thousand miles, you've traveled far,
Like clouds, you've left your mark.
Three returns, you've found your home,
Heaven's voice, you've heard it's calm.
A tea bet, a drink you seek,
Alone, you've found your peace.
Soul, return, and find your way,
Your journey's end, you'll stay.
A thousand fields, you've worked with care,
Your people, they've flourished there.
Your beauty, they've cherished much,
Your virtues, they've spread like such.

asr: 先威后文，善美明只。魂乎归来，赏罚当只。名声若日，照四海只。德誉配天，万民理只。北至幽陵，南交阯只。西薄羊肠，东穷海只。魂乎归来，尚贤士只。
s2tt:
First awe, then grace, the rule is bright.  
O soul, come back, reward aright.  
Fame like the sun shines far and near;  
Virtue like heaven rules without fear.  
From north to south, from east to west,  
Your power spreads, by all confessed.  
O soul, come back, where sages rest.
s2tt_r:
原文：
先威后文，善美民止。
魂乎归来，赏罚当止。
民生若日，照四海止。
德欲配天，万民离止。
北至幽陵，南交趾止。
西薄扬长，东穷海止。
魂乎归来，尚贤事止。

译文：
Before power comes, words are wise,
For the people's welfare, beauty thrives.
Return, spirit, and let rewards and penalties cease,
For life is like the sun, shining across the seas.
Desire virtue to match the heavens,
And the people will be at peace.
Northward to the distant land,
Southward to the southern coast.
Westward to the Yangtze's length,
Eastward to the sea's end.
Return, spirit, and let virtue be the highest goal.

asr: 发政献行，禁苛暴只。举杰压陛，诛讥罢只。直赢在位，近禹麾只。豪杰执政，流泽施只。魂乎来归，国家为只。雄雄赫赫，天德明只。三公穆穆，登降堂只。
s2tt:
Decrees are issued, good deeds done,
Harshness and violence are shunned.
The wise are placed near the throne,
Slanderers are overthrown.
The upright hold the state affairs,
Like Yu the Great, the king appears.
The heroes rule with might and main,
Their kindness spreads like timely rain.
O soul, come back to rule the land,
The state will prosper in your hand.
The state is glorious and bright,
Heavenly virtue sheds its light.
The three grand dukes in harmony
Ascend and leave the hall with glee.
s2tt_r:
原文：
发政献刑，竞苛暴之。举节压币，诛积疲之。职盈在位，禁与徽之。豪杰执政，流则施之。鸿乎来归，国家谓之。熊熊赫赫，天得民之。三公穆穆，登降堂之。

译文：
Implementing policies and enforcing laws,
Competing for harsh and tyrannical measures.
Raising standards and suppressing currency,
Eliminating the accumulation of the weak.
Occupying positions and filling roles,
Prohibiting and restricting the powerful.
Heraldic figures in governance,
Flowing like a river, spreading widely.
Greatly returning, the nation is called.
Bearish and majestic, heaven gains the people's trust.
Three high officials, solemn and dignified,
Ascending and descending the hall.

asr: 诸侯毕极，立九卿只。昭质既设，大侯张只。执弓挟矢，揖辞让只。魂乎来归，尚三王只。
s2tt:
All lords have come to the court,
Nine ministers are set.
The target is displayed,
The great mark is arrayed.
Bows and arrows in hand,
They bow and yield command.
O soul, come back to see
The kings of the three dynasties.
s2tt_r:
诸侯毕集，历久亲旨，昭至既赦，大侯张旨，职公协史，依辞让之，浑乎来归，上三王旨。
译文：
Kings and princes gather, long and close,
Their wills are made clear, their hearts are at ease.
The great lords expand their views,
Their duties and histories align,
Following the way of courtesy and respect,
They return in harmony, to the three kings' command.

asr: 苍然暮色，自远而至，至无所见，而犹不欲归。心凝形释，与万化冥合。然后知吾向之未始游，游于是乎始。故为之文以志。是岁，元和四年也。
s2tt:
The dusk in azure hue
From far to near doth creep,
Till all fades out of view,
Yet I'm not homeward-bound.
My soul from form is freed,
With Nature's soul to blend.
I know I've never found
Such joy as here and now.
So I write this essay down.
The fourth year of Yuanhe reign.
s2tt_r:
原文：
苍然暮色，自远而至，至无所见而犹不欲归。心凝形释，与万化冥合。然后知吾向之未始游，游于是乎始。故为之文以志。是岁，元和四年也。

译文：
Dawn breaks, the light grows dim,
From far and wide, it comes to him,
Till all is gone, yet he does not wish to leave.
His heart is still, his form released,
In harmony with the world, he merges.
Only then does he know his journey has just begun,
A new beginning, a fresh start.
So he writes this poem to commemorate.
This year, the year of Yuanhe, the fourth year.

asr: 皇天之不纯命兮，何百姓之震愆？民离散而相失兮，方仲春而东迁。去故乡而就远兮，遵江夏以流亡。出国门而轸怀兮，甲之鼂吾以行。发郢都而去闾兮，怊荒忽其焉极？
s2tt:
Heaven's will is fickle, O why should it be
To afflict the people with misery?
Families are scattered, O kin from kin,
In early spring to the east driven.
Leaving our homeland for a distant place,
We go in exile along riverside.
Out of the capital, O with heavy heart,
At daybreak from home we start.
Leaving the capital, O our native place,
We go in exile, O we know not where.
s2tt_r:
黄天之不纯命兮，何百姓之震愆。
民离散而相失兮，方仲春而东迁。
去故乡而就远兮，遵江夏以流亡。
出国门而轸怀兮，假之昭吾以行。
八引督而趣驴兮，超荒忽其焉极。

译文：
The heavens are unjust, how can the people be at fault?
People are scattered and lost, fleeing eastward in mid-spring.
Leaving home for distant lands, following the river to exile.
Leaving the country门 with sorrow, guiding me to proceed.
Eight leaders urge the donkey, beyond the wilderness, where will they lead?

asr: 凌阳侯之氾滥兮，忽翱翔之焉薄。心絓结而不解兮，思蹇产而不释。将运舟而下浮兮，上洞庭而下江。去终古之所居兮，今逍遥而来东。羌灵魂之欲归兮，何须臾而忘反。
s2tt:
On waves of Yang Hou I drift and roam,
Where shall I hover, where find a home?
My heart is knotted with grief untold;
My thoughts are tangled, my mind can't hold.
I sail my boat down the stream with ease,
Now up the lake, now down I please.
I leave the land where my forebears lie,
And eastward float 'neath the open sky.
My soul yearns for home from day to day;
How can I forget to come back, pray?
s2tt_r:
原文：
羚羊哀鸣，泛滥兮；
孤鸿哀鸣，淹泊兮。
心挂结而不解兮，
思剪缠而不适。
将运舟而下浮兮，
上洞庭而下江兮，
去钟鼓之所居兮，
今逍遥而来东兮，
将灵魂之欲归兮，
何须鱼而忘返兮。

译文：
The deer's lament, overflowing,
The solitary goose's cry, lost.
My heart is entangled, untied,
My thoughts are entangled, at ease.
I will sail down the river,
Up to Dongting, down to the river,
Away from the place of drums and gongs,
Now at ease, coming from the east,
My soul's desire returns,
Why need fish forget to return?

asr: 背夏浦而西思兮，哀故都之日远。登大坟以远望兮，聊以舒吾忧心。哀州土之平乐兮，悲江介之遗风。当陵阳之焉至兮，淼南渡之焉如？曾不知夏之为丘兮，孰两东门之可芜？
s2tt:
Westward I gaze from summer shore,
My old capital I deplore.
On high mound I stand to see,
To ease my heart in misery.
Fair land spreads far and wide in view,
But old customs bid adieu.
Where can I go o'er Southern Stream?
Like floating weed I drift and dream.
Who knows the palace in decay?
Why ruined are the gates in disarray?
s2tt_r:
原文：
背下普而西思兮，哀故都之日远。
登大坟以望远兮，聊以舒吾忧心。
哀周土之平乐兮，悲将戒之遗风。
当陵阳之烟至兮，渺难渡之烟如。
曾不知夏之为秋兮，孰两东门之可无。

译文：
Bearing the weight of the past,
I look westward, mourning the distance.
Ascending the great graves, I gaze afar,
Seeking solace for my troubled heart.
Alas, the land of Zhou is peaceful and joyful,
But I mourn the lost customs of the past.
As the smoke of Lingyang approaches,
The distant mist is hard to cross.
I once knew not that summer was autumn,
And who could say that the two eastern gates are without?

asr: 乱曰。曼余目以流观兮，冀一反之何时？鸟飞反故乡兮，狐死必首丘。信非吾罪而弃逐兮，何日夜而忘之？
s2tt:
The Epilogue:
I gaze afar, my eyes roam free,
When shall I see my home again?
Birds fly back to their old nest, see;
Foxes die on the mound they love.
It's not my fault that I'm exiled.
How can I forget day and night?
s2tt_r:
原文：
乱曰：蔓于木与流，观兮既已反之何时？鸟飞反故乡兮，虎死必首丘，信非吾罪而弃逐兮，何日夜而忘之？

译文：
Final words:蔓延于树木与水流，观此景象，何时才能返回？鸟儿飞回故乡，虎儿死于故土，信非我有罪而被放逐，何日才能忘却？

asr: 邑中园亭，仆皆为赋此词。一日，独坐停云，水声山色，竞来相娱。意溪山欲援例者，遂作数语，庶几仿佛渊明思亲友之意云。甚矣吾衰矣。怅平生、交游零落，只今余几！
s2tt:
In my garden I've written this verse for each bower.
Sitting alone by the cloud-stopping tower,
I'm amused by hills and rills.
They seem to invite me to write as I will.
I'll write a few lines to show my longing for friends.
Alas! I'm old and weak. How many friends
Are left to share with me
The lonely life I see?
s2tt_r:
译文：
In the garden of the central courtyard, the grass has not yet been mowed.
This day, sitting alone in the pavilion, the water and mountains seem to be in harmony.
I miss my friends and relatives, as if I were in a dream.
I am old, and my strength is failing.
I sing of my life, and my friends are scattered.
Only a few are left with me now.

asr: 白发空垂三千丈，一笑人间万事。问何物、能令公喜？我见青山多妩媚，料青山见我应如是。情与貌，略相似。一尊搔首东窗里。想渊明、停云诗就，此时风味。
s2tt:
White hair hangs in vain, three thousand feet long;  
A single smile dismisses all worldly wrong.  
What can bring you delight, pray?  
I see the green hills so fair and gay,  
And they see me the same way.  
In feeling and in looks, we are akin.  
A cup in hand, by east window I scratch my chin,  
Thinking of the poet who wrote of clouds with ease,  
Just in the mood as his, I feel the breeze.
s2tt_r:
原文：
白发空垂三千丈，
一笑人间万事。
问何物能令公喜？
我见青山多妩媚，
料青山见我应如是。
情与貌，略相似。
一尊搔首东窗里，
想渊明停云诗就，
此时风味。

译文：
White hair hangs down three thousand feet,
A smile on the world's affairs.
What can make you so glad?
I see the mountains as charming,
And料the mountains see me as such.
Feelings and appearance, somewhat alike.
In the east window, I scratch my head,
Thinking of Tao Yuanming's poem,
This moment's flavor.

asr: 江左沉酣求名者，岂识浊醪妙理。回首叫、云飞风起。不恨古人吾不见，恨古人不见吾狂耳。知我者，二三子。
s2tt:
In Jiangzuo, fame-seekers drown in wine,
Who know the truth of spirits fine?
I turn my head, clouds fly, winds roar.
I don't regret not seeing ancients of yore,
But regret they can't see my madness more.
Those who know me are but two or three.
s2tt_r:
江左沉酣求名者，岂识浊醪妙理。回首叫，云飞风起，不恨古人吾不见，恨古人不见吾狂耳。知我者二三子。

译文：
In Jiangsu, those who are intoxicated by fame, 
How can they understand the profound essence of wine? 
Looking back, the clouds soar and the wind blows, 
I do not lament that ancient sages did not see me, 
But that ancient sages did not see my madness. 
A few of my friends understand me.

asr: 群山万壑赴荆门，生长明妃尚有村。一去紫台连朔漠，独留青冢向黄昏。画图省识春风面，环珮空归夜月魂。千载琵琶作胡语，分明怨恨曲中论。
s2tt:
O'er countless hills and streams to Jingmen flows,
Where once a fair princess was born and bred.
She left the royal house for northern snows,
And left her tomb alone with grass o'er spread.
Could the monarch have seen her rosy face?
Could he hear her tinkling ornaments in space?
Her lute still tells her woe in northern tongue,
And her resentment seems e'er to be sung.
s2tt_r:
原文：
群山万壑赴荆门，
生长明妃尚有村。
一去紫台连朔漠，
独留青冢向黄昏。
画图省识春风面，
环佩空归夜月魂。
千载琵琶作胡语，
分明怨恨曲中论。

译文：
Millions of mountains and valleys rush to Jingmen,
The village of the bright concubine still remains.
Gone to the northern desert from the purple court,
Leaving only a green tomb facing the twilight.
The spring face is recognized in a painted portrait,
Jade bracelets return to the soul in the moonlit night.
A thousand years of pipa play in a foreign language,
Clearly expressing the hatred in the music.

asr: 置酒高殿上，亲交从我游。中厨办丰膳，烹羊宰肥牛。秦筝何慷慨，齐瑟和且柔。阳阿奏奇舞，京洛出名讴。乐饮过三爵，缓带倾庶羞。主称千金寿，宾奉万年酬。
s2tt_r:
原文：
置酒高殿上，亲交从我游。
中厨办丰膳，烹羊宰肥牛。
琴筝和慷慨，起色和且柔。
杨阿奏其舞，京洛出名讴。
乐饮过三爵，缓带轻絺褌。
主称千金寿，宾奉万年酬。

译文：
On the high hall, wine is laid,
With close friends, we roam and play.
In the kitchen, feasts are spread,
Cooking lamb, and beef is fed.
The zither and the lute, in tune,
With soft and graceful tones we tune.
Young Faye performs her dance,
From the capital, her song is found.
Drinking three glasses, we are glad,
With loose robes, we feel the day.
The host proclaims a golden birthday,
The guest offers a thousand-year cheer.

asr: 久要不可忘，薄终义所尤。谦谦君子德，磬折欲何求。惊风飘白日，光景驰西流。盛时不可再，百年忽我遒。生存华屋处，零落归山丘。先民谁不死，知命复何忧？
s2tt:
Old vows should not be forgot,
Light ends are what virtue blots.
A noble man with modest grace,
Bows low, what more does he embrace?
Swift winds sweep the sun's bright ray,
Time speeds westward, night to day.
Prime years will not come again,
A hundred years soon wane.
We dwell in mansions grand and high,
Then fall to hills where we shall lie.
Who of the ancients did not die?
Knowing fate, why should we sigh?
s2tt_r:
原文：
酒要不可忘，我忠义所由。
千千君子德，庆哲欲何求。
清风飘白日，光景驰西流。
盛时不可再，百年忽我求。
生存华屋处，零落归山丘。
先民谁不死，知命复何忧。

译文：
Wine must not be forgotten,
My loyalty and righteousness remain.
A thousand gentlemen's virtues,
What more can I seek in wisdom?

Breezes carry the white sun,
Time flows swiftly westward.
The golden age cannot return,
A hundred years pass swiftly.

Living in splendid houses,
I return to the mountains in decay.
Who among the ancients did not die?
Knowing one's fate, what more is there to worry about?

asr: 绿眼胡鹰踏锦鞲，五花骢马白貂裘。往来三市无人识，倒把金鞭上酒楼。
s2tt:
Green-eyed falcon on broidered glove,
Dappled steed in white sable robe.
Through three markets none knows the man,
Gold whip reversed, he mounts the wine-shop.
s2tt_r:
原文：
绿眼胡鹰踏锦沟，
五花骢马白貂裘。
往来三市无人识，
倒把金鞭上酒楼。

译文：
Green-eyed hawk leaps on silk-lined ditch,
Five-spotted horse in white fur coat.
Unrecognized in bustling markets,
Reversing the golden whip to ascend the wine tower.

asr: 君子阳阳，簧执簧，右招我由房。其乐只且！君子陶陶，左执翿，右招我由敖。其乐只且！
s2tt:
My lord looks free and gay,
With a flute in hand so gay.
He calls me to join the feast.
What a pleasure to the least!
My lord looks glad and gay,
With a plume in hand so gay.
He calls me to join the dance.
What a pleasure to enhance!
s2tt_r:
君子洋洋，左执黄，右招我游房，其乐只居。君子陶陶，左执道，右招我游敖，其乐只居。

译文：
A gentleman walks with grace,
Left hand holds a yellow object,
Right hand beckons me to his chamber,
Our joy abounds in this place.
A gentleman smiles with content,
Left hand holds a path,
Right hand beckons me to his play,
Our joy abounds in this place.

asr: 天津三月时，千门桃与李。朝为断肠花，暮逐东流水。前水复后水，古今相续流。新人非旧人，年年桥上游。鸡鸣海色动，谒帝罗公侯。月落西上阳，余辉半城楼。
s2tt:
In March in Tianjin, peach and plum blossoms grace each door,  
At dawn they break the heart, by dusk they drift on streams no more.  
Wave follows wave, as time flows on from ancient days to new,  
New faces come and old ones go, on bridges year by year in view.  
At cockcrow, dawn tints the sea, lords seek the emperor's grace,  
The moon sets o'er the west palace, its glow lights half the place.
s2tt_r:
原文：
天津三月时，千门桃与李。
朝为断肠花，暮逐东流水。
前水复后水，古今相续流。
新人非旧人，年年桥上游。
鸡鸣海色动，夜递罗公好。
月落西上阳，余晖半城楼。

译文：
In Tianjin, March arrives,
A thousand doors bloom with peach and plum.
Morning flowers are heartbreakers,
Evening they follow the eastward stream.
Front water meets back water,
Ancient and modern flow together.
New people are not old ones,
Year after year, they walk on the bridge.
Cocks crow, sea colors stir,
Night passes, the罗公loves well.
The moon sets, West Yang rises,
Half the city's glow remains.

asr: 衣冠照云日，朝下散皇州。鞍马如飞龙，黄金络马头。行人皆辟易，志气横嵩丘。入门上高堂，列鼎错珍羞。香风引赵舞，清管随齐讴。七十紫鸳鸯，双双戏庭幽。
s2tt:
Robes and caps gleam like sunlit cloud;
From court they scatter, proud and loud.
Their steeds like dragons prance and leap,
With golden bridles, arching neck.
All wayfarers aside must sweep,
Their spirit soars o'er peaks so steep.
They enter halls with lofty dome,
Where tripods rare and dainties roam.
Sweet breezes guide Zhao's dance so fair,
Clear pipes accompany Qi's air.
Seventy purple lovebirds bright,
In pairs they play in courtyard's light.
s2tt_r:
衣冠照云日，朝下散黄州。
鞍马如飞龙，黄金络马头。
行人皆避易，志气横松丘。
入门上高堂，列鼎错珍羞。
香风引赵舞，清管随风讴。
七十子鸳鸯，双双戏庭幽。

译文：
Clothing and hat reflect the sun and clouds,
As they descend to Huangzhou in the morning.
Horses and saddles resemble flying dragons,
With gold adorning their heads.
Passersby all avoid them,
Their spirit and courage filling the hills.
Entering the door, they ascend to the high hall,

asr: 行乐争昼夜，自言度千秋。功成身不退，自古多愆尤。黄犬空叹息，绿珠成衅雠。何如鸱夷子，散发棹扁舟。
s2tt:
Revelry vies with day and night,
Boasting to span a thousand years' flight.
Yet when success is won, retreat they spurn,
Since ancient times, from this, troubles often turn.
The yellow hound but heaves a futile sigh,
Green Pearl becomes a feuding enemy.
How better to be like the hermit wise,
With loosened hair, a skiff to row, under open skies.
s2tt_r:
行乐争昼夜，自言度千秋。
功成身不退，自古多千愁。
黄犬空叹息，绿珠成戏虫。
何如痴一子，散发棹扁舟。

译文：
Strive day and night for joy,
Claiming a thousand years of life.
With success comes no retreat,
For ages, sorrow multiplies.
A yellow dog sighs in vain,
A green insect becomes a toy.
Why not be a foolish child,
With loose hair, rowing a small boat?

asr: 孤兰生幽园，众草共芜没。虽照阳春晖，复悲高秋月。飞霜早淅沥，绿艳恐休歇。若无清风吹，香气为谁发。
s2tt:
A lonely orchid in secluded garden grows,
Amidst wild weeds its grace it scarcely shows.
Though bathed in springtime sun's warm, golden light,
It grieves beneath the autumn moon so bright.
Early frost descends with a rustling sound,
Its emerald splendor fears to fade to ground.
Without a gentle breeze to waft its scent,
For whom shall its sweet fragrance be sent?
s2tt_r:
孤兰生幽园，众草共芜没。
虽照阳春晖，复悲高秋月。
飞霜早淅沥，绿艳恐休歇。
若无清风吹，香气为谁发。
译文：
A lone orchid grows in a secluded garden,
Amidst weeds and grass, it's hidden and unseen.
Though it basks in the spring's warm glow,
It mourns the autumn moon's sorrow.
Early frost falls, the green leaves fear to fade,
Without the gentle breeze, its fragrance will be in vain.

asr: 弃我去者，昨日之日不可留。乱我心者，今日之日多烦忧。长风万里送秋雁，对此可以酣高楼。蓬莱文章建安骨，中间小谢又清发。俱怀逸兴壮思飞，欲上青天揽明月。
s2tt_r:
原文：
弃我去者，昨日之日不可留；
乱我心者，今日之日多烦忧。
长风万里送秋雁，对此可以酣高楼。
蓬莱文章建安骨，中间小谢又清发。
俱怀逸兴壮思飞，欲上青天揽明月。

译文：
Gone are the days of yesterday, lost to me;
Today's troubles trouble my heart, many and deep.
A thousand miles of wind carries autumn geese,
Here, I may feast on wine and revel.
Penglai's writings, like the bones of Jian'an,
In the middle, Xiao Xie's clear and fresh.
With aspirations soaring, thoughts flying high,
I wish to ascend to the blue sky and grasp the bright moon.

asr: 抽刀断水水更流，举杯消愁愁更愁。人生在世不称意，明朝散发弄扁舟。
s2tt:
Draw sword to cut the stream, the stream will flow;
Drink wine to drown your woe, the woe will grow.
If in this world we cannot have our way,
Why not tomorrow sail in boat away?
s2tt_r:
原文：
抽刀断水水更流，举杯消愁愁更愁。人生在世不称意，明朝散发弄扁舟。

译文：
Draw a knife to cut the flowing water, the water flows even more. Raise a cup to dispel sorrow, sorrow grows even deeper. Life in this world is not to one's liking, tomorrow let loose the hair and play with the small boat.

asr: 鹤鸣于九皋，声闻于野。鱼潜在渊，或在于渚。乐彼之园，爰有树檀，其下维萚。它山之石，可以为错。鹤鸣于九皋，声闻于天。鱼在于渚，或潜在渊。乐彼之园，爰有树檀，其下维榖。
s2tt:
Cranes cry o'er marshlands wide,
Their voice o'er wilds doth glide.
Fish lurk in deeps profound,
Or swim near shoaly ground.
That garden fair I prize,
Where sandal trees arise,
With fallen leaves below.
Stones from far hills we know
Can grind and polish bright.
Cranes cry o'er marshlands high,
Their voice ascends the sky.
Fish swim near shoaly strand,
Or lurk in depth's command.
That garden fair I prize,
Where sandal trees arise,
With paper mulberries near.
Stones from far hills appear
Can sharpen tools with care.
s2tt_r:
原文：
鹤鸣于九皋，声闻于野。鱼潜在渊，或在于渚。乐彼之园，爰有树檀，其下维萚。他山之石，可以为错。
鹤鸣于九皋，声闻于天。鱼在于渚，或潜在渊。乐彼之园，爰有树檀，其下维榖。

译文：
A crane calls from the ninth marsh,
Its voice heard far and wide.
Fish hide in the deep abyss,
Or rest on the sandy shore.
In that garden's joyous sight,
Tall trees stand, their leaves bright.
Beneath them, the fallen leaves lie,
And stones from distant hills, a fine array.

A crane calls from the ninth marsh,
Its voice heard high in the sky.
Fish rest on the sandy shore,
Or hide in the deep abyss.
In that garden's joyous sight,
Tall trees stand, their leaves bright.
Beneath them, the fallen leaves lie,
And stones from distant hills, a fine array.

asr: 而今才道当时错，心绪凄迷。红泪偷垂，满眼春风百事非。情知此后来无计，强说欢期。一别如斯，落尽梨花月又西。
s2tt:
Now I know how wrong I was then,
My heart is lost in grief again.
My rosy cheeks with tears are stained;
Spring wind brings nothing but pain.
I know we cannot meet again,
In vain I say we will. O when
Can I forget the parting day
When pear blossoms fall and the moon slants away?
s2tt_r:
原文：
而今才道当时错，心绪凄迷。红泪偷垂，满眼春风百事非。情知此后来无计，强说欢期。一别如斯，落尽梨花月又西。

译文：
Now I speak of my past mistake, my heart is filled with sorrow. Tears are secretly shed, as the spring breeze fills my eyes, and everything seems different. I know that in the future, there will be no way to change this, so I force myself to speak of our happy time. After this parting, like the falling of pear blossoms, the moon has moved westward.

asr: 碧云天，黄花地，西风紧，北雁南飞。晓来谁染霜林醉，总是离人泪。
s2tt:
Azure sky,
Yellow earth spread,
West wind keen,
Northward geese southward fly.
Who at dawn dyes frosty woods in red?
Always in tears the parting eye.
s2tt_r:
原文：
碧云天，黄花地，西风紧，北雁南飞。晓来谁染霜林醉？总是离人泪。

译文：
Blue sky, yellow flowers, autumn wind tight,
Northern geese flying southward, the dawn's light.
Who stained the frosty trees so red?
Always the tears of parting lovers.

asr: 挞彼殷武，奋伐荆楚。深入其阻，裒荆之旅。有截其所，汤孙之绪。维女荆楚，居国南乡。昔有成汤，自彼氐羌，莫敢不来享，莫敢不来王。曰商是常。天命多辟，设都于禹之绩。
s2tt:
Against Yin's martial might,  
Chu's lands were put to flight.  
Through perils deep they pressed,  
And quelled the foe's unrest.  
Their conquests stood complete,  
By Tang's descendant's feat.  
O Chu, in southern reign,  
Recall the ancient strain:  
When Tang held sovereign sway,  
From Di and Qiang away,  
None dared withhold their due,  
Nor royal homage eschew,  
Declaring Shang their stay.  
Heaven's will, diverse and grand,  
Built capitals on Yu's land.
s2tt_r:
原文：
挞彼殷武，奋伐荆楚。深入其阻，投其奔旅。有截其壄，汤孙之绪。维女荆楚，居国南乡。昔有成汤，自彼氐羌，莫敢不来享，莫敢不来王。曰商世长，天命多辟，设都于殷，于伊之即。

译文：
Tiger-like, the mighty殷武，
Fiercely fought against the荆楚。
Deep into their strongholds,
They pursued the fleeing troops.
Their defenses were cut,
The legacy of Tang's descendants.
You, the people of荆楚,
Reside in the southern lands.
Once upon a time, there was Tang,
From the氐羌, no one dared to resist,
No one dared to come and pay homage,
No one dared to come and be king.
They said the Tang dynasty was long,
And the destiny was vast and varied,
So they established their capital in殷,
In the land of伊, they took their place.

asr: 岁事来辟，勿予祸适，稼穑匪解。天命降监，下民有严。不僭不滥，不敢怠遑。命于下国，封建厥福。商邑翼翼，四方之极。赫赫厥声，濯濯厥灵。寿考且宁，以保我后生。
s2tt:
The year's affairs come to be ruled,
Let no misfortune be enticed.
In farming, never be remiss.
Heaven's decree descends to inspect,
The people below show respect.
No excess, no abuse, no slack,
No leisure dare they ever take.
To the lands below the decree,
Establish blessings, firm and free.
The Shang capital stands in grace,
A model for each distant place.
Its fame resounds, illustrious, bright,
Its spirit shines with purest light.
Long life and peace it shall bestow,
To guard our offspring's future glow.
s2tt_r:
碎石来避，勿与过辙。稼穑匪懈，天命降艰。下民有言，不见不烂，不敢怠遑。命于夏国，封建厥服。商邑翼翼，四方之极。赫赫厥声，灼灼厥灵。受考且宁，以保我后生。

译文：
Broken stones to avoid, do not cross the track.
Farming is not easy, the heavens send hardship.
The people speak, unseen and unbroken, dare not slacken.
Commanded in the land of summer, establish their service.
The merchant city is orderly, the four directions' limit.
Its voice is resounding, its spirit is bright.
With examination and peace, to protect our descendants.

asr: 陟彼景山，松柏丸丸。是断是迁，方斫是虔。松桷有梴，旅楹有闲，寝成孔安。
s2tt:
Upon the lofty mountain high,
The pines and cypresses stand nigh.
We cut and move with pious care,
And shape with skill beyond compare.
The beams are straight, the pillars grand,
The temple rises o'er the land.
Now rests the spirit, calm and deep,
In hallowed peace, eternal sleep.
s2tt_r:
原文：
置彼南山，松柏丸丸。
是段是迁，方卓是干。
松桷有梴，旅楹有闲。
寝成孔安。

译文：
Place the mountain south, pine and cypress round.
Sections and migrations, square and tall.
Pine beams with length, guest pillars with space.
Sleeping chamber complete, peaceful and safe.

asr: 七月流火，九月授衣。一之日觱发，二之日栗烈。无衣无褐，何以卒岁。三之日于耜，四之日举趾。同我妇子，馌彼南亩，田畯至喜。七月流火，九月授衣。春日载阳，有鸣仓庚。
s2tt:
In seventh moon the Fire Star west glows;
In ninth moon winter clothes we sew.
When first days come, the wind blows cold;
When second days come, frost takes hold.
Without warm clothes of hair or grass,
How can we pass the year, alas!
In third moon we plow fields with share;
In fourth moon we go forth with bare.
My wife and children bring us food
To southern acre, where our lord
Is glad to see the harvest good.
In seventh moon the Fire Star west glows;
In ninth moon winter clothes we sew.
When spring days grow warm and long,
We hear orioles sing their song.
s2tt_r:
原文：
七月流火，九月授衣。一之日觱发，二之日栗烈。无衣无褐，何以卒岁？三之日于耜，四之日举趾。同我妇子，馌彼南亩，田畯至喜。七月流火，九月授衣。春日载阳，有鸣仓庚。

译文：
In July, the fire of the sun descends,
In September, garments are bestowed. 
On the first day, the wind blows cold,
On the second, the frost is strong. 
Without clothes or fur, how survive the year?
On the third, the plow is ready,
On the fourth, the feet are raised. 
With my wife and child, I go to the southern field,
Where the farmer rejoices, seeing the harvest. 
In July, the fire of the sun descends,
In September, garments are bestowed. 
In spring, the sun shines,
And the yellow birds sing.

asr: 女执懿筐，遵彼微行，爰求柔桑。春日迟迟，采蘩祁祁。女心伤悲，殆及公子同归。七月流火，八月萑苇。蚕月条桑，取彼斧斨，以伐远扬，猗彼女桑。七月鸣鵙，八月载绩。
s2tt:
With baskets deep, along the pathways low,
She seeks the tender mulberry leaves to find.
The spring days linger soft and slow,
And thick the southernwood they gather and bind.
Her heart is full of secret woe,
Lest to his home her lord should her consign.

In seventh month the Fire Star westward goes;
In eighth month different reeds they take.
In silkworm month they strip the mulberry boughs,
With hatchets keen the branching trees to break,
The tender leaves in ample stores to house.
In seventh month the shrike cries out his woe;
In eighth month they begin the hemp to make.
s2tt_r:
原文：
女之衣筐，遵彼微行。爰求柔桑，春日迟迟。采繁祁祁，女心伤悲。怠及公子同归，七月流火，八月萑苇。参月调桑，取彼斧戕，以伐远扬，以斲椅桑。七月鸣鼓，八月载绩。

译文：
The girl's clothes are in the basket,
Following the narrow path.
Seeking tender mulberry leaves,
Spring days are long and slow.
Picking abundant leaves,
The girl's heart is filled with sorrow.
She lingers, hoping to return with the prince,
July's heat is fierce, August's reeds are tall.
In the third month, she adjusts the mulberry,
Taking the axe to cut, to cut the distant willow,
To cut the chair mulberry.
July's drums beat, August's work begins.

asr: 载玄载黄，我朱孔阳，为公子裳。四月秀葽，五月鸣蜩。八月其获，十月陨萚。一之日于貉，取彼狐狸，为公子裘。二之日其同，载缵武功，言私其豵，献豜于公。
s2tt:
In black and yellow we dye the thread,
In red most bright for the noble's wear.
In the fourth month grass grows high,
In the fifth cicadas cry.
In the eighth month we reap the grain,
In the tenth month leaves fall again.
In the eleventh we hunt the raccoon,
Foxes for the noble's fur-coat soon.
In the twelfth month we rally our force,
Drill our men and train our horse.
We keep the small game for our own,
And offer the big to the noble's throne.
s2tt_r:
原文：
再玄再黄，我朱孔阳，为公子裳。四月秀葽，五月鸣蜩。八月其获，十月陨萚。一之日于貉，取彼狐狸，为公子裘。二之日其同，载缵武功，言私其宗，献将于公。

译文：
Again black and yellow, my朱孔阳, for the prince's robe. In April, the mugwort blooms; in May, the cicadas sing. In August, the harvest comes; in October, the leaves fall. On the first day of the month, to the north, we take the foxes, for the prince's coat. On the second day of the month, they come together, to continue the martial arts, to speak of their clan, to present it to the public.

asr: 七月食瓜，八月断壶，九月叔苴，采荼薪樗，食我农夫。九月筑场圃，十月纳禾稼。黍稷重穋，禾麻菽麦。嗟我农夫，我稼既同，上入执宫功。昼尔于茅，宵尔索綯。
s2tt:
In July we eat melons, in August gourds we reap,
In September we gather hemp seeds, and for fuel dry wood we keep.
In September we level the threshing ground,
In October we bring in the harvest round.
Millet, early and late, hemp, beans, wheat we store.
Alas, we farmers, when harvest is o'er,
We go to the lord's house to do more.
By day we gather thatch, by night we twist rope tight.
s2tt_r:
原文：
七月食瓜，八月断壶，九月叔苴，采荼薪樗，食我农夫。
九月筑场圃，十月纳禾稼，黍稷同入，禾麻菽麦，皆我农夫。
我稼既同，上入执宫功。昼尔于茅，宵尔索绹。

译文：
In July, we eat melons,
In August, we cut gourds,
In September, we gather chrysanthemums,
Pick tea, gather mulberry leaves, feed our farmers.
In September, we build granaries,
In October, we harvest crops,
Grains and millets enter the granary,
Rice, millet, beans, and wheat, all belong to our farmers.
Our crops are gathered,
We enter the palace to work.
Day and night, we weave,
Day and night, we spin.

asr: 冽彼下泉，浸彼苞稂。忾我寤叹，念彼周京。冽彼下泉，浸彼苞萧。忾我寤叹，念彼京周。冽彼下泉，浸彼苞蓍。忾我寤叹，念彼京师。芃芃黍苗，阴雨膏之。
s2tt:
Cold flows the stream,
Soaking the withered reed.
Awake, I sigh and dream
Of the old capital in need.

Cold flows the rill,
Soaking the wormwood bare.
Awake, I dream until
I see that capital in care.

Cold flows the spring,
Soaking the o'erthrown weed.
Awake, I sigh and sing
Of the old capital in need.

Luxuriant the millet grows,
Nourished by the rain.
The royal house o'erflows
With blessings in its reign.
s2tt_r:
原文：
裂比下泉，浸比包囊，系我无叹，念彼舟轻。
裂比下泉，浸比包萧，系我无叹，念彼舟轻。
裂比下泉，浸比包施，系我无叹，念彼京师。
蓬蓬鼠苗，应予告之。

译文：
Rippling like a spring, soaking like a bag,
Tie me without complaint, miss that light boat.
Rippling like a spring, soaking like a bag,
Tie me without complaint, miss that light boat.
Rippling like a spring, soaking like a bag,
Tie me without complaint, miss that capital.
Pom-pom mouse sprout, should be informed.

asr: 东门之枌，宛丘之栩。子仲之子，婆娑其下。穀旦于差，南方之原。不绩其麻，市也婆娑。穀旦于逝，越以鬷迈。视尔如荍，贻我握椒。
s2tt:
By Eastern Gate the elm trees stand,
By Wanqiu Hill the oaks are grand.
The son of Zizhong, fair and bright,
Dances beneath with great delight.

A lucky day we choose with care,
On southern plain to meet the fair.
She leaves her hemp-spinning aside,
To dance with grace and joyful pride.

The lucky day we will not miss,
Together we go forth in bliss.
You look like morning-glory bright,
And give me pepper with delight.
s2tt_r:
东门之墠，宛丘之塸。子仲之子，婆娑其下。鼓旦于拆，南风之原。不寁其麻，是也婆娑。鼓旦于室，乐以松茂。视尔如侨，以我沃椒。

译文：
At the eastern gate, the field lies wide,
On宛丘之塸, the graves are lined.
The son of子仲, in dance he glides,
Beneath the trees, his form he hides.
At dawn, the drum beats loud and clear,
In the southern breeze, the wind does steer.
The flax he does not weave with care,
His dance, a joy, his spirit rare.
In the room, the drum beats once more,
With joy, the pine trees flourish, more.
Behold you as a guest, dear friend,
With love, I offer you my blend.

asr: 丝衣其紑，载弁俅俅。自堂徂基，自羊徂牛。鼐鼎及鼒，兕觥其觩，旨酒思柔。不吴不敖，胡考之休。
s2tt:
Silk robes so bright,
Caps stand upright.
From hall to shrine,
From sheep to kine.
Tripods and pans,
Rhino cups in hands,
Mellow wine so bland.
No noise, no pride,
Long life and joy abide.
s2tt_r:
原文：
斯衣其否，待变求求。
自唐徂基，自阳徂牛。
奈鼎及兹，肆公祈求。
执酒斯柔，不芜不奥。
胡考之休。

译文：
This garment is old, awaiting change.
From Tang to Ji, from Yang to Niu.
Nai Ding and this, for public prayer.
Holding wine, it is soft, not芜nor奥.
Happiness in examination.

asr: 鱼丽于罶，鲿鲨。君子有酒，旨且多。鱼丽于罶，鲂鳢。君子有酒，多且旨。鱼丽于罶，鰋鲤。君子有酒，旨且有。物其多矣，维其嘉矣！物其旨矣，维其偕矣！
s2tt_r:
原文：
鱼离于罶，鲂鲤。君子有酒，旨且多。
鱼离于罶，鲂鲤。君子有酒，多且旨。
鱼离于罶，鲂鲤。君子有酒，旨且有。
勿其多矣，维其嘉矣。
勿其旨矣，维其携矣。

译文：
Fish in the net, carp and carp.
A gentleman has wine, sweet and abundant.
Fish in the net, carp and carp.
A gentleman has wine, abundant and sweet.
Fish in the net, carp and carp.
A gentleman has wine, sweet and plentiful.
Do not seek abundance, for it is good.
Do not seek sweetness, for it is harmonious.

asr: 笃公刘，匪居匪康。乃埸乃疆，乃积乃仓乃裹餱粮，于橐于囊。思辑用光，弓矢斯张干戈戚扬，爰方启行。笃公刘，于胥斯原。既庶既繁，既顺乃宣，而无永叹。
s2tt_r:
原文：
匪居匪康，乃异乃疆，乃积乃仓，乃裹糇粮，爰及鱼罔，斯及用光。宫室斯张，干戈戢扬，爰方启行。笃公刘，于胥斯远，既庶既繁，既顺乃宣，而无永叹。

译文：
Not resting, not at ease,
They toil, they strive, they build, they store,
They gather food, they fish, they net,
Their efforts reach the light.
Their homes expand, their weapons rest,
As they set out on their journey.
Dedicated to the public good,
They journey far, they grow, they thrive,
Their hearts content, they find peace,
Without endless sighs.

asr: 匪风发兮，匪车偈兮。顾瞻周道，中心怛兮。匪风飘兮，匪车嘌兮。顾瞻周道，中心吊兮。谁能亨鱼？溉之釜鬵。谁将西归？怀之好音。
s2tt:
The wind blows wild and free;
The carriage runs with glee.
I gaze upon the road ahead,
With sorrow in my heart and dread.

The wind whirls fierce and high;
The carriage speeds by.
I gaze upon the road ahead,
With grief in my heart and dread.

Who will cook the fish fine?
Wash the pot and make it shine.
Who will westward go?
Take good news to those I know.
s2tt_r:
原文：
彼风发兮，彼车捷兮。
顾瞻周道，中心怛兮。
彼风飘兮，彼车飘兮。
顾瞻周道，中心吊兮。
谁能烹鱼，盖之釜兮。
谁将栖龟，怀之好音。

译文：
The wind blows strong, the chariot moves swift,
Looking around the wide road, my heart feels swift.
The wind blows light, the chariot moves light,
Looking around the wide road, my heart feels right.
Who can cook the fish, cover it in a pot?
Who will rest the turtle, hold it in a lot.

asr: 南山崔崔，雄狐绥绥。鲁道有荡，齐子由归。既曰归止，曷又怀止？葛屦五两，冠緌双止。鲁道有荡，齐子庸止。既曰庸止，曷又从止？蓺麻如之何？衡从其亩。
s2tt:
High stands the southern hill,
The fox roams at his will.
The road to Lu is wide;
To Lu the bride will ride.
Since she will be a bride,
Why long for her with sighs?

Two pairs of shoes of hemp,
Two hat-strings long and slack.
The road to Lu is wide;
To Lu the bride will ride.
Since she will be a bride,
Why long for her and sigh?

How to sow hemp with ease?
We must sow length and crosswise.
s2tt_r:
原文：
南山崔崔，雄狐绥绥。
鲁道有荡，其子适归。
既曰归止，怀其室只。
葛屦五两，冠緌双止。
鲁道有荡，其子庸止。
既曰庸止，怀其庸只。
亦麻如之何，衡从其母。

译文：
The mountains stand tall and grand,
Foxes roam freely around.
On the road, the path is wide,
Their son returns with pride.
He says he's home at last,
His heart filled with joy and trust.

asr: 取妻如之何？必告父母。既曰告止，曷又鞫止？析薪如之何？匪斧不克。取妻如之何？匪媒不得。既曰得止，曷又极止？
s2tt:
How to take a wife, you say?
You must your parents obey.
Since you've told them, why then
Let her suffer again?
How to split firewood, pray?
Without ax, no way.
How to take a wife, you say?
Without go-between, no way.
Since you've won her, why then
Let her suffer again?
s2tt_r:
娶妻如之何，必告父母。既曰告止，和又居止。昔心如之何，匪甫不可。娶妻如之何，匪媒不得。既曰得止，和又及止。

译文：
How to marry a wife, one must consult parents. Once they say "stop," harmony will continue. How could the heart be so, not without a husband? How to marry a wife, without a matchmaker, one cannot. Once they say "stop," harmony will be achieved.

asr: 叔于田，巷无居人。岂无居人？不如叔也，洵美且仁。叔于狩，巷无饮酒。岂无饮酒？不如叔也，洵美且好。叔适野，巷无服马。岂无服马？不如叔也，洵美且武。
s2tt:
My lord goes hunting, the street's bare.
Is there no man there?
None like my lord, so fair and rare.
My lord goes shooting, no wine's shared.
Is there no wine spared?
None like my lord, so fine and cared.
My lord rides out, no steeds are seen.
Are there no steeds keen?
None like my lord, so brave and keen.
s2tt_r:
原文：
叔于田，巷无居人。
岂无居人？不如叔也。
洵美且仁。
叔于狩，巷无饮酒。
岂无饮酒？不如叔也。
洵美且好。
叔于狩，巷无服马。
岂无服马？不如叔也。
洵美且武。

译文：
In the field, no one lives in the alley.
Is there no one? Not as good as the uncle.
Truly beautiful and kind.
In the hunt, no one drinks in the alley.
Is there no one to drink? Not as good as the uncle.
Truly beautiful and lovely.
In the hunt, no one rides a horse in the alley.
Is there no one to ride a horse? Not as good as the uncle.
Truly beautiful and brave.

asr: 墓门有棘，斧以斯之。夫也不良，国人知之。知而不已，谁昔然矣。墓门有梅，有鸮萃止。夫也不良，歌以讯之。讯予不顾，颠倒思予。
s2tt:
By the tomb gate thorns grow,
With axe we lay them low.
The man is evil, all men know.
Known to all, yet he won't mend.
Who knows when his vice will end?

By the tomb gate mume trees stand,
Owls perch there in a band.
The man is evil, we sing to warn.
Warnings unheeded, he'll be forlorn.
s2tt_r:
原文：
木门有疾，夫以司之。夫也不良，国人知之。知而不已，谁息然矣。木门有楣，有鸮萃止。夫也不良，歌以讯之。讯予不顾，颠倒思予。

译文：
The wooden door is sick, the husband tends it. The husband is not good, the people know it. Knowing but not stopping, who will rest? The wooden door has a frame, an owl gathers there. The husband is not good, singing to warn him. Warning me without regard, I think of him upside down.

asr: 天作高山，大王荒之。彼作矣，文王康之。彼徂矣，岐有夷之行。子孙保之。
s2tt:
Heaven made the lofty hill,
King Tai did cultivate and till.
He founded there the state,
King Wen did peace create.
The people thronged in praise,
On Qi's smooth, level ways.
May sons and grandsons hold
This heritage of old.
s2tt_r:
原文：
天作高山，泰王荒之。
彼作矣，文王康之。
彼徂矣，其有裔行，子孙保之。

译文：
Heaven creates high mountains, King Tai abandons them.
He builds them, King Wen thrives.
He departs, his descendants walk, their descendants protect them.

asr: 灵雨既零，命彼倌人。星言夙驾，说于桑田。匪直也人，秉心塞渊。騋牝三千。
s2tt:
The timely rain has ceased to fall,
I bid my groom to start at call.
At starry night we drive away
To stop and talk in mulberry way.
He is a man of high degree,
With deep concern for you and me.
He has three thousand steeds in stall.
s2tt_r:
原文：
凌雨既临，命彼观人，新颜素价，睡于桑田。匪直野人，秉心塞冤，来聘三千。

译文：
Rain has fallen, and the sight is clear,
The new faces, pure and fair, rest here.
Not just common folk, but hearts filled with wrong,
They come to seek a thousand songs.

asr: 明明上天，照临下土。我征徂西，至于艽野。二月初吉，载离寒暑。心之忧矣，其毒大苦。念彼共人，涕零如雨。岂不怀归？畏此罪罟！昔我往矣，日月方除。
s2tt:
Bright shines the heaven above,
Illuming the earth below.
I march to the west afar,
To the desert I go.
In early second moon,
I left home long ago.
My heart is full of woe,
As bitter as gall.
I think of my dear wife,
Tears like rain down fall.
Do I not wish to go home?
But I fear the law's call.
When I left home last year,
The old year was no more.
s2tt_r:
原文：
明明上天，照临下土。
我征徂西，至于艽野。
二月初吉，载离寒暑。
心之忧矣，其毒太苦。
念彼共人，涕零如雨。
岂不怀归？畏此罪罟。
昔我往矣，日月方舒。

译文：
The heavens are bright and clear,
Shining down on the earth below.
I journey westward, far away,
To the distant and wild lands.
In early spring, I leave the cold and heat behind,
My heart filled with sorrow, the pain too great.
Thinking of my fellow travelers,
My tears fall like rain.
Am I not longing to return home?
But fear of the law holds me back.
When I left, the sun and moon were bright,
The days were long and the nights were short.

asr: 曷云其还？岁聿云莫。念我独兮，我事孔庶。心之忧矣，惮我不暇。念彼共人，眷眷怀顾！岂不怀归？畏此谴怒。昔我往矣，日月方奥。曷云其还？政事愈蹙。
s2tt:
When shall I return? The year is near its end.
Alone I think of my many tasks to attend.
My heart is heavy with care, no leisure I find.
I think of my dear ones, with longing in my mind.
Do I not wish to go home? I fear the reprimand.
When I set out, the sun and moon were warm and bland.
When shall I return? State affairs grow more intense.
s2tt_r:
原文：
何云其还，岁聿云暮。念我独兮，我思孔庶。心之忧矣，旦我不暇。念彼宫人，眷眷怀故。岂不怀归，畏此谴怒。昔我往矣，日月方育。何云其还，正事于处。

译文：
Why ask for return, as the year draws near? I am alone, my thoughts are so deep. My heart is filled with sorrow, but I have no time. I think of the palace people, longing for home. Do I not long to return, fearing punishment? When I left, the sun and moon were young. Why ask for return, when there are tasks to be done?

asr: 嗟尔君子，无恒安息。靖共尔位，好是正直。神之听之，介尔景福。
s2tt:
O noble men, seek not repose in vain,
But guard your posts with heart and soul maintain.
Love what is right, with spirits pure and bright,
The gods will hear, and bless you with delight.
s2tt_r:
原文：
接而君子，无恒安息。
进公而位，好事正直。
神之听之，戒而谨服。

译文：
Approach the virtuous, find peace.
Advocate justice, seek upright.
Heaven listens, warn and obey.

asr: 君子如祉，乱庶遄已。君子屡盟，乱是用长。君子信盗，乱是用暴。盗言孔甘，乱是用餤。匪其止共，维王之邛。奕奕寝庙，君子作之。秩秩大猷，圣人莫之。
s2tt:
A noble man, like blessing bright,
Can quell the chaos and set right.
But if he swears oaths, thick and fast,
The turmoil will but longer last.
If he trusts thieves, both sly and vain,
The turmoil will but wax in pain.
Their honeyed words, so sweet and grand,
Will feed the turmoil in the land.
Not that they fail in duty's call,
But they're the king's own downfall.
The grand ancestral temple's grace,
By noble hands, finds its place.
The wise and ordered, grand design,
By sages' wisdom is made fine.
s2tt_r:
君子如止，乱树传矣。
君子吕蒙，乱世用长。
君子信道，乱世用暴。
道言孔干，乱世用谈。
非其止功，为王之穷。
意义其妙，君子作之。
至至大由，圣人莫之。

译文：
A gentleman stands still, chaos spreads.
A gentleman named Lu Meng, in troubled times, uses his strength.
A gentleman believes in the way, in troubled times, uses force.
Words of the way are dry, in troubled times, they are discussed.
It is not his stopping power, but the king's poverty.
The meaning is wonderful, a gentleman acts.
The utmost is great, even sages cannot achieve it.

asr: 无拳无勇，职为乱阶。既微且尰，尔勇伊何？为犹将多，尔居徒几何？
s2tt:
No strength, no might, yet stir the strife;
Swollen and lame, what valor's rife?
With schemes so many, tricks so rife,
How many follow you in life?
s2tt_r:
原文：
无权无勇，直为乱阶。
既为且种，而勇亦何为？
惟有江多，而居徒几何？

译文：
Without power and courage, only causing chaos.
Having planted and nurtured, what is the use of bravery?
Only the river is abundant, but how much space is there to live?

asr: 岂不尔受？既其女迁。骄人好好，劳人草草。苍天苍天，视彼骄人，矜此劳人。彼谮人者，谁适与谋？取彼谮人，投畀豺虎。豺虎不食，投畀有北。有北不受，投畀有昊！
s2tt:
Do you not accept the plea?
Yet you shift blame, as all can see.
The proud in glee,
The toil-worn in misery.
O Heaven, O Heaven, look down on the proud,
And show mercy to the toil-worn crowd.
Those slanderers vile,
Who plots their guile?
Seize those who lie,
To wolves and tigers throw them high.
If beasts refuse the prey,
To northern wastes cast them away.
If the wilds disdain,
To Heaven's wrath commit their bane.
s2tt_r:
原文：
岂不尔思，劳心忉忉。
皎皎白驹，在彼中阿。
呦呦鹿鸣，食野之苹。
我有嘉宾，德音孔昭。
视彼白驹，伊何人斯？
译文：
Do you not think of me?
My heart is filled with sorrow.
A white horse gallops freely,
In the middle of the field.
A deer calls out,
Feasting on wild grass.
I have guests of honor,
Their virtues are so clear.
Look at that white horse,
Who is it, indeed?

asr: 杨园之道，猗于亩丘。寺人孟子，作为此诗。凡百君子，敬而听之。
s2tt:
Through Yang Garden's way,  
By the fields it winds away.  
Mencius, the temple's son,  
This poem has begun.  
All noble men, I pray,  
Hear what these verses say.
s2tt_r:
原文：
杨园之道，以鱼母丘，四人孟子，作为此诗，凡百君子，敬而听之。

译文：
The path of Yang Yuan, with the fish mother Qiu, four people Mengzi, as this poem, all hundred gentlemen, listen respectfully.

asr: 我将我享，维羊维牛，维天其右之。仪式刑文王之典，日靖四方。伊嘏文王，既右飨之。我其夙夜，畏天之威，于时保之。
s2tt:
I offer my sacrifice,  
With sheep and oxen, pure and nice,  
May Heaven bless the rite.  
By King Wen's laws we rule the land,  
And peace prevails on every hand.  
Great King Wen, on high,  
Accepts the gifts with gracious eye.  
Day and night with reverent awe,  
We obey the heavenly law,  
And guard the state with power.
s2tt_r:
原文：
我将我享，维羊维牛，维天其右之。
于时行，文王之典，日靖四方。
依古文王，既右飨之。
我其夙夜，畏天之威，于时保之。

译文：
I offer my sacrifice,
With sheep and cattle,
May heaven protect them.
In this time, I follow
The ancient ways of King Wen,
And bring peace to all.
Following the ancient ways,
King Wen was right and just.
I will work day and night,
Fearing the power of heaven,
And protect the people.

asr: 我行其野，蔽芾其樗。昏姻之故，言就尔居。尔不我畜，复我邦家。我行其野，言采其蓫。昏姻之故，言就尔宿。尔不我畜，言归斯复。我行其野，言采其葍。
s2tt:
I walk the wilds, where elms grow high,
In marriage bond, to you I tie.
You treat me not as spouse you should,
I'll go back to my neighborhood.

I walk the wilds, where mallows spread,
For marriage vow, I share your bed.
You show me neither love nor grace,
I'll seek again my native place.

I walk the wilds, where bindweeds twine,
No more shall your cold heart be mine.
s2tt_r:
原文：
我行其野，必废其锄。
婚姻之故，言就尔居。
尔不我恤，复我邦家。
我行其野，言采其葍。
婚姻之故，言就尔宿。
尔不我恤，言归斯复。
我行其野，言采其葍。

译文：
I walk the wild, must leave my hoe,
For marriage's sake, I seek your home.
You do not care, return to my land.
I walk the wild, gather wild herbs,
For marriage's sake, find your lodging.
You do not care, return to my land.

asr: 不思旧姻，求尔新特。成不以富，亦祗以异。
s2tt:
Think not of former spouse, 
But seek a new spouse. 
'Tis not for wealth you part, 
But for a fickle heart.
s2tt_r:
原文：
不思旧因求尔新特，
诚不以复一旨以易。

译文：
Seeking novelty without considering old roots,
True intentions are not easily exchanged.

asr: 既醉以酒，既饱以德。君子万年，介尔景福。既醉以酒，尔肴既将。君子万年，介尔昭明。昭明有融，高朗令终。令终有俶，公尸嘉告。其告维何？笾豆静嘉。
s2tt:
Drunk with wine, filled with grace,
May you live long, blessed be your place.
Drunk with wine, feast well laid,
May you live long, in light arrayed.
Light that shines, bright and clear,
Ending well, from year to year.
Ending well, a new start,
Blessings flow from the heart.
What blessings do they bring?
Offerings pure, a sacred thing.
s2tt_r:
原文：
既醉以酒，既饱以德，君子万年，介尔景福。
既醉以酒，尔肴既将，君子万年，介尔昭明。
昭明有融，高朗令终，令终有俶。
公尸嘉告，锡我百禄，百禄既跻，以慰我心。

译文：
Drunk with wine, satisfied with virtue, the gentleman thrives for a thousand years, bestowing upon you great blessings.
Drunk with wine, your dishes are ready, the gentleman thrives for a thousand years, bestowing upon you clear and bright.
Clear and bright, warm and harmonious, high and clear, the end is glorious, the end is splendid.
The public sacrifice brings good news, bestowing upon me abundant blessings, abundant blessings rise, comforting my heart.

asr: 朋友攸摄，摄以威仪。威仪孔时，君子有孝子。孝子不匮，永锡尔类。其类维何？室家之壸。君子万年，永锡祚胤。其胤维何？天被尔禄。君子万年，景命有仆。
s2tt: Friends are gathered and held, held by dignity and bearing. When dignity and rite are duly observed, the gentleman has filial sons. The filial sons do not fail; he will forever bestow them upon your line. And what is that line? The household’s urn. May the gentleman live ten thousand years; may he forever grant blessings to his descendants. And what are those descendants? Heaven covers your sustenance. May the gentleman live ten thousand years; by the splendid mandate there are attendants.
s2tt_r:
原文：
朋有优社，社以威仪。威仪孔时，君子有孝子。孝子不愧，永赐尔类。其类维何？世家之捆。君子万年，永赐作宴。其宴维何？天备尔禄。君子万年，景命有普。

译文：
Friends gather in a fine hall,
With grandeur and grace they display.
This grace is so timely,
A gentleman has a filial son.
The son is not ashamed,
He forever blesses your kind.
What is this kind?
It is the family's bond.
A gentleman for a thousand years,
Forever grants you a feast.
What is this feast?
Heaven provides your rewards.
A gentleman for a thousand years,
His destiny is broad and wide.

asr: 其仆维何？釐尔女士。釐尔女士，从以孙子。
s2tt:
What is the blessing? Maidens fair you gain.
Maidens fair you gain,
And grandsons in train.
s2tt_r:
原文：
其仆维何？黎尔女士。黎尔女士，从以孙子。

译文：
Who is your servant? A lady from the Li family. A lady from the Li family, accompanying your grandson.

asr: 有杕之杜，生于道左。彼君子兮，噬肯适我？中心好之，曷饮食之？有杕之杜，生于道周。彼君子兮，噬肯来游？中心好之，曷饮食之？
s2tt:
A lone tree stands by the road-side here;
O sir, to visit me will you draw near?
Since my heart holds you dear,
Why not come and share my cheer?

A lone tree stands where pathways part;
O sir, will you come to gladden my heart?
Since my heart holds you dear,
Why not come and share my cheer?
s2tt_r:
有弟之度，生于道左。比君子兮，是肯是我。中心好之，何饮食之。
有弟之度，生于道周。比君子兮，是肯来游。中心好之，何饮食之。

译文：
A brother's measure, born on the left of the path,
Compared to a gentleman, he is willing to be me.
In the heart, he loves it, how can he not eat it?

A brother's measure, born on the right of the path,
Compared to a gentleman, he is willing to come and play.
In the heart, he loves it, how can he not eat it?

asr: 胡为乎株林？从夏南！匪适株林，从夏南！驾我乘马，说于株野。乘我乘驹，朝食于株！
s2tt:
Why to the woods of Zhu you go?
To see Xia Nan, I know!
Why to the woods of Zhu you ride?
To see Xia Nan, I know!
With four steeds I drive to the wood;
In the wild I take my food.
With four colts I drive to the wood;
In the wild I take my food.
s2tt_r:
原文：
胡为乎朱林丛下南，
匪是朱林丛下南，
驾我盛马，
税于朱也。
乘我盛居，
朝食于朱。

译文：
Why are you in the southern part of the red forest?
It's not the southern part of the red forest.
Mount my magnificent horse,
Tax the red forest.
Ride my magnificent carriage,
Eat in the red forest in the morning.

asr: 忧心愈愈，是以有侮。忧心惸惸，念我无禄。民之无辜，并其臣仆。哀我人斯，于何从禄？瞻乌爰止？于谁之屋？瞻彼中林，侯薪侯蒸。民今方殆，视天梦梦。
s2tt: My heart is full of grief, So that I am insulted. My heart is full of sorrow, That I have no happiness. The people are innocent, And become slaves all. Alas for us men! Where shall we get happiness? Look at the roosting crows; On whose house do they light? Look into the middle of the forest; There are nothing but faggots and brushwood. The people are now in peril; They look on Heaven as ignorant.
s2tt_r:
原文：
忧心郁郁，是以往昔。
忧心忡忡，念我无路。
民之无辜，并其尘仆。
哀我人斯，于何从禄？
瞻乌爰止，于谁之屋？
瞻彼中林，候心候中。
民今方殆，视天蒙蒙。

译文：
Worried and depressed, I recall the past,
Worried and anxious, I ponder my path.
The innocent people, they fall to dust,
Alas, my people, where do they find their sustenance?
Where does the blackbird rest, in whose house?
Looking at the forest, my heart is filled with sorrow.
People are now in distress, the sky is overcast.

asr: 既克有定，靡人弗胜。有皇上帝，伊谁云憎？谓山盖卑，为冈为陵。民之讹言，宁莫之惩。召彼故老，讯之占梦。具曰予圣，谁知乌之雌雄！谓天盖高，不敢不局。
s2tt:
Once fixed by Heaven's decree,
No mortal can be free.
Who dares to blame the Lord on high?
The hills may lowly lie,
But they are hills and mounts in view.
When rumors spread among the crowd,
Why are they not disallowed?
The elders are called in to say
What dreams mean in their way.
Each says he is a sage divine.
Who knows the gender of the crow?
The sky is high, but we must bow,
For fear of Heaven's frown.
s2tt_r:
原文：
既克有定，靡人弗胜，有皇上帝。伊水洋洋，惟山河之悲。惟冈惟陵，民之讹言，宁莫之惩。肇彼故老，询之占梦，既曰于上帝，谁之乌之雌雄？惟天盖高，不敢不局。

译文：
After victory, no one can resist,
Under the great rule of the emperor.
The water flows wide,
As sorrow fills the mountains and rivers.
On the hills and mounds,
People spread false tales,
But none is punished.
From the old, we seek wisdom,
In dreams and omens,
They say to the heavens,
Who is the male and who the female?
The sky is high,
We dare not be too proud.

asr: 谓地盖厚，不敢不蹐。维号斯言，有伦有脊。哀今之人，胡为虺蜴？瞻彼阪田，有菀其特。天之杌我，如不我克。彼求我则，如不我得。执我仇仇，亦不我力。
s2tt:
The earth is thick, yet I dare not but tread with care;
My words are clear, with reason and order fair.
Alas! Why are men like lizards, sly and mean?
Look at the barren field, where a plant grows green.
Heaven tries to crush me, as if I were its foe;
He seeks me out, as if he wished me to grow.
Yet when he holds me, he treats me with disdain,
And never lets my talents break the chain.
s2tt_r:
原文：
未第何候不敢不齐
惟好斯言有伦有几
哀今之人胡为毁义
瞻彼坂田有婉其特
天之勿我如不我克
彼求我则如不我得
执我仇仇亦不我利

译文：
Before the exam, how can I not be anxious?
Only this saying has its own logic.
Alas, today's people, why do they destroy righteousness?
Looking at the坂田, it is so special.
The sky does not want me, as if it does not conquer me.
If someone asks for me, it is as if they do not get me.
Holding my enemy, it is also not my benefit.

asr: 心之忧矣，如或结之。今兹之正，胡然厉矣？燎之方扬，宁或灭之？赫赫宗周，褒姒灭之！终其永怀，又窘阴雨。其车既载，乃弃尔辅。载输尔载，将伯助予！
s2tt:
My heart is sad, as if in a knot bound;
Why is the government so harsh around?
When flames are high, can they be quenched with ease?
The glorious Zhou by Bao Si fell to its knees.
In constant grief, by gloomy rain oppressed,
The cart once loaded, its support you've left.
The load will fall, and help I must request!
s2tt_r:
心之忧矣，如或结之。
今兹之正，胡然厉矣。
聊之方扬，宁或灭之。
赫赫宗周，褒姒灭之。
终其永怀，又窘阴雨。
其车既载，乃弃而俘。
载输尔在，羌国筑于。

asr: 洽比其邻，婚姻孔云。念我独兮，忧心殷殷。佌佌彼有屋，蔌蔌方有谷。民今之无禄，天夭是椓。哿矣富人，哀此惸独。
s2tt:
Neighbors in harmony dwell,
Weddings in joy excel.
Alone I think of my lot,
With sorrowful heart distraught.
Mean men have houses fine,
Base men have corn and wine.
People now have no pay,
Heaven strikes them every day.
The rich may go their way,
Alas for the poor astray!
s2tt_r:
恰彼其邻，昏阴恐云。念我独兮，忧心殷殷。迟迟彼有屋，肃肃方有谷。民今之无禄，天夭是椓。歌以妇人，哀此穷独。

译文：
Just as my neighbor, the gloom forebodes clouds. Thinking of me alone, my heart is filled with sorrow. Slowly there is a house, solemnly there is a valley. People now have no blessings, heaven has destroyed them. Singing for the woman, lamenting this poverty and solitude.

asr: 民亦劳止，汔可小康。惠此中国，以绥四方。无纵诡随，以谨无良。式遏寇虐，憯不畏明。柔远能迩，以定我王。民亦劳止，汔可小休。惠此中国，以为民逑。
s2tt:
The people are worn and weary,
They long for a little ease.
Show kindness to this central kingdom,
To give the states repose.
Do not indulge the crafty flatterers,
And curb the vicious and mean.
Check the robbers and oppressors,
Who dare not fear the bright decree.
Pacify the distant, cherish the near,
To set our king at rest.
The people are worn and weary,
They long for a little rest.
Show kindness to this central kingdom,
To make the people secure.
s2tt_r:
民亦劳止，汔可小康。
惠此中国，以绥四方。
无纵诡随，以谨无良。
式遏寇虐，惨不为民。
柔远能迩，以定我王。
民亦劳止，汔可小休。
惠此中国，以绥民求。

译文：
People are weary, almost at ease.
Bless this land, to soothe all.
Do not let deceit prevail, to guard the good.
Stop the invaders, for the people's sake.
Be kind to the distant, to bring them near,
To secure our king's rule.
People are weary, almost at rest.
Bless this land, to seek the people's peace.

asr: 无纵诡随，以谨惛怓。式遏寇虐，无俾民忧。无弃尔劳，以为王休。民亦劳止，汔可小息。惠此京师，以绥四国。无纵诡随，以谨罔极。式遏寇虐，无俾作慝。
s2tt:
Do not indulge the crafty and sly,  
To guard against confusion high.  
Restrain the cruel and the fierce,  
Lest people's sorrows never cease.  
Do not forsake your toil and pain,  
To make the king's glory remain.  
The people toil and never rest,  
They long for moments to be blessed.  
Show kindness to the capital,  
To pacify the lands in thrall.  
Do not indulge the crafty and sly,  
To guard against extremes that lie.  
Restrain the cruel and the fierce,  
Lest wickedness should be unleashed.
s2tt_r:
原文：
吴众诡随，伊谨昏挠，事恶寇虐，吾匹靡优，吾弃而劳，以为王休。民意劳止，气可小息，会此京师，以绥四国。吴众诡随，伊谨罔极，事恶寇虐，吾比作特。

译文：
Wu's crowd is deceitful, I'm cautious and confused,
Dealing with evil invaders, my efforts are in vain.
I forsake my toil, for the king's rest,
When people's labor stops, the spirit can rest.
In this capital, to pacify the four nations,
Wu's deceit is boundless, dealing with evil invaders, I compare to a special case.

asr: 敬慎威仪，以近有德。民亦劳止，汔可小愒。惠此中国，俾民忧泄。无纵诡随，以谨丑厉。式遏寇虐，无俾正败。戎虽小子，而式弘大。民亦劳止，汔可小安。
s2tt:
Be reverent, be prudent, and to virtue near;
The people are tired; let them rest here.
Show favor to the Middle State,
And people's worries dissipate.
Do not indulge in crafty art,
But guard against the vicious heart.
Suppress the robbers and the foe,
Lest our good rule should be brought low.
Though you are young, your influence is great;
The people are tired; let them have a rest.
s2tt_r:
原文：
敬慎威仪，以敬有德。民亦劳止，汔可小憩。惠此中国，俾民有隙。无纵诡随，以谨丑厉。式遏寇虐，无俾政怠。戎虽小子，而式弘大。民亦劳止，汔可小安。

译文：
With solemn reverence and decorum,
We honor those of virtue.
The people toil, yet rest is near.
With care, we find a brief respite.
Bless this land, that peace may reign,
And let the people find their way.
Do not let deceit prevail,
But guard against evil's sway.
Stop the oppressor's hand,
And let not governance fade.
Though small, the warrior stands,
And his spirit is vast and grand.
The people toil, yet rest is near,
And peace may find its place.

asr: 惠此中国，国无有残。无纵诡随，以谨缱绻。式遏寇虐，无俾正反。王欲玉女，是用大谏。
s2tt_r:
原文：
会此中国国无有残，无从归随，以谨前犬，示恶寇虐，无比正犯，王欲御辱，是用大剑。

译文：
In this land of China, there is no remnant, no way to return, to guard the former dog, to show the evil invaders, there is no equal offender, the king wants to defend against humiliation, this uses the great sword.

asr: 渐渐之石，维其高矣。山川悠远，维其劳矣。武人东征，不皇朝矣。渐渐之石，维其卒矣。山川悠远，曷其没矣？武人东征，不皇出矣。有豕白蹢，烝涉波矣。
s2tt:
Steep the stones, oh so high;
Far the hills, oh so nigh.
Eastward march our men in arms,
No time for dawn's alarms.

Steep the stones, oh so sheer;
Far the hills, oh so drear.
Eastward march our men in might,
No time for morning light.

White-hoofed swine, in throngs they go,
Wading through the stream's flow.
s2tt_r:
原文：
潺潺之石，惟其高矣。
山川悠远，惟其劳矣。
五人东征，不遑朝矣。
潺潺之石，惟其足矣。
山川悠远，何其莫矣。
五人东征，不遑出矣。
有矢白狄，征射播矣。

译文：
Flowing stones, how high they stand,
In distant mountains, how toil they demand.
Five men to the east, no time to dwell,
Their journey long, no rest to tell.

Flowing stones, how firm they are,
In distant mountains, how vast they are.
Five men to the east, no time to leave,
Their journey long, no way to weave.

Arrows fly, white狄aim,
Their shots spread far, their spirits claim.

asr: 月离于毕，俾滂沱矣。武人东征，不皇他矣。
s2tt:
The moon in Bi doth hide,
And floods the land o'erflow.
To east the warriors ride,
No time for other woe.
s2tt_r:
原文：
月出于东山之上，徘徊于斗牛之间。白露横江，水光接天。纵一苇之所如，凌万顷之茫然。浩浩乎如冯虚御风，而不知其所止；飘飘乎如遗世独立，羽化而登仙。

译文：
The moon rises above the eastern mountains,
Wandering among the stars and the oxen.
White dew covers the river,
And the water meets the sky.
With a single reed boat,
I sail through the boundless expanse.
I feel like I'm riding the wind,
But I don't know where it will take me.
I feel like I'm leaving the world behind,
And ascending to heaven.

asr: 我送舅氏，曰至渭阳。何以赠之？路车乘黄。我送舅氏，悠悠我思。何以赠之？琼瑰玉佩。
s2tt:
I see my uncle off
To north of River Wei.
What gift for him I bring?
A chariot with steeds fleet.
I see my uncle off,
Long, long for him I pine.
What gift for him I bring?
Gems and pendants fine.
s2tt_r:
原文：
我送舅氏，曰至渭阳，何以赠之？路车乘黄。
我送舅氏，悠悠我思，何以赠之？琼瑰玉佩。

译文：
I send my uncle to the渭阳，What gift can I give him？A yellow carriage.
I send my uncle，My thoughts are far away，What gift can I give him？Jade and precious stones.

asr: 湛湛露斯，匪阳不晞。厌厌夜饮，不醉无归。湛湛露斯，在彼丰草。厌厌夜饮，在宗载考。湛湛露斯，在彼杞棘。显允君子，莫不令德。其桐其椅，其实离离。
s2tt:
Heavy, heavy the dew-drops lie,
Not dry till shines the morning sky.
Deep, deep we drink the whole night long;
Not drunk, we keep the feast in song.

Heavy, heavy the dew-drops gleam,
On lush grass in the morning beam.
Deep, deep we drink the whole night long;
Our kinsmen praise our feast in song.

Heavy, heavy the dew-drops shine,
On jujube trees and on the vine.
Our noble lord, illustrious, bright,
Is famed for virtue day and night.

The parasol trees, lush and high,
With fruits abundant catch the eye.
s2tt_r:
原文：
湛湛露斯，匪阳不晞。
熠熠夜永，不醉无归。
湛湛露斯，在彼丰草。
熠熠夜永，在宗在考。
湛湛露斯，在彼起棘。
显允君子，莫不令德。
其桐其椅，其石离离。

译文：
Dew falls deep, not drying under the sun.
Long nights shine bright, without rest, no return.
Dew falls deep, on the lush grass.
Long nights shine bright, in the ancestral hall.
Dew falls deep, on the rising thorns.
Prominent gentlemen, all with virtuous deeds.
Their pines and elms, their stones stand tall.

asr: 嗟嗟烈祖！有秩斯祜。申锡无疆，及尔斯所。既载清酤，赉我思成。亦有和羹，既戒既平。鬷假无言，时靡有争。绥我眉寿，黄耇无疆。约軝错衡，八鸾鸧鸧。
s2tt:
O glorious Ancestors, our line's great pride!
Boundless your blessings, spreading far and wide.
Through endless years your favor we receive,
And in this sacred place our vows believe.
With purest wine the ritual cup we fill,
That you may grant success to our good will.
With blended soup, well-seasoned and complete,
In silent awe we lay the offering meet.
No discord mars the solemn sacrifice;
You grant us length of days, a blessed prize.
With yellow age our brows you crown anew,
And life renewed like morning's sparkling dew.
On painted wheels, with bells that sweetly ring,
Eight phoenix-birds their golden voices sing.
s2tt_r:
原文：
嗟嗟列祖，有志斯护。身次无疆，吉而思所。既载亲姑，赖我思成。亦有何更，既戒既平。宗格无言，实米有征。随我眉寿，黄狗无疆。约其错衡，八鸾锵锵。

译文：
Jia jia lie zu, you zhi si hu. Shen ci wu jiang, ji er si suo. Ji zai qin gu, lai wo si cheng. Yi you he geng, ji jie ji ping. Zong ge wu yan, shi mi you zheng. Sui wo mei shou, huang gou wu jiang. Yue qi cuo heng, ba luan qiang qiang.

asr: 以假以享，我受命溥将。自天降康，丰年穰穰。来假来飨，降福无疆。顾予烝尝，汤孙之将。
s2tt:
With offerings pure and sacrifice,
I serve the mandate vast and grand.
From heaven descends prosperity,
With harvests rich across the land.
In reverence we feast and pray,
Boundless blessings heaven bestows.
Behold our solemn rites today,
By Tang's descendants' hands they close.
s2tt_r:
原文：
以歌以飨我受命，
普降自天降康，
丰年穰穰，
来歌来飨，
降福无疆，
顾予烝尝，
汤孙之将。

译文：
With song and feast, I am ordained,
Blessings from heaven, prosperity descends,
A bountiful year, abundant and rich,
With song and feast, blessings without end,
A feast of blessings, vast and boundless,
I am watched and tasted,
The descendant of Tang, the future's guide.

asr: 白华菅兮，白茅束兮。之子之远，俾我独兮。英英白云，露彼菅茅。天步艰难，之子不犹。滮池北流，浸彼稻田。啸歌伤怀，念彼硕人。樵彼桑薪，卬烘于煁。
s2tt:
White blooms the reed, white bound the sedge;
My lord is far, I stand alone.
White clouds above, dew-drops below,
Heaven's way is hard, my lord is gone.
Northward the stream flows to the field,
Soaking the rice, my heart is pained.
I sing aloud to ease my woe,
Thinking of him who is detained.
Mulberry wood I cut for fuel,
To warm myself by the fire.
s2tt_r:
原文：
白花间兮白茅树兮
之子之远比我独兮
英英白云路比肩茅
天不艰难之子不由
标尺北流近比稻田
笑歌伤怀念比朔人
桥比桑心安昏于晨

译文：
White flowers and white reeds grow,
The son is far, I am alone.
White clouds on the road, side by side with reeds,
The sky is not difficult, the son does not go.
The ruler flows north, near the rice fields,
Laughter and song, sorrow and longing, miss the northern people.
The bridge is like a heart of mulberry, peaceful in the morning.

asr: 维彼硕人，实劳我心。鼓钟于宫，声闻于外。念子懆懆，视我迈迈。有鹙在梁，有鹤在林。维彼硕人，实劳我心。鸳鸯在梁，戢其左翼。之子无良，二三其德。
s2tt:
That man of noble mien,
My heart is worn with pain.
The palace bells ring clear,
Their sound is heard afar.
I think of you with fear,
You look at me with scorn.
The cormorant on weir,
The crane in woods forlorn.
That man of noble mien,
My heart is worn with pain.
The lovebirds on the weir
Tuck in the left wing neat.
You are not good, my dear,
Your heart is not true and fleet.
s2tt_r:
原文：
维彼硕人，实劳我心。
谷中于宫，生文于外。
念子草草，逝我麦麦。
有秋在梁，有鹤在林。
维彼硕人，实劳我心。
鸳鸯在梁，集其左翼。
知子无良，二三其德。

译文：
The great beauty, indeed,
劳我心绪难平。
宫室深藏于谷，
文饰彰显于外。
念子匆匆忙忙，
离我麦田漫漫。
秋风在梁上吹拂，
鹤影在林间徘徊。
伟大的美人，实劳我心，
鸳鸯在梁上栖息，
集其左翼。
知子无良，二三其德。

asr: 有扁斯石，履之卑兮。之子之远，俾我疧兮。
s2tt:
This stone is flat and low,
Trodden by feet below.
You go far, far away,
And leave me in dismay.
s2tt_r:
原文：
游遍思时屡之悲兮，知子之远离我其底。

译文：
Throughout the journey, sorrow often arises,
Knowing you are far from me, at the bottom of my heart.

asr: 緜緜瓜瓞。民之初生，自土沮漆。古公亶父，陶复陶穴，未有家室。古公亶父，来朝走马。率西水浒，至于岐下。爰及姜女，聿来胥宇。周原膴膴，堇荼如饴。
s2tt:
Gourds spread their vines in endless line.
When Zhou first rose,
From Ju and Qi the people came.
The ancient duke, Dan-fu by name,
Made kilns and caves for his abode,
Nor house yet had he for his load.
The ancient duke at break of day
On westward journey rode his way.
Along the riverside he sped
Until he reached Mount Qi's head.
There with his lady Jiang he came
To find a home and win a name.
The plain of Zhou was rich and good;
Vetch and sow-thistle sweet as food.
s2tt_r:
原文：
绵绵瓜瓞，民之初生，自土沮漆。古公亶父，陶复陶穴，未有家室。古公亶父，来朝走马，率西水浒，至于岐下。爰及姜女，聿来胥宇，周原五亩，今图如仪。

译文：
Endless瓜瓞绵绵，人民初生，自土沮漆。古公亶父，陶复陶穴，未有家室。古公亶父，来朝走马，率西水浒，至于岐下。爰及姜女，聿来胥宇，周原五亩，今图如仪。

asr: 柞棫拔矣，行道兑矣。混夷駾矣，维其喙矣！虞芮质厥成，文王蹶厥生。予曰有疏附，予曰有先后。予曰有奔奏，予曰有御侮！
s2tt:
The oaks and thorns are cleared away,
The roads are opened to the day.
The Huns in flight are put to rout,
They pant and gasp and cry out.
The states of Yu and Rui are reconciled,
King Wen's virtue makes them mild.
We have ministers to help the state,
To come before and not be late.
We have envoys to speed the news,
And warriors to beat our foes.
s2tt_r:
原文：
坐隅把以
行道对以
混夷退以
围棋会以
鱼瑞至爵成
文王贵爵生
予曰有叔父
予曰有先侯
予曰有奔奏
予曰有御舞

译文：
Sitting by the corner, holding it,
Walking on the path, facing it,
Mixing with the barbarians, retreating it,
Playing chess together, meeting it,
Fish瑞arrives, the cup is filled,
The king of Zhou values the nobleman,
I say there is a brother,
I say there is an ancestor,
I say there is a rush to play,
I say there is a dance to watch.

asr: 维天之命，於穆不已。於乎不显，文王之德之纯。假以溢我，我其收之。骏惠我文王，曾孙笃之。
s2tt:
The Mandate of Heaven, sublime and grand,
Unceasing flows o'er all the land.
How glorious shines its purest ray,
In King Wen's virtue to this day.
