Its grace o'erflows and makes us whole,
We humbly take and guard our soul.
O King Wen, guide us with your light,
Let heirs preserve your wisdom bright.
s2tt_r:
原文：
惟天之命，无穆不显。
文王之德，纯甲乙矣。
我我其收之，骏惠我文王。
曾孙笃之。

译文：
The will of heaven, clear and bright,
No deed goes unnoticed by the light.
The virtue of King Wen, pure and bright,
In every action, it shines so bright.
I shall gather it all, with care and might,
With great kindness, I honor King Wen.
My descendants, with deep respect and might.

asr: 羔裘豹袪，自我人居居。岂无他人？维子之故。羔裘豹褎，自我人究究。岂无他人？维子之好。
s2tt:
In lamb fur trimmed with leopard cuff,
You treat us cold and gruff.
Are there no other men?
For you I stay, my friend.

In lamb fur trimmed with leopard sleeve,
You make us fret and grieve.
Are there no other men?
For you I love, my friend.
s2tt_r:
高裘抱屈，自我人拘拘，岂无他人为子之故；高裘抱秀，自我人纠纠，岂无他人为子之好。
译文：
High boots embrace grievances,  
Self-restrained, I am bound;  
Is there no one else for your sake?  
High boots embrace beauty,  
Self-restrained, I am bound;  
Is there no one else for your affection?

asr: 苕之华，芸其黄矣。心之忧矣，维其伤矣！苕之华，其叶青青。知我如此，不如无生！牂羊坟首，三星在罶。人可以食，鲜可以饱！
s2tt:
The flowers of reeds, so yellow and bright,
My heart is heavy, filled with sorrow's blight.
The leaves of reeds, so lush and green they grow,
Had I known this life, better not to be so.

Ewes with swollen heads, stars in fishing net's gleam,
Men may have food, but few can truly redeem.
s2tt_r:
原文：
调之花，云其黄矣。
心之忧矣，维其伤矣。
调之花，其叶青青。
知我如此，不如无生。
纷扬繁手，身心在流。
人可一时，显可一霸。

译文：
Flowers are adjusted, their petals yellow.
My heart is troubled, it hurts so.
Flowers are adjusted, their leaves green.
Knowing I am thus, it's better to be without life.
Fluffy hands, hearts flowing.
One can be for a moment, one can be a tyrant.

asr: 我觏之子，乘其四骆。乘其四骆，六辔沃若。左之左之，君子宜之。右之右之，君子有之。维其有之，是以似之。
s2tt_r:
原文：
我觏之子，乘其四骆。
乘其四骆，六辔沃若。
左之左之，君子宜之。
右之右之，君子有之。
维其有之，是以似之。

译文：
I meet this son, riding his four骆.
Riding his four骆, six reins lush and green.
Left and left, the gentleman is suitable.
Right and right, the gentleman possesses it.
For it is suitable, thus it is like it.

asr: 之子于征，有闻无声。允矣君子，展也大成。
s2tt:
The hero goes to war, we hear;
But no complaint comes from the rear.
O faithful to your lord, you won
A great deed nobly done.
s2tt_r:
原文：
知子于征，有问无生。
云已君子，展也大成。

译文：
I know you are on a journey,
With questions but no response.
You are a gentleman indeed,
Your achievements are vast and profound.

asr: 鱼在在藻，有颁其首。王在在镐，岂乐饮酒。鱼在在藻，有莘其尾。王在在镐，饮酒乐岂。鱼在在藻，依于其蒲。王在在镐，有那其居。
s2tt:
Fish in the pond, among the weeds,
With head so large and fine.
The king in Hao, among his deeds,
Drinks joyfully his wine.

Fish in the pond, among the weeds,
With tail so long and bright.
The king in Hao, among his deeds,
Drinks merrily with delight.

Fish in the pond, among the weeds,
By rushes they abide.
The king in Hao, among his deeds,
Lives in his royal pride.
s2tt_r:
原文：
鱼哉哉藻，有焚其首。
王哉哉昊，凯乐饮酒。
鱼哉哉藻，有申其尾。
王哉哉昊，饮酒乐凯。
鱼哉哉藻，依于其蒲。
王哉哉昊，有挪其居。

译文：
Fish swim in algae, their heads ablaze,
King revels in joy, drinks with glee.
Fish swim in algae, their tails display,
King revels in joy, drinks with glee.
Fish swim in algae, by reeds they stay,
King revels in joy, moves with glee.

asr: 淑人君子，其仪不忒。其仪不忒，正是四国。鸤鸠在桑，其子在榛。淑人君子，正是国人，正是国人。胡不万年？
s2tt:
A man of virtue, noble and true,
His manners constant, ever new.
His manners constant, ever new,
He rules the lands with justice due.

The cuckoo perches on the mulberry tree,
Her young ones nest in hazel, wild and free.
A man of virtue, noble and true,
He guides his people, just and wise in view.
He guides his people, just and wise in view.
Oh, may his reign forever last and ever renew!
s2tt_r:
原文：
疏人君子，其一不特，其一不特，正视四国。施纠在桑，其子在征。疏人君子，正视国人，胡不万年？

译文：
Disengaged gentlemen, one not special, one not special, facing four nations. Applying correction in mulberry, their sons in campaign. Disengaged gentlemen, facing the people, why not a thousand years?

asr: 交交黄鸟，止于棘。谁从穆公？子车奄息。维此奄息，百夫之特。临其穴，惴惴其栗。彼苍者天，歼我良人！如可赎兮，人百其身！交交黄鸟，止于桑。谁从穆公？
s2tt:
Golden orioles, on thorn trees rest.
Who follow Duke Mu to his grave?
Zhonghang Yanxi, the bravest and best.
When he sees the tomb, he shivers with dread.
O azure Heaven, why should the good die?
Could we redeem him, a hundred would instead.
Golden orioles, on mulberries rest.
Who follow Duke Mu to his grave?
s2tt_r:
原文：
姣姣黄鸟，止于棘。
谁从穆公，资车掩息。
维此偃息，百夫之特。
临其穴，惴惴其栗。
彼苍天者，歼我良人。
如何淑兮，人百其身。
姣姣黄鸟，止于桑。
谁从穆公。

译文：
A beautiful yellow bird,
Perched on the thorn.
Who accompanied the king,
Provided a carriage to hide.
This one rests, a hundred men's strength.
Approaching the grave, trembling with fear.
Oh, heaven above, you have taken my beloved.
How kind, yet a hundred people's life.
A beautiful yellow bird,
Perched on the mulberry.
Who accompanied the king.

asr: 子车仲行。维此仲行，百夫之防。临其穴，惴惴其栗。彼苍者天，歼我良人！如可赎兮，人百其身！交交黄鸟，止于楚。谁从穆公？子车鍼虎。维此鍼虎，百夫之御。
s2tt: Ziju Zhonghang. This Zhonghang, a match for a hundred men. When they approach his grave, they tremble with fear. O blue heaven, why destroy our good men? Could we but ransom him, there are a hundred who would give their lives! Chirp, chirp, the yellow birds rest on the jujube trees. Who followed Duke Mu? Ziju Qianhu. This Qianhu, a match for a hundred men.
s2tt_r:
子居众行，唯此众行。百夫之房，临其穴，惴惴其栗。彼苍者天，歼我良人，如可赎兮，人百其身。交交黄鸟，止于楚。谁从穆公？子居针虎，唯此针虎，百夫之御。

译文：
In the midst of many paths, this path alone stands out.
A hundred men's house, near their graves, they tremble in fear.
Oh, heaven above, why destroy my beloved?
If I could redeem them, a hundred men would pay the price.
The yellow birds chirp, resting on the楚 (a type of tree).
Who follows the king, Mu?
Zi Jū sews a tiger, only this tiger, guarding a hundred men.

asr: 临其穴，惴惴其栗。彼苍者天，歼我良人！如可赎兮，人百其身！
s2tt:
By the grave I stand, trembling with dread.
O azure Heaven, why claim the best instead?
Could life be redeemed, a hundredfold we'd pay,
To bring our noble men back from the clay.
s2tt_r:
原文：
临其穴，惴惴其栗。
彼苍天者，曷其有极？
我生未几，念彼共人。
人百其身，亦可卒戒。

译文：
At the grave, trembling with fear,
The heavens above, how can they bear?
My life is short, yet I think of you,
A hundred times, I warn and rue.

asr: 黄鸟黄鸟，无集于穀，无啄我粟。此邦之人，不我肯谷。言旋言归，复我邦族。黄鸟黄鸟，无集于桑，无啄我粱。此邦之人，不可与明。言旋言归，复我诸兄。
s2tt:
Yellow birds, oh yellow birds,
Perch not on my mulberry tree,
Peck not my millet grains, I plea.
In this land, no kindness flows,
No welcome for my weary woes.
I'll turn back, I'll homeward flee,
To my own kin and country.

Yellow birds, oh yellow birds,
Light not on my mulberry bough,
Touch not my sorghum, I avow.
In this place, no truth is found,
No honest dealings to be bound.
I'll turn back, I'll homeward go,
To my own brothers that I know.
s2tt_r:
原文：
黄鸟黄鸟，无集于谷，无啄我粟。此邦之人，不我肯谷。言旋言归，复我邦族。黄鸟黄鸟，无集于桑，无啄我梁。此邦之人，不可与明。言旋言归，复我诸兄。

译文：
Yellow birds, yellow birds,
Do not gather in the valley,
Do not peck at my grain.
The people of this land,
Do not give me grain.
Return, return,
Restore my family.

Yellow birds, yellow birds,
Do not gather in the mulberry,
Do not peck at my grain.
The people of this land,
Are not to be understood.
Return, return,
Restore my brothers.

asr: 黄鸟黄鸟，无集于栩，无啄我黍。此邦之人，不可与处。言旋言归，复我诸父。
s2tt:
Yellow birds, O yellow birds,
Don't perch on oak trees,
Don't peck my millet seeds.
The people here are not my kind,
I'll go back, I'll go home,
To my father's side.
s2tt_r:
原文：
黄鸟黄鸟，无集于宇，无啄我黍。此邦之人，不可与处。言旋言归，复我诸父。

译文：
Yellow birds, yellow birds, do not gather on the roof, do not peck at my millet. The people of this land, are not fit to dwell with. Speak and return, restore my brothers.

asr: 莫不率从，鲁侯之功。保有凫绎，遂荒徐宅。至于海邦，淮夷蛮貊。及彼南夷，莫不率从。莫敢不诺，鲁侯是若。天锡公纯嘏，眉寿保鲁。居常与许，复周公之宇。
s2tt:
All submit to his command,
The Duke of Lu's great hand.
He holds Fu and Yi Hill,
And Xu's land at his will.
To the sea states he goes,
And Huai tribes he o'erthrows.
The southern tribes as well
Submit to his rule fell.
None dare say no to him,
All follow his will grim.
Heaven grants him pure grace,
Long life to guard Lu's place.
He holds Chang and Xu's land,
Restoring Zhou's command.
s2tt_r:
莫不率从，鲁侯之功，保有弗逸。岁荒徐宅，至于海邦，怀夷蛮貊，及彼南夷。莫不率从，莫敢不诺。鲁侯若是，天赐公纯嘏，眉寿保鲁，长居于许，复周公之宇。

译文：
All follow, the Duke of Lu's merit,  
Preserved without end, his work.  
In times of famine, he dwells in peace,  
Reaching the sea's edge, embracing all,  
The barbarians and the distant,  
And the southern tribes, too.  
All follow, none dare to disobey.  
The Duke of Lu, if so,  
Heaven grants you pure blessings,  
Longevity and peace,  
A long life,  
Settling in Xu,  
Restoring the宇 of Duke Zhou.

asr: 鲁侯燕喜，令妻寿母。宜大夫庶士，邦国是有。既多受祉，黄发儿齿。徂徠之松，新甫之柏。是断是度，是寻是尺。松桷有舄，路寝孔硕，新庙奕奕。奚斯所作，孔曼且硕，万民是若。
s2tt:
The prince of Lu feasts with delight;  
His wife and mother share his joy.  
All officers and men of state  
Are pleased to serve the prince so great.  
Heaven sends him down great happiness;  
His hair turns yellow, teeth grow new.  
The pines of Culai and cypresses  
Of Xinpu are cut and measured true.  
The rafters made of pine are long;  
The hall is large and temple strong.  
The temple built by Xi Si stands  
So long and large in all men's lands.
s2tt_r:
鲁侯宴喜令其寿母，以大夫束事，邦国是友，既多受祉，黄发而齿。徂徕之松，新甫之柏，是断是斫，是寻是尺。松桷有舄，路寝孔硕，新庙奕奕。昔之所作，孔曼且硕，万民是若。

译文：
The Duke of Lu celebrated a feast for his mother's birthday, with the help of a doctor, and the country was his friend. He received many blessings, and his hair turned yellow and his teeth grew white. The pine trees of Culei, the cypress trees of Xinpu, were cut and chopped, measured and cut. The wooden beams had shoes, the hall was very large, and the new temple was magnificent. What he had done in the past was both beautiful and grand, and all the people were like him.

asr: 方叔涖止，其车三千。旂旐央央，方叔率止。约軧错衡，八鸾玱玱。服其命服，朱芾斯皇，有玱葱珩。鴥彼飞隼，其飞戾天，亦集爰止。方叔涖止，其车三千。
s2tt:
When Fang Shu arrives, his chariots are three thousand grand,
With banners fluttering, he leads the command.
Axles bound, crossbars adorned, eight bells ring clear and bright,
In robes of office, crimson splendor shines in light,
With pendants green that gleam in sight.
Like falcons swift that soar on high,
Reaching the sky, then resting nigh.
When Fang Shu arrives, his chariots are three thousand strong,
In ordered ranks, they march along.
s2tt_r: 方叔率止，其车三千，其马盈衡。方叔率止，其车三千，其马盈衡。

asr: 师干之试，方叔率止。钲人伐鼓，陈师鞠旅。显允方叔，伐鼓渊渊，振旅阗阗。蠢尔蛮荆，大邦为仇。方叔元老，克壮其犹。方叔率止，执讯获丑。戎车啴啴，啴啴焞焞，如霆如雷。
s2tt:
The troops are tried in martial art;  
Fang Shu leads them with noble heart.  
The gongsmen beat the drums with might,  
Arraying hosts for battle's fight.  
Illustrious, true, is Fang Shu's name,  
Whose drums resound with thunderous fame.  
The ranks in order loud advance,  
Awe-striking in their war-like dance.  

O foolish tribes of southern land,  
Against a mighty kingdom stand!  
Fang Shu, a veteran wise and grand,  
His plans are firm, his command grand.  
He leads his men with steady hand,  
Captives and spoils at his command.  
His chariots rumble, roll, and roar,  
Like crashing thunders, more and more.
s2tt_r:
诗干之誓，方叔率止。征人伐鼓，陈师鞠旅。显允方叔，伐鼓渊渊。振旅阗阗，纯耳满襟。大邦为仇，方叔元老。克壮其猷，方叔率止。执讯获丑，戎车啴啴。啴啴焞焞，如霆如雷。

译文：
The oath of the poem's beginning, 
Fang Shu leads the way. 
The soldiers beat their drums, 
The army forms a line. 
Fang Shu, distinguished and brave, 
Beats the drums with a resounding sound. 
The troops march in unison, 
Their ears filled with the harmony. 
Great enemies become foes, 
Fang Shu, the elder statesman. 
With wisdom and courage, 
Fang Shu leads the way. 
Capturing prisoners and enemies, 
The war chariots move slowly. 
Slowly and steadily, 
Like thunder and lightning.

asr: 不留不处，三事就绪。赫赫业业，有严天子。王舒保作，匪绍匪游。徐方绎骚，震惊徐方。如雷如霆，徐方震惊。王奋厥武，如震如怒。进厥虎臣，阚如虓虎。
s2tt:
No stay, no rest,  
Three tasks are done.  
Majestic, grand,  
The stern Son of Heaven.  
The king marched forth,  
Not for leisure, not for play.  
The Xu lands stirred,  
Shaken to the core.  
Like thunder, like lightning,  
Xu trembled in fear.  
The king roused his might,  
Like quake, like wrath.  
His tiger-warriors advanced,  
Roaring like fierce tigers.
s2tt_r:
原文：
不流不处，三事就绪。
赫赫业业，有严天子。
王叔保坐，匪绍匪由。
徐方义骚，震金徐方。
如雷如霆，徐方震金。
王奋厥武，如震如怒。
既觉虎臣，罕如虓虎。

译文：
Without flow or pause, three matters are settled.
Greatly established, there is a strict ruler.
The king's uncle sits, not for leisure.
The Dukedom of the North is in turmoil, shaking gold.
Like thunder and lightning, the North shakes gold.
The king exerts his power, like thunder and anger.
Having awakened the tiger ministers, rare as a roaring tiger.

asr: 铺敦淮濆，仍执丑虏。截彼淮浦，王师之所。王旅啴啴，如飞如翰。如江如汉，如山之苞。如川之流，绵绵翼翼。不测不克，濯征徐国。王犹允塞，徐方既来。
s2tt:
On Huai's banks our troops deploy,
Capturing the foe with joy.
Along the stream our force appears,
The king's host dispelling fears.
The king's host in its array
Flies like eagles on its way.
Like rivers and mountains strong,
It sweeps all evils along.
It's like a stream from the hill,
Flowing onward, onward still.
It's irresistible force
Conquers Xu without remorse.
The king's plans are carried out,
Xu comes to us without doubt.
s2tt_r:
原文：
铺陈淮坟，仍执仇虏，结比淮浦。王师之所，王旅贪贪，如飞如翰，如江如汉，如山之包，如川之流，绵绵翼翼，不测不刻。濯征徐国，王有允塞，徐方既来。

译文：
Laying out the graves by the Huai River,
Still holding the enemy, uniting by the riverbank.
Where the royal army is, the royal troops,
Like birds in flight, like rivers flowing,
Like mountains embracing, like rivers flowing,
Endlessly, boundlessly, unpredictable, unmeasurable.
Washing away the Dukedom of Xu,
The king has allowed, Xu has come.

asr: 徐方既同，天子之功。四方既平，徐方来庭。徐方不回，王曰还归。
s2tt_r:
原文：
徐方既同，天子之功。
四方既平，徐方来庭。
徐方不回，王曰旋归。

译文：
Xu Fang has joined,
The emperor's great achievement.
All四方have been pacified,
Xu Fang comes to court.
Xu Fang does not return,
The king says, "Return."

asr: 有杕之杜，其叶湑湑。独行踽踽。岂无他人？不如我同父。嗟行之人，胡不比焉？人无兄弟，胡不佽焉？有杕之杜，其叶菁菁。独行睘睘。岂无他人？不如我同姓。
s2tt:
A Lonely Tree

A lonely pear tree stands,
With leaves so lush and grand.
Alone I walk the lands.
Are there no other hands?
None like my own brother's bands.
O passers-by, why lend no aid?
A man without a brother's shade,
Why leave him in the glade?

A lonely pear tree grows,
With leaves in thickest rows.
Alone my journey goes.
Are there no friends to choose?
None of my own blood's hues.
O passers-by, why turn away?
A man without a brother's stay,
Why let him stray astray?
s2tt_r:
原文：
有弟皆分散，无家问死生。
寄书长不达，况乃未休兵。

译文：
All brothers scattered, no home to ask about life and death.
Letters never reach, how can war cease?

asr: 嗟行之人，胡不比焉？人无兄弟，胡不佽焉？
s2tt:
O wanderers, why not stand by my side?
Brotherless, why not help me abide?
s2tt_r:
原文：
街行之人，胡不比焉？人无兄弟，胡不赐焉？

译文：
People walking on the street, why not gather together? Without brothers, why not give them?

asr: 凫鹥在泾，公尸来燕来宁。尔酒既清，尔肴既馨。公尸燕饮，福禄来成。凫鹥在沙，公尸来燕来宜。尔酒既多，尔肴既嘉。公尸燕饮，福禄来为。凫鹥在渚，公尸来燕来处。
s2tt:
Wild ducks on the stream,
The spirit comes to rest in dream.
Your wine is clear,
Your dishes smell sweet here.
The spirit drinks his fill,
Good fortune comes at will.
Wild ducks on the sand,
The spirit comes to bless the land.
Your wine is not few,
Your dishes are good, too.
The spirit drinks his fill,
Good fortune comes at will.
Wild ducks on the isle,
The spirit comes to rest awhile.
s2tt_r:
原文：
弗衣载襟，公尸来燕来宁。
尔酒既清，尔肴既馨。
公尸燕饮，福禄来成。
弗衣载裳，公尸来燕来仪。
尔酒既多，尔肴既嘉。
公尸燕饮，福禄来维。
弗衣载主，公尸来燕来楚。

译文：
Clothes on the chest, the lord comes to feast and rest.
Your wine is clear, your dishes are fragrant.
The lord feasts and drinks, blessings and joys are complete.
Clothes on the skirt, the lord comes to feast and show respect.
Your wine is abundant, your dishes are fine.
The lord feasts and drinks, blessings and joys are maintained.
Clothes on the head, the lord comes to feast and bring peace.

asr: 尔酒既湑，尔肴伊脯。公尸燕饮，福禄来下。凫鹥在潀，公尸来燕来宗。既燕于宗，福禄攸降。公尸燕饮，福禄来崇。凫鹥在亹，公尸来止熏熏。旨酒欣欣，燔炙芬芬。
s2tt:
Your wine is clear and fine,
Your viands rich and sweet.
The prince's spirit feasts with us,
And blessings we shall meet.

The ducks and gulls in streams are seen,
The spirit comes with grace serene.
He feasts within the hall,
And blessings on us fall.

The prince's spirit feasts with us,
And blessings multiply.
The ducks and gulls at isles appear,
The spirit comes with joy and cheer.

With wine that gladdens heart,
And roast meats' fragrant art.
s2tt_r:
原文：
而酒既许，而肴亦敷。公师宴矣，福禄来下。服衣载从，公师来燕来宗。既燕于宗，福禄优降。公师宴矣，福禄来从。服缨载门，公师来止。熏熏，执酒欣欣，繁志纷纷。

译文：
Wine has been promised, and dishes laid out.
The master feasts, blessings and joys descend.
Clothes are worn, the master comes to the ancestral hall.
After the feast in the ancestral hall, blessings and joys descend.
The master feasts, blessings and joys come.
Clothes are worn at the door, the master arrives.
Drunk, holding wine, hearts are filled with joy,
Thoughts are scattered, hearts are filled with joy.

asr: 以享以祀，以介景福。瑟彼柞棫，民所燎矣。岂弟君子，神所劳矣。莫莫葛藟，施于条枚。岂弟君子，求福不回。
s2tt:
With offerings and rites we pray,  
For blessings bright and grand.  
The oaks and thorn trees, lush and gay,  
Are burned by people's hand.  
O noble prince, serene and kind,  
By gods you're favored well.  
The creeping vines, by fate entwined,  
On branches climb and dwell.  
O noble prince, with virtue true,  
For blessings pure you strive.
s2tt_r:
原文：
宜言饮酒，与子偕老。
琴瑟友之，钟鼓乐之。
岂敢定居，一月三捷。
岂敢定居，一月三捷。
王事靡盬，不遑启处。
岂不怀归，心怀二亲。
王事靡盬，不遑启处。
有敦瓜苦，烝在栗薪。
岂不日戒，有子七人。
王事靡盬，不遑启处。
有敦瓜苦，烝在栗薪。
有敦瓜苦，烝在栗薪。
王事靡盬，不遑启处。
有敦瓜苦，烝在栗薪。
译文：
It is time to drink wine,
And grow old together with you.
With the lute and the zither,
With the bells and the drums.
How dare we settle down,
When we win three battles in a month?
How dare we settle down,
When we win three battles in a month?
The king's affairs are never done,
And we have no time to rest.
How can we not long to return home?
Our hearts are filled with thoughts of our parents.
The king's affairs are never done,
And we have no time to rest.
There are many bitter gourds,
Steamed and cooked in the firewood.
How can we not be vigilant every day?
We have seven children.
The king's affairs are never done,
And we have no time to rest.
There are many bitter gourds,
Steamed and cooked in the firewood.
There are many bitter gourds,
Steamed and cooked in the firewood.
The king's affairs are never done,
And we have no time to rest.
There are many bitter gourds,
Steamed and cooked in the firewood.

asr: 駉駉牡马，在坰之野。薄言駉者，有驒有骆，有骝有雒，以车绎绎。思无斁，思马斯作。駉駉牡马，在坰之野。薄言駉者，有骃有騢，有驔有鱼，以车祛祛。思无邪，思马斯徂。
s2tt:
Sturdy stallions, strong and bold,
Roam the wilderness untold.
Here are dappled, there are bay,
Some are chestnut, some are gray,
Drawing chariots in array.
Train them well with tireless care,
Make them worthy steeds and rare.

Sturdy stallions, strong and free,
Roam the plains for all to see.
Some are roan, and some are red,
Some with white on legs or head,
Drawing chariots where they're led.
Guide them true with purpose pure,
Make their lasting strength endure.
s2tt_r:
原文：
中流马在中之野，
薄言马者，有驼有落，
有流有落，以车翼翼，
思无翼，思马思作。
中流马在中之野，
薄言马者，有衣有瑕，
有电有鱼，以车区区，
思无邪，思马思处。

译文：
In the middle of the field, horses in the stream,
When we speak of horses, some are hunched, some fall,
Some flow, some fall, with carriages in line,
Thinking of flightless, thinking of horses and streams.
In the middle of the field, horses in the stream,
When we speak of horses, some are clothed, some flawed,
Some electric, some fish, with carriages in line,
Thinking of innocence, thinking of horses and streams.

asr: 九罭之鱼，鳟鲂。我觏之子，衮衣绣裳。鸿飞遵渚，公归无所，於女信处。鸿飞遵陆，公归不复，於女信宿。是以有衮衣兮，无以我公归兮，无使我心悲兮。
s2tt:
Nine nets in the stream, trout and bream caught;
I meet my lord, in broidered robe clad.
Wild geese along the islets fly;
My lord, where will you homeward hie?
With you here let me stay.
Wild geese along the hills fly high;
My lord, you'll go beyond the sky.
With you here let me lie.
So I keep your robe bright
Lest you should take your flight,
Lest you should leave me in endless night.
s2tt_r:
原文：
九域之于尊房，我构之子，衮衣绣裳。鸿飞遵渚，宫闺无所。与女信处，鸿飞遵路。宫闺不复，与女信宿。逝矣有衮衣兮，无以我宫闺兮，无使我心悲兮。

译文：
Nine regions under the high hall,
My son in the palace, dressed in fine attire.
The swan flies along the riverbank,
The palace is empty, no trace of her.
With you, I trust, the swan flies along the road.
The palace is gone, I stay with you.
The swan flies away, time passes,
Do not forget my palace, my heart will grieve.

asr: 文王既勤止，我应受之。敷时绎思，我徂维求定。时周之命，於绎思。
s2tt:
King Wen's toil has borne its fruit,
I, his heir, must execute.
His plans I'll spread and carry through,
To bring the land peace ever new.
This charge from Zhou, this high decree,
Demands our thought unceasingly.
s2tt_r:
文王既勤止，我应受之。夫时亦思，我徂为求定。时周之命，勿逸斯。
译文：
King Wen has worked hard,
And I shall accept his rule.
The time calls for thought,
As I journey to seek peace.
The Zhou's mandate, do not forget,
In this moment, let it be fulfilled.

asr: 思乐泮水，薄采其芹。鲁侯戾止，言观其旂。其旂茷茷，鸾声哕哕。无小无大，从公于迈。思乐泮水，薄采其藻。鲁侯戾止，其马蹻蹻。其马蹻蹻，其音昭昭。
s2tt:
How we love the Pan Stream's flow,
Where celery we may pluck and grow.
Our lord of Lu comes to this place,
We see his flags with waving grace.
His flags are fluttering in the air,
His bells ring out with music rare.
Both great and small, in order due,
Follow our lord in retinue.

How we love the Pan Stream's flow,
Where water weeds we may pluck and grow.
Our lord of Lu comes to this place,
His steeds are prancing with good grace.
His steeds are prancing to and fro,
His voice is clear as it may go.
s2tt_r:
原文：
思乐泮水，薄采其芹。
鲁侯戾止，言观其旗。
其旗淠淠，鸾声哕哕。
五小五大，从公于迈。
思乐泮水，薄采其藻。
鲁侯戾止，其马角角。
角角其马，其音昭昭。

译文：
Thinking of the pleasant water,
Gently picking its greenery.
The ruler of Lu arrives,
Observing the flags with care.
The flags flutter softly,
The birdsong echoes softly.
Five small, five large,
Following the ruler on the road.
Thinking of the pleasant water,
Gently picking its seaweed.
The ruler of Lu arrives,
The horses' horns are sharp.
Sharp as the horses' horns,
Their sounds are clear and loud.

asr: 载色载笑，匪怒伊教。思乐泮水，薄采其茆。鲁侯戾止，在泮饮酒。既饮旨酒，永锡难老。顺彼长道，屈此群丑。穆穆鲁侯，敬明其德。敬慎威仪，维民之则。
s2tt:
With smiles and cheer, no ire appears,
But gentle words to guide our peers.
By Pan Stream's banks, in joy we stand,
To gather herbs from water's land.
Lord of Lu comes with grace and might,
To drink in Pan with pure delight.
The wine is sweet, the cup we raise,
May endless youth crown all his days.
He treads the path of virtue long,
And quells the proud, the fierce, the wrong.
O noble Lord of Lu, serene,
Your virtue bright and clear is seen.
With reverence in each deed and face,
You set for all the ruling grace.
s2tt_r:
原文：
再射再校，匪怒伊教，斯乐畔水，博采其毛。鲁侯莅止，载旆饮酒，既饮止酒，永赐南老。顺彼长道，屈此群丑。穆穆鲁侯，敬明其德，敬慎威仪，为民之则。

译文：
Aiming and校准，非因怒气，乐在水畔，博采其毛。鲁侯莅临，挥旗饮酒，既饮止酒，永赐南老。顺着长道，屈此群丑。穆穆鲁侯，敬明其德，敬慎威仪，为民之则。

asr: 允文允武，昭假烈祖。靡有不孝，自求伊祜。明明鲁侯，克明其德。既作泮宫，淮夷攸服。矫矫虎臣，在泮献馘。淑问如皋陶，在泮献囚。济济多士，克广德心。
s2tt:
Both in letters and in arms,  
He honors his forefathers' charms.  
With filial heart, he seeks the grace,  
To rule with virtue's gentle pace.  
The Marquis of Lu, wise and bright,  
Upholds the good with all his might.  
He builds the school by waters clear,  
To tame the tribes both far and near.  
His warriors brave, with trophies grand,  
Present their spoils on this fair land.  
Like Gao Yao, just in every plea,  
They bring their captives, bound and free.  
The scholars gather, noble, true,  
To spread the virtue, old and new.
s2tt_r:
原文：
远闻云武招甲列祖，
靡有不孝自求一户。
明明鲁侯克民其德，
既作叛公怀以忧服。
皎皎户臣在叛献国，
疏问如高瑶。
在叛献求及己多事，
克广德心。

译文：
Far heard the martial call of the ancestors,
No one dares to be unfaithful to their duty.
The wise ruler of Lu subdued the people with virtue,
And though he rebelled, he was still held in awe.
The loyal subjects of the rebel state,
As if they were high mountains.
In the rebellion, they sought their own interests,
But still, they broadened their hearts with virtue.

asr: 桓桓于征，狄彼东南。烝烝皇皇，不吴不扬。不告于讻，在泮献功。角弓其觩，束矢其搜。戎车孔博，徒御无斁。既克淮夷，孔淑不逆。式固尔犹，淮夷卒获。
s2tt:
Proudly we march to war,
To quell the tribes in south afar.
In solemn might, with no loud boast,
No strife we stir from coast to coast.
No turmoil told, no discord sown,
In hall of learning feats are shown.
Bent are the horn-tipped bows we hold,
Like flight of arrows, straight and bold.
Our chariots grand in battle gleam,
Each driver steadfast as in dream.
The Huai tribes conquered, tamed their pride,
They yield to rule and turn the tide.
By strategies firm and wisely laid,
The southern realms to peace are swayed.
s2tt_r:
原文：
环环于中，涕比东南。
铮铮惶惶，不吾不扬。
不告于兄，再判宪公。
剿攻其囚，术使其搜。
戎车孔博，徒欲无益。
既克怀疑，恐疏不逆。
是故而由，怀疑足惑。

译文：
In the midst of the ring, tears flow to the southeast.
Ringing and anxious, not without my voice.
Without informing my brother, I again judge the constitutional public.
To attack and capture his prisoners, using tactics to search.
The army is vast, but徒ly useless.
After victory, there is doubt, fearing neglect and disobedience.
Therefore, doubt arises, enough to confuse.

asr: 翩彼飞鸮，集于泮林。食我桑葚，怀我好音。憬彼淮夷，来献其琛。元龟象齿，大赂南金。
s2tt:
The owl in flight,  
On groves alight.  
Feasting on mulberries sweet,  
It sings with voice replete.  
The tribes from Huai,  
With tribute nigh.  
Tortoise-shell and ivory bright,  
And southern gold they bring to light.
s2tt_r:
偏彼飞萧，集于判林。
使我桑葚，怀我好音。
井彼淮夷，来献其琛。
元龟象齿，大麓南金。

译文：
The flying crows gather in the divided forest,
Making my heart yearn for the sweet mulberry.
The淮夷 brings their treasures to offer,
With the precious bones and ivory, the southern gold.

asr: 既破我斧，又缺我斨。周公东征，四国是皇。哀我人斯，亦孔之将。既破我斧，又缺我锜。周公东征，四国是吪。哀我人斯，亦孔之嘉。既破我斧，又缺我銶。
s2tt_r:
原文：
既破我斧，又缺我斨。
周公东征，四国是皇。
哀我人斯，亦孔之将。
既破我斧，又缺我锜。
周公东征，四国是遏。
哀我人斯，亦孔之嘉。
既破我斧，又缺我斨。
周公东征，四国是皇。
哀我人斯，亦孔之将。

译文：
My axe is broken, my adz is gone,
Zhou Gong to the east, four nations he won.
Alas, my people, they are about to fall.
My axe is broken, my adz is gone,
Zhou Gong to the east, four nations he won.
Alas, my people, they are about to fall.
My axe is broken, my adz is gone,
Zhou Gong to the east, four nations he won.
Alas, my people, they are about to fall.

asr: 周公东征，四国是遒。哀我人斯，亦孔之休。
s2tt:
The Duke marched east, the states he swayed;
For us, alas, what good he made!
s2tt_r:
周公东征，四国是求。哀我人斯，亦孔之休。
译文：
Zhou Gong's eastern campaign,
Four nations seek his command.
Alas, my people's plight,
Is truly a great shame.

asr: 交交桑扈，有莺其羽。君子乐胥，受天之祜。交交桑扈，有莺其领。君子乐胥，万邦之屏。之屏之翰，百辟为宪。不戢不难，受福不那。兕觥其觩，旨酒思柔。
s2tt:
The finch sings in the mulberry tree,
With feathers bright and free.
The noble lord is full of glee,
Blessed by heaven's decree.

The finch sings in the mulberry tree,
With collar fair to see.
The noble lord is full of glee,
A shield for all to be.

A shield, a prop, a steadfast stay,
A model for the realm's array.
With grace and virtue ever near,
Boundless blessings shall appear.

The rhino cup with curves so fine,
Holds mellow wine, divine.
s2tt_r:
原文：
交交桑扈，有鸣其羽。君子乐胥，受天之祜。
交交桑扈，有鸣其里。君子乐胥，万邦之屏。
知平之旱，百辟维宪。不疾不挠，受福不挠。
肆共其求，执酒斯柔。

译文：
The桑扈 bird sings its song,
In the forest, in the town.
The noble man finds joy,
Blessed by heaven's grace.

The桑扈 bird sings its song,
In the village, in the town.
The noble man finds joy,
A shield for all the land.

Knowing the drought's pain,
All the people follow the law.
Without haste or delay,
They receive blessings without end.

Together they seek,
With wine they find peace.

asr: 时迈其邦，昊天其子之，实右序有周。薄言震之，莫不震叠。怀柔百神，及河乔岳，允王维后。明昭有周，式序在位。载戢干戈，载櫜弓矢。我求懿德，肆于时夏，允王保之。
s2tt:
The states now move in season's grace,
Heaven's Son shows his embrace,
And aids the Zhou with power.
His thunders roll with awe,
All tremble and adore.
He soothes each spirit's might,
The streams and mountains bright,
True king, our shield and tower.

The Zhou shines clear and high,
In order thrones rely.
Spears, shields are laid away,
Bows, arrows stored for day.
We seek the virtuous way,
To spread in summer's sway,
True king, our guard for aye.
s2tt_r:
原文：
时迈其邦，昊天其子之。
时佑序有周，伯言正之。
莫不震叠，怀柔百神。
及和乔岳，允王维后。
明昭有周，世序在位。
在即干戈，在高宫室。
我求翼德，肆于时夏。
允王保之。

译文：
In the vast expanse of time, the nation moves forward,
The heavens, as its son, guides the way.
With the grace of the times, the Zhou dynasty flourishes,
Under the wise governance of the elder.
All are in harmony, embracing the divine.
With the unity of the mountains and rivers, the king's legacy endures.
Bright and clear, the Zhou dynasty shines,
Maintaining its order through the ages.
In the midst of strife, in the high halls of power,
I seek the winged virtue, spreading it across the summer.
The king's protection is secure.

asr: 芃芃黍苗，阴雨膏之。悠悠南行，召伯劳之。我任我辇，我车我牛。我行既集，盖云归哉。我徒我御，我师我旅。我行既集，盖云归处。肃肃谢功，召伯营之。
s2tt:
Lush, lush the millet grows,
Moistened by rain it glows.
Long, long the southward way,
Lord Shao cheers us, they say.

We push the carts, we bear the load,
We drive the oxen on the road.
Our journey done, we'll homeward go,
To rest our weary limbs, I trow.

We march on foot, we ride in car,
In troops we come from lands afar.
Our journey done, we'll homeward wend,
To find our journey's peaceful end.

The city walls stand firm and high,
Built by Lord Shao 'neath the sky.
s2tt_r:
原文：
蓬蓬鼠苗，阴雨告之。
悠悠南行，少伯劳之。
我任我辇，我车我牛。
我行既疾，何云归哉？
我涂我御，我师我旅。
我行既疾，何云归处？
速速谢公，少伯吟之。

译文：
Pom-pom mouse sprout, rain tells.
Southward journey, young man劳.
My carriage, my ox, I drive.
My pace swift, where shall I go?
My path, my charioteer, my teacher, my companion.
My pace swift, where shall I go?
Quickly bid farewell, young man sings.

asr: 烈烈征师，召伯成之。原隰既平，泉流既清。召伯有成，王心则宁。
s2tt_r:
原文：
烈烈征师，绍伯成之。
源兮既平，泉流既清。
绍伯有成，王心则宁。

译文：
A grand army departs,
With great strength, Shao Bo leads the way.
The source is now at peace,
The stream flows clear and bright.
With Shao Bo's success,
King's heart finds its peace.

asr: 驷驖孔阜，六辔在手。公之媚子，从公于狩。奉时辰牡，辰牡孔硕。公曰左之，舍拔则获。游于北园，四马既闲。輶车鸾镳，载猃歇骄。
s2tt:
Four steeds, sleek and strong,
Six reins held long.
The lord's favorite son
Follows the hunt begun.
The season's game, grand and prime,
Is offered in due time.
"Turn left," the lord's command,
And the arrow leaves the hand.
In the north garden they roam,
Four steeds now free to roam.
Light chariots, bells on the rein,
Carry hounds home again.
s2tt_r:
原文：
四铁孔赋六辔在手，弓之妹子，从弓于兽。奉时乘母，乘母孔硕。弓曰左之，舍拔则获。由余北辕，驷马既衔，由车栾镳，载险歇郊。

译文：
Four iron holes, six reins in hand,
Bow's sister, following the hunt.
Feng's mother, riding strong and bold,
Bow named Zuo, release and catch.
You Yu heading north, horses in harness,
Carriage wheels, facing danger's path.
Exhausted, they rest at the northern outskirts.

asr: 谁谓尔无羊？三百维群。谁谓尔无牛？九十其犉。尔羊来思，其角濈濈。尔牛来思，其耳湿湿。或降于阿，或饮于池，或寝或讹。尔牧来思，何蓑何笠，或负其餱。
s2tt:
Who says you have no sheep?
Three hundred in a flock appear.
Who says you have no oxen?
Ninety-sleek black ones are here.
Your sheep come along,
Horns thick and strong;
Your oxen move on,
With ears wagging.
Some go down the hill,
Some drink at the rill,
Some sleep or awake.
Your shepherd will take
His grass-cloak and hat
And provisions for that.
s2tt_r:
原文：
谁谓尔无羊？三百维群。
谁谓尔无牛？九十其犉。
尔羊来思，其角棘棘。
尔牛来思，其耳施施。
或降于阿，或饮于池，
或寝或讹。
尔牧来思，何蓑何笠，
或负其糇。

译文：
Who says you have no sheep? Three hundred in a flock.
Who says you have no cattle? Ninety in their strength.
Your sheep come, their horns sharp and strong.
Your cattle come, their ears long and long.
Some descend to the slope, some drink by the pool,
Some rest, some lie down.
Your herders come, with their蓑and their笠,
Some carry their food.

asr: 三十维物，尔牲则具。尔牧来思，以薪以蒸，以雌以雄。尔羊来思，矜矜兢兢，不骞不崩。麾之以肱，毕来既升。牧人乃梦，众维鱼矣，旐维旟矣，大人占之：众维鱼矣，实维丰年旐维旟矣，室家溱溱。
s2tt:
Thirty chariots, each with its team,  
And your victims all complete,  
Your herdsmen come,  
With their faggots and their brush,  
With their herds of males and females.  
Your sheep arrive,  
In good condition, large and strong,  
None injured, none sick.  
You wave to them with your arms,  
And they all prance up the hall.  
The herdsmen then dream,  
That locusts become fishes,  
That the tortoise-and-serpent banners become falcon banners,  
So the chief diviner interprets it:  
That the locusts become fishes  
Is a token of abundant years;  
That the tortoise-and-serpent banners become falcon banners  
Is a token of increasing population.
s2tt_r:
原文：
三十为物，二十则聚。耳目来思，以心以争。以此以雄，以次以雄。耳良来思，斤斤斤斤，不牵不崩。挥之以弓，必来既生。目人乃猛，众为鱼矣。赵为鱼矣。大人战之，众为鱼矣。实为丰年，赵为鱼矣。是家珍珍。

译文：
Thirty things are scattered,
Twenty gather together.
Ears and eyes come to think,
With heart and mind in contention.
With this to be strong,
With this to be strong.
Ears truly come to think,
斤斤斤斤, not tied nor broken.
With bow to strike,
It must come alive.
Eyes see people as fierce,
All become fish.
Zhao becomes fish.
Adults fight them,
All become fish.
Actually a bountiful year,
Zhao becomes fish.
This family treasures.

asr: 有駜有駜，駜彼乘黄。夙夜在公，在公明明。振振鹭，鹭于下。鼓咽咽，醉言舞。于胥乐兮！有駜有駜，駜彼乘牡。夙夜在公，在公饮酒。振振鹭，鹭于飞。鼓咽咽，醉言归。
s2tt:
Steeds strong and stout,  
Steeds strong and stout,  
Draw yellow chariots proud.  
At court they toil day and night,  
With duty clear and bright.  
Like egrets in flight,  
They land in graceful might.  
Drums beat with deep delight,  
Drunk, they dance in the light.  
All share joy outright!  

Steeds strong and stout,  
Steeds strong and stout,  
Draw stallions' chariots loud.  
At court they toil day and night,  
With wine they dine in light.  
Like egrets in flight,  
They soar in graceful height.  
Drums beat with deep delight,  
Drunk, they go home at night.
s2tt_r:
原文：
有弟有弟，毕彼成黄。
夙夜在公，在公明明。
振振鹿鹿，于下，鼓咽咽，醉言舞。
于胥乐兮。
有弟有弟，毕彼成母。
夙夜在公，在公饮酒。
振振鹿鹿，于飞，鼓咽咽，醉言归。
译文：
Brother, brother, complete this task.
Day and night in public service, clear and bright.
Vibrant and lively, below, drums beat, drunk dancing.
Let us rejoice.
Brother, brother, complete this task.
Day and night in public service, drinking.
Vibrant and lively, flying, drums beat, drunk returning.

asr: 于胥乐兮！有駜有駜，駜彼乘駽。夙夜在公，在公载燕。自今以始，岁其有。君子有穀，诒孙子。于胥乐兮！
s2tt:
How happy we are, how gay!
How sleek and strong, how sleek and strong,
The steeds which draw our lord along!
At early dawn he serves the state,
And feasts at night till it is late.
From this day forth for years to come,
We'll have good harvest in our home.
Our lord will have good luck and cheer,
And leave his sons and grandsons here.
How happy we are, how gay!
s2tt_r:
原文：
余须乐兮，有庇有庇，庇彼圣轩。夙夜在公，在公在宴，自今以始，岁其有君子有谷，贻孙子。余须乐兮。

译文：
I am joyful, with shelter and protection, guarding the sacred hall. Day and night, I am dedicated to public service, in service and feast. From now on, may the year bring prosperity to the virtuous, to be passed on to future generations. I am joyful.

asr: 芃芃棫朴，薪之槱之。济济辟王，左右趣之。济济辟王，左右奉璋。奉璋峨峨，髦士攸宜。淠彼泾舟，烝徒楫之。周王于迈，六师及之。倬彼云汉，为章于天。
s2tt:
Lush grow the oaks and elms, 
As firewood they're piled. 
The king in stately grace, 
By aides is well served. 
The king in stately grace, 
With jade scepters they attend. 
Holding scepters high, 
These worthy men are fit. 
On Jing River boats float, 
By many oarsmen rowed. 
The king sets forth his march, 
Six armies follow him. 
Vast spreads the Milky Way, 
A splendid robe in sky.
s2tt_r:
原文：
蓬蓬郁甫，心之有之。
岌岌必亡，左右趋之。
岌岌必亡，左右奉之。
奉之峨峨，貌事优仪。
辟比金舟，征途及之。
舟亡于迈，六师及之。
濯比云汉，违章于天。

译文：
Pom-pom lush and full, heart's possession it is.
Tall and towering, doomed to fall, all around it is.
Tall and towering, doomed to fall, all around it is.
Fulfill it grand, appearance and manner it is.
Compared to a golden boat, journey it reaches.
Boat lost in motion, six armies it reaches.
Washed by the heavenly river, law it breaks.

asr: 瞻卬昊天，则不我惠？孔填不宁，降此大厉。邦靡有定，士民其瘵。蟊贼蟊疾，靡有夷届。罪罟不收，靡有夷瘳！人有土田，女反有之。人有民人，女覆夺之。
s2tt:
I look up to the sky so vast and high,
But why should it on me no favor shower?
Long have I been in fear and anxiety,
For Heaven sends down woe and dour.
The state is in disorder and unrest,
Officers and people are in distress.
Like pests and vermin harmful to the crop,
The evil-doers never stop.
They spread their nets to catch the innocent,
And never will their cruelty relent.
Some people have their fields and land,
But you have taken them in hand.
Some people have their serfs and men,
But you have robbed them now and then.
s2tt_r:
瞻仰昊天，则不我讳，恐臣不宁，降此大戾。邦民有定，是民其宅。谋贼谋及，民有遗戒。罪罟不收，民有遗畴。人有土田，汝反有之；人有名任，汝父夺之。
译文：
I look up to the vast sky, yet it does not hide from me, fearing that my subjects may not be at peace, and thus bring down this great calamity. The people of the state have their place, and this is where they dwell. Those who plot against the people, they have left behind a warning. The nets of justice are not collected, and the people have lost their fields. The people have their land and fields, yet you have taken them; the people have their positions and roles, yet your father has taken them.

asr: 人之云亡，邦国殄瘁！天之降罔，维其优矣。人之云亡，心之忧矣。天之降罔，维其几矣。人之云亡，心之悲矣！觱沸槛泉，维其深矣。心之忧矣，宁自今矣？
s2tt:
When good men pass away,
Our country goes to decay.
When Heaven sends down woe,
It's hard to escape the blow.
When good men pass away,
Our hearts are filled with dismay.
When Heaven sends down woe,
It's hard to escape the blow.
When good men pass away,
Our hearts are filled with grief.
The bubbling fountain flows
From deep source, as it shows.
Our hearts are filled with woe.
Is it only now so?
s2tt_r:
人之云亡，邦国殄瘁。
天之降亡，惟其忧矣。
人之云亡，心之忧矣。
天之降亡，惟其戚矣。
人之云亡，心之悲矣。
必复见权，惟其深矣。
心之忧矣，命自艰矣。

译文：
When people say they are gone,
The nation's strength fades away.
When heaven sends its doom,
It's only sorrow they'll see.
When people say they are gone,
Their hearts are filled with sorrow.
When heaven sends its doom,
It's only grief they'll feel.
When people say they are gone,
Their hearts are filled with grief.
To regain power, it must be deep.
Their hearts are filled with sorrow,
Life is hard.

asr: 不自我先，不自我后。藐藐昊天，无不克巩。无忝皇祖，式救尔后。
s2tt:
Not before me, nor after me,
Vast Heaven, firm and steadfast be.
Bring no shame to royal line,
Save your sons in days to shine.
s2tt_r:
原文：
不自我先，不自我后。
藐藐昊天，无不可拱。
我天皇祖，事旧而厚。

译文：
Not ahead of me, nor behind,
In the vast sky, all can be seen.
My heavenly ancestor, in olden days,
Performs great deeds with care.

asr: 君子至止，福禄既同。君子万年，保其家邦。
s2tt:
The noble lord arrives, with grace bestowed;
Wealth and honor blend, on common road.
May he live ten thousand years, and ever stand,
To guard our homeland with his mighty hand.
s2tt_r:
君子至止，福禄既同。君子万年，保其家邦。
译文：
The gentleman arrives, fortune and blessings in common. The gentleman endures for a thousand years, safeguarding his family and state.

asr: 阴山千里横东西，秋声浩浩鸣秋溪。猿猱鸿鹄不能过，天兵百万驰霜蹄。万倾松风落松子，郁郁苍苍映流水。六丁何事夸神威，天台罗浮移到此。云霞掩翳山重重，峰峦突兀何雄雄。
s2tt:
A thousand miles the Yinshan Mountains lie,
With autumn's roar the autumn streams reply.
No ape nor swan can fly across the height,
Our troops on frosted hooves sweep in their might.
Pine cones fall when through pines winds roar and pass,
Lush green is mirrored in the running glass.
Why should the gods have moved the mountains here,
With clouds and mists to make them disappear?
s2tt_r:
原文：
阴山千里横东西，
秋声浩浩鸣秋溪。
元老鸿鹄不能过，
天兵百万驰霜蹄。
万顷松风落松子，
郁郁苍苍映流水。
六丁何事夸神威，
天台罗浮疑到此。
云霞掩映山重重，
峰峦突兀何雄雄。

译文：
A thousand miles of Yin mountains stretch,
Autumn's voice resounds in the stream.
Elders and great birds cannot cross,
Millions of heavenly soldiers gallop on frosty hooves.
Millions of acres of pine wind drops pine seeds,
Green and lush reflecting flowing water.
Why do the six soldiers boast of divine power,
Tiantai and Luofu seem to have arrived here.
Clouds and mist intertwine with towering mountains,
Peaks rise abruptly, how majestic.

asr: 古来天险阻西域，人烟不与中原通。细路萦纡斜复宜，山角摩天不盈尺。溪风萧萧溪水寒，花落空山人影寂。四十八桥横雁行，胜游奇观真非常。临高俯视千万仞，令人凛凛生恐惶。
s2tt:
Since ancient times, the western realm by nature's barrier stands,
Where human traces seldom meet the heartlands' teeming bands.
Winding trails twist and turn, now steep, now gently spread,
Where mountain peaks scrape heaven, less than a foot overhead.
The stream-wind sighs and whispers, the waters chill and clear,
Blossoms fall in empty hills, no human soul draws near.
Forty-eight bridges span like wild geese on the wing,
A journey rare, a wondrous sight, an extraordinary thing.
From the lofty height I gaze down thousands of fathoms deep,
A shudder of awe and trembling fear within my soul does creep.
s2tt_r:
古来天险阻，西域人渊不与中原通。西麓萦纡挟复疑，山脚摩天不盈尺。
译文：
Anciently, the natural barrier was formidable, and the people of the Western Regions were isolated, not communicating with the Central Plains. The western foothills meandered and were full of doubts, and the mountain foot touched the sky, not exceeding a foot.

asr: 百里镜湖山顶上，旦暮云烟浮气象。山南山北多幽绝，几派飞泉练千丈。大河西注波无穷，千溪万壑皆会同。君成绮语壮奇诞，造物缩手神无功。山高四更才吐月，八月山峰半埋雪。
s2tt:
On Mirror Lake's peak, a hundred miles in sight,
From dawn to dusk, clouds drift in misty light.
North and south, the mountains in seclusion steep,
Where countless streams like silver ribbons leap.
The great river westward pours with endless might,
A thousand rills and vales converge in flight.
Your verse, with splendor and wonder brightly dyed,
Makes Nature's craft seem pale and nullified.
The moon climbs slow when fourth watch's bell has rung,
In eighth month, half the peaks in snow are flung.
s2tt_r:
原文：
百里镜湖山顶上，
淡抹云烟浮气象。
山南山北多幽绝，
几派飞泉练千丈。
大河西注波无穷，
千溪万壑皆会通。
君乘绮岩状奇诞，
造物缩手神无功。
山高四更才吐月，
八月山峰半埋雪。

译文：
On the summit of a hundred-mile lake,
Draped in mist, the landscape's serene.
North and south, the mountains are secluded,
Several streams of water, a thousand feet long.
The river flows westward, its waves endless,
Thousands of streams and valleys converge.
You ride on the strange rock, a sight so grand,
Nature's hand retreats, its power gone.
At four o'clock, the mountain peak reveals the moon,
In August, the peaks are half covered in snow.

asr: 匏有苦叶，济有深涉。深则厉，浅则揭。有瀰济盈，有鷕雉鸣。济盈不濡轨，雉鸣求其牡。雍雍鸣雁，旭日始旦。士如归妻，迨冰未泮。招招舟子，人涉卬否。
s2tt:
The gourd has bitter leaves, the ford is deep to wade.
Deep, then I'll swim across; shallow, I'll lift my gown.
The ford is full and wide, the pheasant calls her mate.
The ford won't wet the wheel; she calls her mate to come.
The wild geese honk and honk; the morning sun's aglow.
If you would come for me, come ere the ice would melt.
The boatman beckons me, but I will not go o'er.
s2tt_r:
原文：
庖有苦叶，己有申舍。
申则立，浅则弃。
有麋，己盈。
有杳，至明。
己盈不如鬼，至明求其母。
庸庸，明焰，续日使旦。
视如归，期，待兵未畔。
昭昭，周子人设，昂否。

译文：
In the kitchen, there are bitter leaves,
In the courtyard, there are discarded items.
Discarded items are kept, shallow ones are discarded.
There are deer, already full.
There are shadows, until dawn.
Fullness is not as good as ghosts, until dawn seeking its mother.
Ordinary, bright flame, extending the day to dawn.
Looking like home, waiting for soldiers not to rebel.
Clearly, Zhou's people set up, whether or not.

asr: 宴尔新昏，如兄如弟。泾以渭浊，湜湜其沚。宴尔新昏，不我屑以。毋逝我梁，毋发我笱。我躬不阅，遑恤我后！就其深矣，方之舟之。就其浅矣，泳之游之。
s2tt:
Feast you on your new delight,
Like brothers sharing day and night.
The Jing with Wei looks dim and drear,
Yet clear its waters still appear.
Feast you on your new delight,
To me you show no more respect.
Don't touch my weir, nor break my net,
For I myself am in neglect.
How can I care for what's behind,
When I'm forsaken and unkind?
Where the stream is deep and wide,
I'll cross it by boat or by raft.
Where the stream is shallow and clear,
I'll swim across with all my craft.
s2tt_r:
燕尔新婚，如兄如弟。
经以渭浊，食时其止。
燕尔新婚，不我泻矣。
无食我良，无发我羹。
我躬不阅，遑恤我后。
就其深矣，方之舟之。
就其浅矣，泳之游之。

译文：
A newlywed couple, like brother and sister,
With渭河的浊水，饭时才停止。
A newlywed couple, no longer sharing,
No food for me, no soup for me.
My body is not seen, how can I care for the future?
Near the deep, like a boat,
Near the shallow, swimming and playing.

asr: 何有何亡，黾勉求之。凡民有丧，匍匐救之。不我能慉，反以我为雠。既阻我德，贾用不售。昔育恐育鞫，及尔颠覆。既生既育，比予于毒。我有旨蓄，亦以御冬。
s2tt:
What's there and what's not there,
I strive to seek with care.
When others are in distress,
I crawl to help and bless.
You show me no good will,
But treat me with ill skill.
You spurn my virtue bright,
Like goods that sell not right.
In fear and want I grew,
Through ups and downs with you.
Now life and wealth we own,
You treat me as a thorn.
I have preserved food fine,
To pass the winter's time.
s2tt_r:
原文：
何有何无民免求之
凡民有丧
匍匐救之
不我能续
凡以我为仇
既足我德
古用不受
昔予恐欲居
及尔颠覆
既生既育
俾予余毒
我有旨蓄
亦以御冬

译文：
What is there, what is not, people seek to avoid,
When people mourn,
They crawl to save,
They cannot continue with me,
They regard me as their enemy,
Satisfied with my virtue,
Ancient times did not accept it,
I feared to live,
But now you are in ruin,
You have been born and nurtured,
Leaving me with the remainder of your curse,
I have provisions,
To ward off the winter.

asr: 宴尔新昏，以我御穷。有洸有溃，既诒我肄。不念昔者，伊余来塈。
s2tt:
In your new joy, you use me to ward off need,
With harshness and anger, you make my heart bleed.
You give me but toil, and forget days of old,
When you cherished me dearly, a tale to be told.
s2tt_r:
原文：
燕尔新婚，以我裕穷。
有光有愧，既予我意。
不念昔者，易于来兮。

译文：
Blessed with a new marriage, I am rich in joy.
With light and shame, I find my heart's desire.
No longer thinking of the past, I welcome the future with ease.

asr: 旄丘之葛兮，何诞之节兮。叔兮伯兮，何多日也？何其处也？必有与也！何其久也？必有以也！狐裘蒙戎，匪车不东。叔兮伯兮，靡所与同。琐兮尾兮，流离之子。
s2tt:
On the mound the vine grows long,
With its branches thick and strong.
O uncles dear, why so late
To come to our rescue state?
Why do you stay away so long?
You must have a reason strong.
Why do you stay away so late?
You must have something to wait.
In fox-furs you are clad,
But eastward you won't go.
O uncles dear, I am sad
To find you treat us so.
We are young and small,
Like homeless birds we call.
s2tt_r:
原文：
茅丘之阁兮，何淡之洁兮。
舒兮勃兮，何多日也。
何其处也，必有余也。
何其久也，必有一也。
胡求蒙容，匪车不东。
舒兮勃兮，靡所与同。
所兮微兮，琉璃之子。

译文：
A thatched cottage on a hill,
How pure and clean it stands.
Stretched and勃勃， how many days!
Where it is, there must be more.
How long it is, there must be one.
Why seek acceptance, when the carriage does not move east?
Stretched and勃勃, with nothing in common.
So small and微微, like a son of glass.

asr: 简兮简兮，方将万舞。日之方中，在前上处。硕人俣俣，公庭万舞。有力如虎，执辔如组。左手执龠，右手秉翟。赫如渥赭，公言锡爵。山有榛，隰有苓。云谁之思？
s2tt:
Oh, the drumbeats sound, oh, the drumbeats sound,
The grand dance begins on the sunlit ground.
At the front of the hall, in the noon's bright light,
The dancers appear, a majestic sight.
Tall and strong they stand, with a tiger's might,
Holding reins like silk, in the dance so bright.
Flutes in left hands, plumes in right they bear,
Faces flushed like wine, glowing in the air.
The lord, pleased and proud, grants them wine to share.
Hazels crown the hill, sweet grass fills the dale,
But for whom does my heart set its lonely sail?
s2tt_r:
原文：
卷西风将万物，日之方中在前上处。硕人于予，宫廷万物，有力如虎，执辔如组。左手指月，右手秉狄，赫如渥者。公言次爵，山有榛，隰有苓。云谁之思。

译文：
In the west, the wind rolls,  
All things are in its sway.  
The sun, at midday, shines bright,  
In the heavens, it does stay.  
A great man, in my sight,  
In the palace, he does reign.  
His strength, like a tiger's,  
His reins, like a rope, he does twain.  
Left hand, pointing to the moon,  
Right hand, holding the狄,  
Glowing, like a red sun.  
He speaks, the next to the throne,  
On the mountain, hazel grows,  
In the lowlands, lichen flows.  
Whose thoughts do these words show?

asr: 载脂载舝，还车言迈。遄臻于卫，不瑕有害？我思肥泉，兹之永叹。思须与漕，我心悠悠。驾言出游，以写我忧。
s2tt:
With grease applied, the carriage flies,
To homeward journey swift it hies.
To Wei I haste, no harm to fear,
Yet anxious thoughts my bosom sear.
I think of Feiquan's flowing tide,
And heave a long, long sigh inside.
For Xu and Cao my heart doth yearn,
With ceaseless longing it doth burn.
I drive abroad to ease my care,
And seek relief in open air.
s2tt_r:
原文：
载之载遐，玄车延迈。传真于渭，不遐有害。我思肥泉，滋之咏叹。思须与曹，我心悠悠。驾言出游，以泻我忧。

译文：
Carrying far and wide, the chariot moves slow.
Transmitting through the river, no harm will show.
I think of the fat spring, its waters flow.
With thoughts of the river, my heart grows slow.
I drive out to roam, to ease my sorrow.

asr: 出自北门，忧心殷殷。终窭且贫，莫知我艰。已焉哉！天实为之，谓之何哉！王事适我，政事一埤益我。我入自外，室人交徧谪我。已焉哉！天实为之，谓之何哉！
s2tt:
Out of the north gate I go,
With sorrow in my heart, oh!
Poor and in want am I,
None knows my misery, oh!
What can I do? oh!
Heaven has done this to me,
What can I say? oh!

Royal affairs press me sore,
State affairs burden me more.
When I come home from outside,
All my family chide.
What can I do? oh!
Heaven has done this to me,
What can I say? oh!
s2tt_r:
出自北门，忧心殷殷。
中居且贫，莫知我艰。
以燕哉，天实为之。
谓之何哉，王室治我。
政事亦疲亦我。
我入自外，士人交贬折我。
以燕哉，天实为之。
谓之何哉。

asr: 王事敦我，政事一埤遗我。我入自外，室人交徧摧我。已焉哉！天实为之，谓之何哉！
s2tt:
The king's affairs press me sore;
State duties pile up more and more.
When I come back from outside,
All my family chide.
Let it be!
What can I do when it's Heaven's decree?
s2tt_r:
原文：
王室敦我，郑师卫我。
我入自外，士人交贬。
催我以焉哉，天时为之。
未知何在。

译文：
The royal house supports me,
The army of Zheng protects me.
I enter from the outside,
Scholars and officials demean me.
Pressing me with what is it,
The timing of heaven determines it.
I wonder where it is.

asr: 北风其凉，雨雪其雱。惠而好我，携手同行。其虚其邪？既亟只且！北风其喈，雨雪其霏。惠而好我，携手同归。其虚其邪？既亟只且！莫赤匪狐，莫黑匪乌。
s2tt:
The north wind blows, so chill and drear;
The snow falls thick and fast.
If you are kind and hold me dear,
Let's hand in hand go past.
How can we be so slow?
The danger's pressing so!

The north wind blows, so shrill and drear;
The snow falls thick and light.
If you are kind and hold me dear,
Let's hand in hand take flight.
How can we be so slow?
The danger's pressing so!

What's red but foxes, say?
What's black but crows, I pray?
s2tt_r:
原文：
北风其凉，雨雪其雱。惠而好我，携手同行。其实在兮，维子之故。北风其喈，雨雪其霏。惠而好我，携手同归。其实在兮，维予之故。莫赤匪狐，莫黑匪乌。

译文：
The northern wind is cool, the snow falls thick.
You are kind and fond of me, let's walk together.
You are so real, it's all because of you.
The northern wind blows gently, snow falls softly.
You are kind and fond of me, let's return together.
You are so real, it's all because of you.
No fox is red, no crow is black.

asr: 惠而好我，携手同车。其虚其邪？既亟只且！
s2tt:
With love you treat me, hand in hand we ride.
Why hesitate? Why wait? Let's go side by side.
s2tt_r:
原文：
惠而好我，携手同车。既舒既徐，既疾止居。

译文：
With kindness and affection, we hold hands and share a carriage. Both relaxed and leisurely, we move swiftly and then pause.

asr: 新台有泚，河水弥弥。燕婉之求，蘧篨不鲜。新台有洒，河水浼浼。燕婉之求，蘧篨不殄。鱼网之设，鸿则离之。燕婉之求，得此戚施。
s2tt:
The new tower gleams so bright,
The river flows with might.
A gentle spouse she sought,
But a hunchback she got.

The new tower stands so high,
The river flows nearby.
A gentle spouse she prayed,
But a hunchback she made.

A net for fish was laid,
A toad in it was weighed.
A gentle spouse she'd woo,
But a hunchback came in view.
s2tt_r:
原文：
青苔有此，河水弥弥。
燕婉之求，渠除不显。
青苔有嘴，河水绵绵。
燕婉之求，古除不采田。
渔网之设，洪泽离之。
燕婉之求，得此其施。

译文：
Green moss with this, river water deep.
Wishful swan, canal hidden.
Green moss with mouth, river water long.
Wishful swan, ancient canal not farmed.
Fishing net set, flood泽 away.
Wishful swan, this施 received.

asr: 汎彼柏舟，亦汎其流。耿耿不寐，如有隐忧。微我无酒，以敖以游。我心匪鉴，不可以茹。亦有兄弟，不可以据。薄言往愬，逢彼之怒。我心匪石，不可转也。
s2tt:
A cypress boat floats free,
Adrift upon the stream.
Sleepless, with care I'm fraught,
As if in troubled dream.
Not that I lack for wine,
Or wander without aim.
My heart is not a mirror,
To hold all without blame.
Though I have brothers dear,
On them I can't rely.
When I go to complain,
I meet with angry eye.
My heart is not a stone,
That can be turned at will.
s2tt_r: 泛彼柏舟，亦泛其流。耿耿不寐，如有隐忧。维我无酒，以敖以游。我心匪鉴，不可以茹。兄弟不可以据，国人之怒，不可言也。

asr: 我心匪席，不可卷也。威仪棣棣，不可选也。忧心悄悄，愠于群小。觏闵既多，受侮不少。静言思之，寤辟有摽。日居月诸，胡迭而微？心之忧矣，如匪澣衣。
s2tt: My heart is not a mat, you cannot roll it away. My dignity is so great, you cannot do it away. With grief in my heart, I'm hated by mean men. I have suffered so much, insulted again and again. In the quiet night I think of it, awake I beat my breast. O sun, O moon, why should you be eclipsed? With grief in my heart, like an unwashed dress.
s2tt_r:
我心匪席，不可卷也。威仪棣棣，不可选也。忧心悄悄，愠于群小。觏闵既多，受侮不少。静言思之，寤辟有摽。日居月诸，胡迭而微？心之忧矣，如匪衣襵。

译文：
My heart is not like a mat, unrollable.
My demeanor is harmonious, unselectable.
My worries are quiet, provoked by small people.
I have faced many hardships, endured much abuse.
In silence, I ponder, my heart beats with distress.
Days and months, how they fade away?
My heart's sorrow, like unbuttoned clothes.

asr: 燕燕于飞，差池其羽。之子于归，远送于野。瞻望弗及，泣涕如雨。燕燕于飞，颉之颃之。之子于归，远于将之。瞻望弗及，伫立以泣。燕燕于飞，下上其音。
s2tt:
Swallows in flight,
Their wings in varied height.
My sister goes to wed,
I see her off o'er the wild.
When she's lost to my sight,
My tears run like a child.
Swallows in flight,
Now up, now down in light.
My sister goes to wed,
I see her off far away.
When she's lost to my sight,
I stand and weep all day.
Swallows in flight,
Their songs now low, now bright.
s2tt_r:
原文：
燕燕于飞，差池其羽。
之子于归，远送于野。
瞻望弗及，泣涕如雨。
燕燕于飞，颉之颃之。
之子于归，远于将之。
瞻望弗及，伫立以泣。
燕燕于飞，下上其音。

译文：
Swallows fly in pairs, their wings apart,
As the bridegroom departs, far into the night.
I watch but cannot see, tears fall like rain.
Swallows fly in pairs, their wings apart,
As the bridegroom departs, far into the night.
I watch but cannot see, tears fall like rain.
Swallows fly in pairs, their wings apart,
As the bridegroom departs, far into the night.
I watch but cannot see, tears fall like rain.

asr: 之子于归，远送于南。瞻望弗及，实劳我心。仲氏任只，其心塞渊。终温且惠，淑慎其身。先君之思，以勖寡人。
s2tt:
The bride now homeward goes;
Far south my escort flows.
I gaze till she's no more in view;
My heart is laden with deep rue.
My second sister, dear,
With heart sincere,
So gentle, virtuous and good,
She's e'er in pensive mood.
"Remember our deceased sire,"
She says, "to do what you desire."
s2tt_r:
原文：
之子于归，远送于南。瞻望弗及，实劳我心。仲氏任只，其心塞渊。钟鼓既设，疏食果臝。先君之思，以勖寡人。

译文：
The son is returning, far sent to the south. Looking but not reaching, truly weary my heart. The second sister, only, her heart deep and profound. The bells and drums are set, sparse food and fruit. The thoughts of the former king, to encourage the widow.

asr: 日居月诸，照临下土。乃如之人兮，逝不古处？胡能有定？宁不我顾。日居月诸，下土是冒。乃如之人兮，逝不相好。胡能有定？宁不我报。日居月诸，出自东方。
s2tt:
O sun, O moon, that shine on earth below,
Why is my lord not as he was of old?
How can his heart find rest? He does not know
To care for me as in the days foretold.

O sun, O moon, that cover earth with light,
Why is my lord not friendly as before?
How can his heart find rest? He does not right
To pay me back what I have given o'er.

O sun, O moon, that rise from east afar,
s2tt_r:
原文：
日居月诸，照临下土。乃如之人兮，室不古处，胡能有定？命不我顾。日居月诸，下土是冒。乃如之人兮，室不相好，胡能有定？命不我报。日居月诸，出自东方。

译文：
The sun and moon shine bright,
Bathing the earth in their light.
Yet, O my beloved,
Your dwelling is not old,
How can you find peace?
Fate does not look back.
The sun and moon shine bright,
Covering the earth with their light.
Yet, O my beloved,
Your dwelling is not good,
How can you find peace?
Fate does not respond to you.
The sun and moon shine bright,
Emerging from the east.

asr: 乃如之人兮，德音无良。胡能有定？俾也可忘。日居月诸，东方自出。父兮母兮，畜我不卒。胡能有定？报我不述。
s2tt:
Such a man as you, I find,
Has no good virtue in mind.
How can he be steadfast and true?
He makes me forget what I knew.
The sun and moon, in their course,
Rise in the east as their source.
O father, mother, dear,
Why did you not keep me here?
How can he be steadfast and true?
He does not tell me what is due.
s2tt_r:
乃如之人兮，德音无量。胡能有定，彼也渴望。日居月诸，东方自出。父兮母兮，蓄我不足。胡能有定，报我不数。

译文：
Like such a person, virtue is boundless.
How can there be a limit, they yearn.
The sun and moon, from the east they rise.
Father and mother, my needs they supply.
How can there be a limit, their care is endless.

asr: 终风且暴，顾我则笑。谑浪笑敖，中心是悼。终风且霾，惠然肯来。莫往莫来，悠悠我思。终风且曀，不日有曀。寤言不寐，愿言则嚏。曀曀其阴，虺虺其雷。
s2tt:
The wind blows wild and strong,
You look at me and laugh along.
With mocking words and scornful air,
My heart is filled with deep despair.

The wind blows thick with haze,
You come to me in gentle ways.
When you no longer come or go,
My longing thoughts forever flow.

The wind blows dark and drear,
No sun appears from day to day.
Awake, I lie with sleepless fear,
Wishing a sneeze might bring you near.

The sky is dark and low,
The thunder rumbles long and slow.
s2tt_r:
中风且暴，故我则效，血浪向澳，中心是道，中风且埋，惠然肯来，莫往莫来，悠悠我思，中风且逸，不日有益，勿言不昧，怨言则涕，亦亦其音，回回其雷。

译文：
In the midst of the storm, fierce and wild,
I follow its path, as blood flows, wild and wild.
The waves rush to the shore, a path within,
In the heart of the storm, the way is seen.
In the midst of the storm, buried deep,
With grace, you come, not to the north, not to the south.
My thoughts, wandering, deep and deep,
In the midst of the storm, the spirit flies,
Not a day without benefit, not a day without light,
Words of complaint, tears will fall, clear and clear,
The sound of the storm, the thunder's roar.

asr: 雄雉于飞，泄泄其羽。我之怀矣，自诒伊阻。雄雉于飞，下上其音。展矣君子，实劳我心。瞻彼日月，悠悠我思。道之云远，曷云能来？百尔君子，不知德行。
s2tt:
The pheasant flies,
With wings that spread the skies.
My heart's in pain,
For love's long chain.

The pheasant flies,
With songs that rise and rise.
O my dear lord,
My heart is deeply gored.

I watch the sun and moon,
And think of you soon.
The road is long and far,
When comes my morning star?

All men of high degree,
Know not morality.
s2tt_r:
原文：
雄雉于飞，熠熠其羽。我之怀矣，自诒伊阻。雄雉于飞，下上其音。展矣君子，实劳我心。瞻彼日月，悠悠我思。道之云远，曷云能来？百尔君子，不知德行。

译文：
A phoenix bird soars high,
Its feathers gleaming bright.
My heart yearns for thee,
Self-inflicted hardship.

A phoenix bird soars high,
Its voice echoing clear.
Oh, noble man, so kind,
My heart is filled with pain.

I gaze at sun and moon,
My thoughts drift far and wide.
The path is long and distant,
How can I find my way?

Oh, noble men, so wise,
You know not virtue's grace.

asr: 君即颍水荀，何惭许郡宾。相逢太史奏，应是聚宝人。玉隐且在石，兰枯还见春。俄成万里别，立德贵清真。
s2tt:
You are Xun of Ying Stream, why feel ashamed of Xu County's guest?  
When we meet, the Grand Scribe would report, that we are men of treasure blessed.  
Jade hides yet within the stone, orchids wither but see spring anew.  
Soon we part for miles unknown, virtue's worth lies in being true.
s2tt_r:
君疾饮饮水寻，何惭许俊宾。相逢太史奏，应是聚宝人。欲饮且在时，兰枯还见春。蛾成万里别，立得贵清真。

译文：
Seeking water to drink, you are not ashamed, like Xu Jun's guest. Meeting the historian, you should be a treasure collector. Wanting to drink, you are still in time, as orchids wither, yet spring returns. Moths fly a thousand miles apart, yet you stand firm,贵清真.

asr: 余小时，大人令诵《子虚赋》，私心慕之。及长，南游云梦，览七泽之壮观。酒隐安陆，蹉跎十年。初，嘉兴季父谪长沙西还，时途拜见，预饮林下。专乃稚子，嬉游在傍。
s2tt:
When I was young, I was told to recite "The Rhapsody of Zixu,"  
And in my heart, I secretly admired its grace.  
As I grew, I traveled south to Yunmeng's dream,  
Beholding the grandeur of seven lakes' gleam.  
In Anlu, I drowned my cares in wine,  
Ten years slipped by, a fleeting sign.  
At first, my uncle, exiled to Changsha, returned west,  
I met him on the road, by woods we were blessed.  
We drank beneath the trees, a moment's rest,  
While children played nearby, in innocence dressed.
s2tt_r:
余小时，大人令诵子虚赋，思心慕之，及长，南游云梦，览七泽之壮观，久隐安陆，蹉跎十年初。嘉兴既复，谪长沙西还，时途拜见，欲饮林下，乃专致子，西游在旁。

译文：
When I was young, my parents taught me to recite the赋of Zixu, and I longed for it. As I grew older, I traveled south to Yunmeng, marveling at the grandeur of the Seven Lakes. I spent ten years in Hanzhong, hiding in Anlu, and wasted my time. After Jiaxing was restored, I was exiled to Changsha, returning west. I visited various places along the way, wanting to drink in the countryside, but I was always accompanied by my son, who was always by my side.

asr: 今来有成，郁负秀气。吾衰久矣！见尔慰心，申悲导旧，破涕为笑。方告我远涉，西登香炉。长山横蹙，九江却转。瀑布天落，半与银河争流腾虹奔电，潨射万壑，此宇宙之奇诡也。
s2tt: Now you have achieved success, and you are full of talent. I have been declining for a long time! Seeing you comforts my heart, as you express sorrow and recall old times, turning tears into smiles. You tell me of your long journey westward to the Incense Burner Peak. The long mountains stretch and twist, and the nine rivers turn back. The waterfall falls from the sky, competing with the Milky Way for its flow, like a rainbow soaring and lightning racing, shooting into myriad valleys. This is the wondrous spectacle of the universe.
s2tt_r:
原文：
今来有成，欲赴秀气，吾衰久矣。渐耳未新，声悲捣臼，破涕为笑，方告我远涉。熄灯香炉，长山横蹙，九江却转。瀑布天落，半与银河争流。腾虹奔电，葱射万壑。此宇宙之奇诡也。

译文：
Now come to fulfillment, eager to embrace the spirit, I have long been衰弱。Gradually, my ears are not new, the sound is sad, pounding the mortar, turning tears into laughter, just telling me of distant travels. Extinguish the lamp, the incense burner, the long mountains are crumpled, the nine rivers turn back. Waterfalls fall from the sky, half competing with the Milky Way. Rising dragons, galloping electric, green shooting through ten thousand valleys. This is the wonder of the universe.

asr: 其上有方湖石井，不可得而窥焉。羡君此行，抚鹤长啸。恨丹液未就，白龙来迟，使秦人著鞭，先往桃花之水。孤负夙愿，惭归名山，终期后来，携手五岳。情以送远，诗宁阙乎？
s2tt:
Above, square lake and stony well,
Beyond our mortal sight to dwell.
I envy you this journey's flight,
To stroke the crane and sing outright.
Regret elixir's brew delayed,
White dragon's coming slow displayed,
That Qin men took the whip and sped
To peach-blossom waters ahead.
My lifelong wish left unfulfilled,
Ashamed to famed hills I rebuild,
Yet hope we meet in days to be,
Hand in hand through peaks all five.
With heartfelt thoughts to speed your way,
Could verse be absent? Nay, I say.
s2tt_r:
原文：
其上有方壶石井，不可得其归焉。献君此行，抚鹤长啸，恨丹液未就，白龙来迟，使秦人斫鞭，先往桃花之水，孤负夙愿，惭归名山，终期后来，携手五岳，情以送远，师宁缺乎？

译文：
There is a square stone well on it, but it cannot be returned. I present this journey to you, stroking the crane and long啸ing, regretting that the elixir has not been completed, and the white dragon has arrived late, causing the Qin people to chop the whip. I will go to the water of the peach blossom first, failing to fulfill my old wish, ashamed to return to the famous mountain, finally looking forward to the future, holding hands with the five mountains, sending off with emotion, will the teacher be absent?

asr: 本作一行书，殷勤道相忆。一行复一行，满纸情何极。瑶台有黄鹤，为报青楼人。朱颜凋落尽，白发一何新。自知未应还，离居经三春。桃李今若为，当窗发光彩。
s2tt:
A letter I write, line by line,
To tell how I long for thee.
Line after line, the sheet's o'erflowed
With love that will ever be.
The yellow crane on the tower high
Would send word to the green bower nigh.
Rosy faces fade away;
White hair new comes day by day.
I know I cannot come back again;
Three springs have passed since we parted then.
How are peach and plum blossoms now?
They must be blooming on the bough.
s2tt_r:
本作一行书，殷勤道相忆。
一行复一行，满纸情何极。
瑶台有黄鹤，未报青楼人。
朱颜凋落尽，白发亦何心。
自知未应还，离居经三春。
桃李今若为，当窗发光采。

译文：
A line of words in this work,
With deep affection, I recall.
Line after line, the paper fills,
The depth of emotion, how vast.
On the jade platform, a yellow crane,
Has not yet reported to the blue building.
The red face fades away,
And the white hair, what heart?
Knowing I should not return,
I have been separated for three springs.
If the peach and plum were here now,
They would shine brightly at the window.

asr: 万国同风共一时，锦江何谢曲江池。石镜更明天上月，后宫亲得照蛾眉。
s2tt:
All lands in shared breeze stand,
As brocade streams match royal strand.
The moon on stone mirror bright,
Lights palace brows in clear night.
s2tt_r:
原文：
万国同风共一时，
锦江和泻曲江池。
时近更明天上月，
后宫亲得照蛾眉。

译文：
Across the world, the same wind blows,
In the rivers, the same water flows.
As the time nears, the moon shines bright,
In the harem, the beauty is light.

asr: 锦水东流绕锦城，星桥北挂象天星。四海此中朝圣主，峨眉山下列仙庭。
s2tt_r:
原文：
锦水东流绕锦城，
星桥北挂向天星。
四海此中朝圣主，
峨眉山下列仙庭。

译文：
The Jin River flows eastward around the city of Jin,
The star bridge hangs northward toward the celestial stars.
Here in the four seas, the holy ruler is worshipped,
Under the峨眉 mountain, the celestial court is lined.

asr: 水绿天青不起尘，风光和暖胜三秦。万国烟花随玉辇，西来添作锦江春。
s2tt:
Green water, blue sky, no dust in sight,
Warm, gentle breeze outshines spring in Qin bright.
Fireworks from all lands follow the royal way,
Adding to spring in Jinjiang from the west they sway.
s2tt_r:
原文：
水绿天青不起尘，风光和暖胜三秦。
万国烟花随玉辇，西来天作锦江春。

译文：
Green waters and blue skies, no dust to stir,
A warm and beautiful sight, surpassing the Three Qin.
The fragrance of flowers from all nations follows the imperial carriage,
As spring comes to the Jinjiang from the west.

asr: 剑阁重关蜀北门，上皇归马若云屯。少帝长安开紫极，双悬日月照乾坤。
s2tt_r:
原文：
剑阁重关蜀北门，
上皇归马若云屯。
少帝长安开紫极，
双悬日月照乾坤。

译文：
The sword gate, a heavy barrier,
Sits at the northern gate of Shu.
The emperor returns, horses gather like clouds.
The young emperor opens the purple gate in Chang'an,
Two celestial bodies hang, illuminating the universe.

asr: 旧简拂尘看，鸣琴候月弹。桃源迷汉姓，松树有秦官。空谷归人少，青山背日寒。羡君栖隐处，遥望白云端。
s2tt_r:
原文：
旧简拂尘看，明琴候月弹。
桃源迷汉姓，松树有琴观。
空谷归人少，青山悲日寒。
献君七隐处，遥望白云端。

译文：
Old scrolls dusted to read, bright zither waits for moonlight to play.
In the lost桃源, Han surnames are hidden, pine trees hold the zither's view.
Few returnees in the empty valley, mountains mourn the cold of the setting sun.
Presenting you seven hidden retreats, gazing at the distant white clouds.

asr: 贫居依谷口，乔木带荒村。石路枉回驾，山家谁候门。渔舟胶冻浦，猎火烧寒原。唯有白云外，疏钟闻夜猿。
s2tt:
My hut stands by the valley's mouth,
With tall trees round the lonely village south.
On stony path I turn my cab aside;
Who waits for me at door with lamp a-glow?
The fishing boat's on frozen river tied;
The hunting fire burns on the plain with snow.
Beyond the white cloud I hear from the bell
The midnight ape's melancholy farewell.
s2tt_r:
原文：
平居依谷口，悄兀待荒村。
石路往回架，山家谁后门。
渔舟交洞浦，烈火烧寒原。
唯有白云外，书中闻夜猿。

译文：
In the valley's mouth, I dwell,
Quietly awaiting the village's call.
Stone paths lead back, a bridge spans,
Whose home is this, whose door stands?
Fishing boats meet at the river's bend,
A fire burns on the cold plain.
Only in the clouds, I hear the night's cry,
A book's tale of the howling apes.

asr: 岩壑转微径，云林隐法堂。羽人飞奏乐，天女跪焚香。竹外峰偏曙，藤阴水更凉。欲知禅坐久，行路长春芳。
s2tt_r:
原文：
严鹤转微径，云林隐法堂。
羽人飞奏乐，天女跪焚香。
竹外风偏暑，藤阴水更凉。
预知禅坐久，行路长春芳。

译文：
On the path of slight turns, cranes fly,
In the forest of clouds, the temple lies.
Birds in flight, music plays in the air,
Goddesses kneel, incense burns in prayer.
The wind outside the bamboo is hot,
The shade of vines and water is cool and soft.
Long spring blossoms, I know, will grow,
As I sit in meditation, deep and slow.

asr: 高楼望所思，目极情未毕。枕上见千里，窗中窥万室。悠悠长路人，暧暧远郊日。惆怅极浦外，迢递孤烟出。能赋属上才，思归同下秩。故乡不可见，云水空如一。
s2tt:
From high tower I gaze on my thought,  
My sight is lost, but my heart is not.  
On pillow I see miles and miles away,  
Through window I watch houses in array.  
Long, long the road that travelers go,  
Dim, dim the sun on distant fields aglow.  
My heart is grieved where far-off waters gleam,  
A lonely smoke rises in a lingering stream.  
A gifted poet I can hardly claim,  
Yet homesickness is mine, all the same.  
My homeland is beyond my yearning eye,  
Only clouds and waters meet the sky.
s2tt_r:
原文：
高楼望所思，目极情未毕。
枕上见千里，窗中窥万室。
悠悠长路人，蔼蔼远郊日。
惆怅吉甫外，迢递孤烟出。
能复属上才，思归同下志。
故乡不可见，云水空如一。

译文：
On high tower I gaze afar,
My eyes' reach, my heart's desire.
From pillow I see a thousand miles,
From window, a thousand rooms.
Long road winds, people distant,
Sunset in the far countryside.
Chagrined, I miss my friend,吉甫,
In the distance, smoke rises.
Can I again belong to the talented?
I long to return, with the same resolve.
My homeland is unseen, like clouds and water,
Empty, like a single garment.

asr: 金杯缓酌清歌转，画舸轻移艳舞回。自叹鶺鴒临水别，不同鸿雁向池来。
s2tt:
Golden cups, slow sips, with clear songs in flight;
Painted boats, light shifts, as fair dances take flight.
I sigh, as wagtail by the water must part,
Unlike wild geese that toward the pond take heart.
s2tt_r:
原文：
金杯缓酌清歌转，
画戈轻移艳舞回。
自叹鹡鸰临水别，
不同鸿雁向迟来。

译文：
Slowly pouring wine in golden cups,
Clear songs softly turn.
Lightly moving painted戈,
A graceful dance returns.
Sighing at parting by the water,
Like a heron, I cannot stay,
Unlike geese, who come late.

asr: 高处敞招提，虚空讵有倪。坐看南陌骑，下听秦城鸡。眇眇孤烟起，芊芊远树齐。青山万井外，落日五陵西。眼界今无染，心空安可迷。
s2tt:
High the temple stands, open and wide,
In the void, where can bounds abide?
I watch riders on southern way,
Hear cocks crowing in town of Qin far away.
From afar lonely smoke rises in the air,
And lush trees stand line by line over there.
Green hills out of myriad wells extend,
In the west the sun sinks where five mausoleums end.
Now my eyes are from worldly dust free,
How can my carefree heart bewildered be?
s2tt_r:
高处敞招提，虚空聚有尼。
坐看南陌骑，下听秦城鸡。
渺渺孤烟起，芊芊远树齐。
青山万井外，落日五陵西。
眼界今无染，心空安可迷。

译文：
At the high place, the temple opens wide,
In the void, nuns gather in a crowd.
Sitting and watching the riders on the southern road,
Listening to the rooster crowing in the Qin city below.
Distant smoke rises faintly,
Trees stretch out in a line.
Mountains and ten thousand wells beyond,
The setting sun over the five imperial tombs.
Now my eyes are free from pollution,
My heart is empty, how can I be lost?

asr: 商山包楚邓，积翠蔼沉沉。驿路飞泉洒，关门落照深。野花开古戍，行客响空林。板屋春多雨，山城昼欲阴。丹泉通虢略，白羽抵荆岑。若见西山爽，应知黄绮心。
s2tt:
Mount Shang embraces Chu and Deng,
In emerald green, a misty scene.
The post road's sprinkled by flying spring,
The pass gate's steeped in sunset's gleam.
Wild flowers bloom by the ancient fort,
Wayfarers' echoes through woods are caught.
Wooden huts see spring rains oft,
The mountain town's in shade aloft.
The Red Spring leads to Guo's way,
White Feather Peak stands proud and gay.
If you see the west hill's grace,
You'll know the hermits' mind and face.
s2tt_r:
原文：
商山包楚洞，积翠霭沉沉。
驿路飞泉洒，关门落照深。
野花开古树，行客响空林。
板屋春多雨，山城昼欲阴。
丹泉通国略，白羽抵京尘。
若见西山爽，应知黄绮心。

译文：
Mountains embrace the Chu cave, 
Greenery thick and deep.
Fountain water splashes on the road, 
Sunset deepens the gate.
Wildflowers bloom on ancient trees, 
Travelers echo in the empty forest.
Spring rains often fall on wooden houses, 
The city's day seems to turn to dusk.
Red springs connect to national strategies, 
White feathers carry dust to the capital.
If you see the coolness of the Western Mountain, 
You should know the heart of Huang Qi.

asr: 不识阳关路，新从定远侯。黄云断春色，画角起边愁。瀚海经年到，交河出塞流。须令外国使，知饮月氏头。
s2tt:
The Road to Yang Pass I've never trod,  
I follow General Ding afar.  
Yellow clouds veil spring's tender nod,  
War horns stir grief where frontiers are.  
Through desert sands for years I've passed,  
To Jiaohe River flowing fast.  
Let envoys from the foreign land  
Know we drink from the Yuezhi's hand.
s2tt_r:
原文：
不识阳关路，心从定远侯。
黄云断春色，画角起边愁。
瀚海经年到，交河出塞流。
须令外国使，知饮月支酒。

译文：
Unknown is the path to Yangguan,
My heart follows the spirit of Ding Yuan.
Yellow clouds block the spring's hue,
The bugle sounds, stirring border sorrow.
Across the desert for years,
Jiaohe flows out of the pass.
Let foreign envoys know,
To drink the wine of the Moon Branch.

asr: 草色日向好，桃源人去稀。手持平子赋，目送老莱衣。每候山樱发，时同海燕归。今年寒食酒，应是返柴扉。
s2tt:
Green grass grows fairer day by day;
Few friends come to my hermit's way.
I read my verse with book in hand,
And watch old friends leave for their land.
When mountain cherries bloom in view,
With swallows from the sea I'll go.
On Cold Food Day I drink wine new;
I should come back to my hut low.
s2tt_r:
原文：
草色日向好，桃园人去稀。
手持平子赋，目送老莱衣。
每候山阴发，时同海燕归。
今年寒食酒，应是返柴扉。

译文：
Grass turns green as the sun sets,
C桃园's people grow scarce.
Holding the赋of Pingzi,
I watch the old man's clothes.
Every time the mountain wind blows,
I return with the sea swallow.
This year's寒食wine,
Should return to the wooden door.

asr: 一公栖太白，高顶出风烟。梵流诸壑遍，花雨一峰偏。迹为无心隐，名因立教传。鸟来远语法，客去更安禅。昼涉松路尽，暮投兰若边。洞房隐深竹，清夜闻遥泉。
s2tt:
A monk on Taibai dwells,
Above the wind and misty swells.
Through valleys chants of sutras flow,
On one peak falls the blossom snow.
He hides, not seeking fame's acclaim,
Yet spreads his teachings, gains his name.
Birds come to hear the distant lore,
Guests leave, he meditates the more.
By day he treads the pine-clad trail,
At dusk he rests by temple pale.
His cell in deep bamboo is set,
At night, far springs he hears, and yet.
s2tt_r:
原文：
一宫七太白，高顶出风烟。
泛流朱鹤变，花雨亦风偏。
既为无心饮，名因利教传。
鸟来猿语法，客去更安禅。
昼射松露尽，暮投兰惹边。
洞房引深竹，清夜闻瑶泉。

译文：
Seven white peaks in one palace,
Their tops rise high, smoke and wind.
Red cranes float, flowers rain,
The wind blows, nature's dance.

Drinking without heart, fame spreads,
Teaching for profit, name spreads.
Birds come, apes speak,
Guests leave, peace spreads.

Daylight fades, morning dew gone,
Evening falls, orchids by the shore.
Deep bamboo leads to the chamber,
Clear night, jade spring's song.

asr: 向是云霞里，今成枕席前。岂唯暂留宿，服事将穷年。
s2tt:
Once in rosy clouds you lay,
Now beside my pillow stay.
Not for just a night you'll keep,
But in service years as deep.
s2tt_r:
原文：
相思云霞里，君乘枕席前。
岂为暂留宿，不是将穷年。

译文：
In the clouds of longing, you sit,
On my pillow, my heart's delight.
Not for a fleeting night, but long,
Your presence fills my endless night.

asr: 翡翠香烟合，琉璃宝地平。龙宫连栋宇，虎穴傍檐楹。谷静唯松响，山深无鸟声。琼峰当户拆，金涧透林明。郢路云端迥，秦川雨外晴。雁王衔果献，鹿女踏花行。
s2tt_r:
原文：
翡翠香烟合，琉璃宝地平。
龙宫连洞雨，虎穴傍岩萤。
古径围松响，山深无鸟声。
穷峰当户拆，金剑透林明。
引路云端迥，晴川雨外晴。
雁王衔果献，鹿女踏花行。

译文：
Emerald smoke closes,
Glassy ground lies flat.
Dragon palace connects,
Cave nears with fireflies.
Ancient path echoes,
Deep mountains without birdsong.
Endless peaks split,
Golden sword shines through the forest.
Guiding path stretches high,
Clear river under rain.
King of geese carries fruit,
Deer maiden treads floral path.

asr: 朱绂谁家子，无乃金张孙。骊驹从白马，出入铜龙门。问尔何功德，多承明主恩。斗鸡平乐馆，射雉上林园。曲陌车骑盛，高堂珠翠繁。奈何轩冕贵，不与布衣言。
s2tt:
Whose son in crimson robe so fine?
A scion of the noble line.
On white steed he rides with his black,
Through palace gate and out and back.
What merits has he to his name?
He owes his fortune to his fame.
He fights his cocks in pleasure ground;
He shoots his pheasants in park's bound.
His chariots crowd the winding way;
His hall's with pearls and gems inlay.
Why should the noble and the great
Not with the common people mate?
s2tt_r:
原文：
朱门酒肉臭，
路有冻死骨。
《短歌行》
对酒当歌，人生几何！
譬如朝露，去日苦多。
慨当以慷，忧思难忘。
何以解忧？唯有杜康。
青青子衿，悠悠我心。
但为君故，沉吟至今。
呦呦鹿鸣，食野之苹。
我有嘉宾，鼓瑟吹笙。
明明如月，何时可掇？
忧从中来，不可断绝。
越陌度阡，枉用相存。
契阔谈讌，心念旧恩。
月明星稀，乌鹊南飞。
绕树三匝，何枝可依？
山不厌高，海不厌深。
周公吐哺，天下归心。

译文：
In the halls of the rich, wine and meat stink,
On the streets, the frozen lie in death's clasp.
"Short Song" - To drink and sing, life is fleeting!
Like morning dew, days slip away, so many gone.
With passion and sorrow, thoughts linger on.
How to ease the pain? Only wine can help.
Green is the collar, deep is my heart's yearn.
For your sake, I ponder still, till now.
The deer calls, eating wild grass.
I have guests, I play the lute and sing.
The moon shines bright, when can I pick it?
Worry grows, never to end.
Crossing fields, I come to see you.
Longing to talk, my heart's old bond.
The moon is clear, crows fly south.
绕 the tree three times, which branch to take?
The mountains do not厌 be high, the seas do not厌 be deep.
As Zhou Gong spits out his food, the world returns to him.

asr: 越妇拜县官，桑牙今尚小。会待春日晏，丝车方掷掉。越妇通言语，小姑具黄粱。县官踏飧去，簿吏复登堂。
s2tt:
The Yue wife bows to the county head,
"Mulberry buds are still small," she said.
"Wait till the late spring day,
Silk wheels will whirl away."
The wife speaks with the county head,
Her sister-in-law cooks millet bread.
The county head leaves after the meal,
The clerk comes to make another deal.
s2tt_r:
岳父拜县官，桑芽今尚小。
会待春日宴，丝车方织雕。
岳父通言语，小姑具黄粱。
县官踏春去，不吏妇登堂。

译文：
The father-in-law bows to the county official,
Saplings are still small today.
待到春日宴席，丝车方织锦绣。
岳父通晓言语，小姑准备黄粱。
县官踏春而去，不吏妇登堂。

asr: 竹里缲丝挑网车，青蝉独噪日光斜。桃胶迎夏香琥珀，自课越佣能种瓜。
s2tt_r:
竹里骚思调网车，轻颤独造日光斜。
桃胶盈夏香琥珀，自客月拥能种瓜。

译文：
In the bamboo grove, a delicate tune,
From the fishing cart, a gentle sound.
The sun slants, casting a soft light,
Amidst the summer, the fragrance of peach gum.

The amber scent fills the air,
As guests gather, under the moon's embrace,
They can plant melons, in this serene place.

asr: 三十未有二十余，白日长饥小甲蔬。桥头长老相哀念，因遗戎韬一卷书。
s2tt:
Thirty years not yet, twenty more,
By day long hunger, scant herb store.
The elder on the bridge, with pity's grace,
Gave me a scroll on war's art to pore.
s2tt_r:
原文：
三十未有二十余，
白日长鸡小甲疏。
桥头长老相哀思，
因为龙涛一卷书。

译文：
Thirty years old but still in my twenties,
The sun shines long, the rooster crows, the armor is sparse.
Elders at the bridgehead mourn and think,
For a scroll of dragon waves.

asr: 春水初生乳燕飞，黄蜂小尾扑花归。窗含远色通书幌，鱼拥香钩近石矶。
s2tt_r:
原文：
春水初生，如燕飞。
黄蜂小尾扑花归。
窗含远色通书幌，
鱼拥香钩近石矶。

译文：
Spring water first flows, like swallows fly.
Yellow bees with small tails return to flowers.
Windows frame distant colors through book curtains,
Fish gather near the stone reef with fragrant hooks.

asr: 边让今朝忆蔡邕，无心裁曲卧春风。舍南有竹堪书字，老去溪头作钓翁。
s2tt:
Bian Rang today recalls Cai Yong,
Who cares for songs in spring breeze long?
South of my hut, bamboos stand tall,
By the stream I fish, old and all.
s2tt_r:
边让今朝异，蔡邕无心采。
卧春风，射南有竹看书字。
老去溪头坐钓翁。

译文：
Today, Bian Let is different,
Cai Yong has no heart to pick.
Lying in the spring breeze, shooting southward bamboo,
Reading words in the stream, old, sitting as a fishing man.

asr: 宝婺摇珠佩，常娥照玉轮。灵归天上匹，巧遗世间人。花果香千户，笙竽滥四邻。明朝晒犊鼻，方信阮家贫。
s2tt:
The Star of Weaving Maid her gem-like pendant shakes,  
The Moon Goddess her jade-like chariot takes.  
The Celestial matchmaker comes from the sky,  
Leaving her needlework to earthly maidens nigh.  
Sweet flowers and fruits perfume thousands of doors,  
Flutes and pipes resound to neighbors of all outdoors.  
Tomorrow I'll hang my breeches out to dry,  
Then you'll believe the Ruan's family in poverty lie.
s2tt_r:
宝物瑶珠佩，嫦娥照玉轮。
灵龟天上匹，巧为世间人。
花果香千户，生于烂死林。
明朝晒犊鼻，方信阮家贫。

译文：
Jewels of jade adorn the treasure,
Chang'e shines on the jade wheel.
A celestial tortoise, a heavenly steed,
Crafted for the earthly realm.
A thousand households with fragrant flowers and fruits,
Born in a forest of decay.
Tomorrow, drying the apron,
Confirms the poverty of the Ruan family.

asr: 多病欣依有道邦，南塘宴起想秋江。卷帘飞燕还拂水，开户暗虫犹打窗。更阅前题已披卷，仍斟昨夜未开缸。谁人为报故交道，莫惜鲤鱼时一双。
s2tt:
In ailing days, I'm glad to stay in a land of order;
From Southern Pool I rise, dreaming of autumn river.
Uprolled screen, the flying swallows skim the water;
Door open, darkling insects still tap on the window.
I read again the poems on the scroll unrolled,
And drink the wine left over from last night's jar.
Who will send word to my old friends for me?
Do not grudge a pair of carps now and then!
s2tt_r:
原文：
多病心忧道帮南唐燕起翔秋江，转帘飞燕还扶水，开户暗虫犹打窗，更月前啼已疲倦，人争坐夜未开缸，谁人未报故交道，莫惜鲤鱼时一双。

译文：
Worried by illness, my heart seeks solace in the Dao,
As the swallows of the Southern Tang rise and fly across the autumn river.
The swallows turn the curtains, still clinging to the water,
As the dark insects open the door, still striking the window.
The moon's cry before dawn is already weary,
People argue at night, yet the jar remains unopened.
Who has not reported to old friends,
Do not hesitate to send a pair of carp at a time.

asr: 多少分曹掌秘文，洛阳花雪梦随君。定知何逊缘联句，每到城东忆范云。
s2tt:
How many secret clerks in the court's employ?
Luoyang's blossoms and snow in dreams with you I enjoy.
I know why He Xun wrote verses in reply;
At the east town I think of Fan Yun with a sigh.
s2tt_r:
原文：
多少分曹掌秘文，洛阳花雪梦随君。
定知何逊元连句，每到东城一泛云。

译文：
How many times have I shared the secret texts,  
In the snow of Luoyang, my dreams follow you.  
I know that every verse by He Xun and Yuan Lian,  
When I reach the eastern city, I float like a cloud.

asr: 霞绡云幄任铺陈，隔巷蟆更听未真。枕上轻寒窗外雨，眼前春色梦中人。盈盈烛泪因谁泣，点点花愁为我嗔。自是小鬟娇懒惯，拥衾不耐笑言频。
s2tt:
Silken drapes and rosy clouds in disarray,  
From the lane the watchman's drum sounds far away.  
On the pillow chill, outside the window rain,  
Spring hues before my eyes, in dreams my love again.  
Why do the candle's tears in sorrow flow?  
Why do the blossoms grieve with spots of woe?  
My maid, too young and lazy to attend,  
Laughs and chats on, impatient for the quilt to mend.
s2tt_r:
原文：
狭小云卧任铺尘，
隔巷马耕听未真。
枕上清寒窗外雨，
眼前春色梦中人。
盈盈竹泪因谁泣，
点点花愁为我嗔。
自是小鬟娇懒惯，
慵侵不耐笑颜贫。

译文：
Narrow clouds lie still, dust spread wide,
In the next lane, horses plow, sound not real.
On the pillow, cold from the window rain,
In front, spring scenery, dreamlike person.
Glistening bamboo tears for whom to weep,
Flowers' sorrow for me to frown.
It's the little maid, always娇懒惯,
Laziness can't bear the poor smile.

asr: 山水横拖千里外，楼台高起五云中。园修日月光辉里，景夺文章造化功。
s2tt_r:
原文：
山水横拖千里外，
楼台高起五云中。
元修日月光辉里，
尽夺文章造化工。

译文：
Mountains and rivers stretch far and wide,
Towers rise high among the clouds.
In the radiance of the sun and moon,
All the splendor of creation is captured.

asr: 携锄秋圃自移来，篱畔庭前故故栽。昨夜不期经雨活，今朝犹喜带霜开。冷吟秋色诗千首，醉酹寒香酒一杯。泉溉泥封勤护惜，好知井径绝尘埃。
s2tt:
With hoe in hand, I moved them from the autumn field,
And by the fence and steps I planted them with care.
Last night, revived by rain, they did not yield;
This morn, with frost, they bloom in chilly air.
In autumn hues, I chant a thousand verses cold;
To fragrant blooms, I pour a cup of wine.
With spring-fed soil, I tend them as of old,
Far from the dusty world, they purely shine.
s2tt_r:
原文：
斜除秋圃自移来，
篱畔庭前故故栽。
昨夜不期经雨活，
今朝有喜待霜开。
冷吟秋色诗千首，
醉泪含香酒一杯。
泉盖凝风晴护膝，
好枝紧净绝尘埃。

译文：
From the autumn garden, I plucked and moved,
Planted by the fence, by the courtyard, deliberately.
Last night, without warning, it rained and revived,
Today, with joy, it awaits the frost to open.
A thousand poems of autumn colors I chant,
A cup of wine, tears mingled with the fragrance.
The wind covers the spring, the clear sky guards the knee,
Good branches are tightly cleaned, free from dust and dirt.

asr: 洞房环佩冷，玉殿起秋风。秦地应新月，龙池满旧宫。系舟今夜远，清漏往时同。万里黄山北，园陵白露中。
s2tt_r:
原文：
洞房淮佩冷，玉殿起秋风。
琴地莺新月，龙池满旧宫。
系舟今夜远，清漏望时同。
万里黄山北，园林白露中。

译文：
Cold in the jade palace, autumn wind rises.
Lingering moon on the lute, old palace filled with dragon pool.
Boat tied far tonight, clear drops of water at the same time.
Ten thousand miles north of the Yellow Mountain, gardens in the white dew.
